1773 int popup_max_height_in_items = -1;
1774 if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightRegular) popup_max_height_in_items = 8;
1775 else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightSmall) popup_max_height_in_items = 4;
1776 else if (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLarge) popup_max_height_in_items = 20;
1777 ImVec2 constraint_min(0.0f, 0.0f), constraint_max(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
1778 if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize) == 0 || g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x <= 0.0f) // Don't apply constraints if user specified a size
1779 constraint_min.x = w;
1780 if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize) == 0 || g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y <= 0.0f)
1781 constraint_max.y = CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items);
1782 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(constraint_min, constraint_max);
1783 }
1784
1785 // This is essentially a specialized version of BeginPopupEx()
1786 char name[16];
1787 ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Combo_%02d", g.BeginComboDepth); // Recycle windows based on depth
1788
1789 // Set position given a custom constraint (peak into expected window size so we can position it)
1790 // FIXME: This might be easier to express with an hypothetical SetNextWindowPosConstraints() function?
1791 // FIXME: This might be moved to Begin() or at least around the same spot where Tooltips and other Popups are calling FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx()?
1792 if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = FindWindowByName(name))
1793 if (popup_window->WasActive)
1794 {
1795 // Always override 'AutoPosLastDirection' to not leave a chance for a past value to affect us.
1796 ImVec2 size_expected = CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(popup_window);
1797 popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection = (flags & ImGuiComboFlags_PopupAlignLeft) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Down; // Left = "Below, Toward Left", Down = "Below, Toward Right (default)"
1798 ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(popup_window);
1799 ImVec2 pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(bb.GetBL(), size_expected, &popup_window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, bb, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox);
1800 SetNextWindowPos(pos);
1801 }
1802
1803 // We don't use BeginPopupEx() solely because we have a custom name string, which we could make an argument to BeginPopupEx()
1804 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
1805 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(g.Style.FramePadding.x, g.Style.WindowPadding.y)); // Horizontally align ourselves with the framed text
1806 bool ret = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
1807 PopStyleVar();
1808 if (!ret)
1809 {
1810 EndPopup();
1811 IM_ASSERT(0); // This should never happen as we tested for IsPopupOpen() above
1812 return false;
1813 }
1814 g.BeginComboDepth++;
1815 return true;
1816}
1817
1818void ImGui::EndCombo()
1819{
1820 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1821 EndPopup();
1822 g.BeginComboDepth--;
1823}
1824
1825// Call directly after the BeginCombo/EndCombo block. The preview is designed to only host non-interactive elements
1826// (Experimental, see GitHub issues: #1658, #4168)
1827bool ImGui::BeginComboPreview()
1828{
1829 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1830 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
1831 ImGuiComboPreviewData* preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
1832
1833 if (window->SkipItems || !(g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible))
1834 return false;
1835 IM_ASSERT(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.x && g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y == preview_data->PreviewRect.Min.y); // Didn't call after BeginCombo/EndCombo block or forgot to pass ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview flag?
1836 if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(preview_data->PreviewRect)) // Narrower test (optional)
1837 return false;
1838
1839 // FIXME: This could be contained in a PushWorkRect() api
1840 preview_data->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1841 preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
1842 preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine;
1843 preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
1844 preview_data->BackupLayout = window->DC.LayoutType;
1845 window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->PreviewRect.Min + g.Style.FramePadding;
1846 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
1847 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
1848 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
1849 PushClipRect(preview_data->PreviewRect.Min, preview_data->PreviewRect.Max, true);
1850
1851 return true;
1852}
1853
1854void ImGui::EndComboPreview()
1855{
1856 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1857 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
1858 ImGuiComboPreviewData* preview_data = &g.ComboPreviewData;
1859
1860 // FIXME: Using CursorMaxPos approximation instead of correct AABB which we will store in ImDrawCmd in the future
1861 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->DrawList;
1862 if (window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.x && window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y < preview_data->PreviewRect.Max.y)
1863 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size > 1) // Unlikely case that the PushClipRect() didn't create a command
1864 {
1865 draw_list->_CmdHeader.ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 1].ClipRect = draw_list->CmdBuffer[draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size - 2].ClipRect;
1866 draw_list->_TryMergeDrawCmds();
1867 }
1868 PopClipRect();
1869 window->DC.CursorPos = preview_data->BackupCursorPos;
1870 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, preview_data->BackupCursorMaxPos);
1871 window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = preview_data->BackupCursorPosPrevLine;
1872 window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = preview_data->BackupPrevLineTextBaseOffset;
1873 window->DC.LayoutType = preview_data->BackupLayout;
1874 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
1875 preview_data->PreviewRect = ImRect();
1876}
1877
1878// Getter for the old Combo() API: const char*[]
1879static const char* Items_ArrayGetter(void* data, int idx)
1880{
1881 const char* const* items = (const char* const*)data;
1882 return items[idx];
1883}
1884
1885// Getter for the old Combo() API: "item1\0item2\0item3\0"
1886static const char* Items_SingleStringGetter(void* data, int idx)
1887{
1888 const char* items_separated_by_zeros = (const char*)data;
1889 int items_count = 0;
1890 const char* p = items_separated_by_zeros;
1891 while (*p)
1892 {
1893 if (idx == items_count)
1894 break;
1895 p += strlen(p) + 1;
1896 items_count++;
1897 }
1898 return *p ? p : NULL;
1899}
1900
1901// Old API, prefer using BeginCombo() nowadays if you can.
1902bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items)
1903{
1904 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
1905
1906 // Call the getter to obtain the preview string which is a parameter to BeginCombo()
1907 const char* preview_value = NULL;
1908 if (*current_item >= 0 && *current_item < items_count)
1909 preview_value = getter(user_data, *current_item);
1910
1911 // The old Combo() API exposed "popup_max_height_in_items". The new more general BeginCombo() API doesn't have/need it, but we emulate it here.
1912 if (popup_max_height_in_items != -1 && !(g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint))
1913 SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, CalcMaxPopupHeightFromItemCount(popup_max_height_in_items)));
1914
1915 if (!BeginCombo(label, preview_value, ImGuiComboFlags_None))
1916 return false;
1917
1918 // Display items
1919 // FIXME-OPT: Use clipper (but we need to disable it on the appearing frame to make sure our call to SetItemDefaultFocus() is processed)
1920 bool value_changed = false;
1921 for (int i = 0; i < items_count; i++)
1922 {
1923 const char* item_text = getter(user_data, i);
1924 if (item_text == NULL)
1925 item_text = "*Unknown item*";
1926
1927 PushID(i);
1928 const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
1929 if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected) && *current_item != i)
1930 {
1931 value_changed = true;
1932 *current_item = i;
1933 }
1934 if (item_selected)
1935 SetItemDefaultFocus();
1936 PopID();
1937 }
1938
1939 EndCombo();
1940
1941 if (value_changed)
1942 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
1943
1944 return value_changed;
1945}
1946
1947// Combo box helper allowing to pass an array of strings.
1948bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_in_items)
1949{
1950 const bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void*)items, items_count, height_in_items);
1951 return value_changed;
1952}
1953
1954// Combo box helper allowing to pass all items in a single string literal holding multiple zero-terminated items "item1\0item2\0"
1955bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* items_separated_by_zeros, int height_in_items)
1956{
1957 int items_count = 0;
1958 const char* p = items_separated_by_zeros; // FIXME-OPT: Avoid computing this, or at least only when combo is open
1959 while (*p)
1960 {
1961 p += strlen(p) + 1;
1962 items_count++;
1963 }
1964 bool value_changed = Combo(label, current_item, Items_SingleStringGetter, (void*)items_separated_by_zeros, items_count, height_in_items);
1965 return value_changed;
1966}
1967
1968#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
1969
1970struct ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData { void* UserData; bool (*OldCallback)(void*, int, const char**); };
1971static const char* ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback(void* user_data, int idx)
1972{
1973 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData* data = (ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData*)user_data;
1974 const char* s = NULL;
1975 data->OldCallback(data->UserData, idx, &s);
1976 return s;
1977}
1978
1979bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, bool (*old_getter)(void*, int, const char**), void* user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items)
1980{
1981 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData old_to_new_data = { user_data, old_getter };
1982 return ListBox(label, current_item, ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback, &old_to_new_data, items_count, height_in_items);
1983}
1984bool ImGui::Combo(const char* label, int* current_item, bool (*old_getter)(void*, int, const char**), void* user_data, int items_count, int popup_max_height_in_items)
1985{
1986 ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallbackData old_to_new_data = { user_data, old_getter };
1987 return Combo(label, current_item, ImGuiGetNameFromIndexOldToNewCallback, &old_to_new_data, items_count, popup_max_height_in_items);
1988}
1989
1990#endif
1991
1992//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1993// [SECTION] Data Type and Data Formatting Helpers [Internal]
1994//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1995// - DataTypeGetInfo()
1996// - DataTypeFormatString()
1997// - DataTypeApplyOp()
1998// - DataTypeApplyFromText()
1999// - DataTypeCompare()
2000// - DataTypeClamp()
2001// - GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision
2002// - RoundScalarWithFormat<>()
2003//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2004
2005static const ImGuiDataTypeInfo GDataTypeInfo[] =
2006{
2007 { sizeof(char), "S8", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S8
2008 { sizeof(unsigned char), "U8", "%u", "%u" },
2009 { sizeof(short), "S16", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S16
2010 { sizeof(unsigned short), "U16", "%u", "%u" },
2011 { sizeof(int), "S32", "%d", "%d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S32
2012 { sizeof(unsigned int), "U32", "%u", "%u" },
2013#ifdef _MSC_VER
2014 { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%I64d","%I64d" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
2015 { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%I64u","%I64u" },
2016#else
2017 { sizeof(ImS64), "S64", "%lld", "%lld" }, // ImGuiDataType_S64
2018 { sizeof(ImU64), "U64", "%llu", "%llu" },
2019#endif
2020 { sizeof(float), "float", "%.3f","%f" }, // ImGuiDataType_Float (float are promoted to double in va_arg)
2021 { sizeof(double), "double","%f", "%lf" }, // ImGuiDataType_Double
2022};
2023IM_STATIC_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(GDataTypeInfo) == ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
2024
2025const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* ImGui::DataTypeGetInfo(ImGuiDataType data_type)
2026{
2027 IM_ASSERT(data_type >= 0 && data_type < ImGuiDataType_COUNT);
2028 return &GDataTypeInfo[data_type];
2029}
2030
2031int ImGui::DataTypeFormatString(char* buf, int buf_size, ImGuiDataType data_type, const void* p_data, const char* format)
2032{
2033 // Signedness doesn't matter when pushing integer arguments
2034 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S32 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U32)
2035 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU32*)p_data);
2036 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S64 || data_type == ImGuiDataType_U64)
2037 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU64*)p_data);
2038 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float)
2039 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const float*)p_data);
2040 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2041 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const double*)p_data);
2042 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
2043 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS8*)p_data);
2044 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
2045 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU8*)p_data);
2046 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
2047 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImS16*)p_data);
2048 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
2049 return ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, format, *(const ImU16*)p_data);
2050 IM_ASSERT(0);
2051 return 0;
2052}
2053
2054void ImGui::DataTypeApplyOp(ImGuiDataType data_type, int op, void* output, const void* arg1, const void* arg2)
2055{
2056 IM_ASSERT(op == '+' || op == '-');
2057 switch (data_type)
2058 {
2059 case ImGuiDataType_S8:
2060 if (op == '+') { *(ImS8*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS8*)arg1, *(const ImS8*)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX); }
2061 if (op == '-') { *(ImS8*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS8*)arg1, *(const ImS8*)arg2, IM_S8_MIN, IM_S8_MAX); }
2062 return;
2063 case ImGuiDataType_U8:
2064 if (op == '+') { *(ImU8*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU8*)arg1, *(const ImU8*)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX); }
2065 if (op == '-') { *(ImU8*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU8*)arg1, *(const ImU8*)arg2, IM_U8_MIN, IM_U8_MAX); }
2066 return;
2067 case ImGuiDataType_S16:
2068 if (op == '+') { *(ImS16*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS16*)arg1, *(const ImS16*)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX); }
2069 if (op == '-') { *(ImS16*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS16*)arg1, *(const ImS16*)arg2, IM_S16_MIN, IM_S16_MAX); }
2070 return;
2071 case ImGuiDataType_U16:
2072 if (op == '+') { *(ImU16*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU16*)arg1, *(const ImU16*)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX); }
2073 if (op == '-') { *(ImU16*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU16*)arg1, *(const ImU16*)arg2, IM_U16_MIN, IM_U16_MAX); }
2074 return;
2075 case ImGuiDataType_S32:
2076 if (op == '+') { *(ImS32*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS32*)arg1, *(const ImS32*)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX); }
2077 if (op == '-') { *(ImS32*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS32*)arg1, *(const ImS32*)arg2, IM_S32_MIN, IM_S32_MAX); }
2078 return;
2079 case ImGuiDataType_U32:
2080 if (op == '+') { *(ImU32*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU32*)arg1, *(const ImU32*)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX); }
2081 if (op == '-') { *(ImU32*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU32*)arg1, *(const ImU32*)arg2, IM_U32_MIN, IM_U32_MAX); }
2082 return;
2083 case ImGuiDataType_S64:
2084 if (op == '+') { *(ImS64*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImS64*)arg1, *(const ImS64*)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX); }
2085 if (op == '-') { *(ImS64*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImS64*)arg1, *(const ImS64*)arg2, IM_S64_MIN, IM_S64_MAX); }
2086 return;
2087 case ImGuiDataType_U64:
2088 if (op == '+') { *(ImU64*)output = ImAddClampOverflow(*(const ImU64*)arg1, *(const ImU64*)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX); }
2089 if (op == '-') { *(ImU64*)output = ImSubClampOverflow(*(const ImU64*)arg1, *(const ImU64*)arg2, IM_U64_MIN, IM_U64_MAX); }
2090 return;
2091 case ImGuiDataType_Float:
2092 if (op == '+') { *(float*)output = *(const float*)arg1 + *(const float*)arg2; }
2093 if (op == '-') { *(float*)output = *(const float*)arg1 - *(const float*)arg2; }
2094 return;
2095 case ImGuiDataType_Double:
2096 if (op == '+') { *(double*)output = *(const double*)arg1 + *(const double*)arg2; }
2097 if (op == '-') { *(double*)output = *(const double*)arg1 - *(const double*)arg2; }
2098 return;
2099 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2100 }
2101 IM_ASSERT(0);
2102}
2103
2104// User can input math operators (e.g. +100) to edit a numerical values.
2105// NB: This is _not_ a full expression evaluator. We should probably add one and replace this dumb mess..
2106bool ImGui::DataTypeApplyFromText(const char* buf, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const char* format)
2107{
2108 while (ImCharIsBlankA(*buf))
2109 buf++;
2110 if (!buf[0])
2111 return false;
2112
2113 // Copy the value in an opaque buffer so we can compare at the end of the function if it changed at all.
2114 const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* type_info = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type);
2115 ImGuiDataTypeTempStorage data_backup;
2116 memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size);
2117
2118 // Sanitize format
2119 // - For float/double we have to ignore format with precision (e.g. "%.2f") because sscanf doesn't take them in, so force them into %f and %lf
2120 // - In theory could treat empty format as using default, but this would only cover rare/bizarre case of using InputScalar() + integer + format string without %.
2121 char format_sanitized[32];
2122 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double)
2123 format = type_info->ScanFmt;
2124 else
2125 format = ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning(format, format_sanitized, IM_ARRAYSIZE(format_sanitized));
2126
2127 // Small types need a 32-bit buffer to receive the result from scanf()
2128 int v32 = 0;
2129 if (sscanf(buf, format, type_info->Size >= 4 ? p_data : &v32) < 1)
2130 return false;
2131 if (type_info->Size < 4)
2132 {
2133 if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S8)
2134 *(ImS8*)p_data = (ImS8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S8_MIN, (int)IM_S8_MAX);
2135 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U8)
2136 *(ImU8*)p_data = (ImU8)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U8_MIN, (int)IM_U8_MAX);
2137 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_S16)
2138 *(ImS16*)p_data = (ImS16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_S16_MIN, (int)IM_S16_MAX);
2139 else if (data_type == ImGuiDataType_U16)
2140 *(ImU16*)p_data = (ImU16)ImClamp(v32, (int)IM_U16_MIN, (int)IM_U16_MAX);
2141 else
2142 IM_ASSERT(0);
2143 }
2144
2145 return memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, type_info->Size) != 0;
2146}
2147
2148template<typename T>
2149static int DataTypeCompareT(const T* lhs, const T* rhs)
2150{
2151 if (*lhs < *rhs) return -1;
2152 if (*lhs > *rhs) return +1;
2153 return 0;
2154}
2155
2156int ImGui::DataTypeCompare(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void* arg_1, const void* arg_2)
2157{
2158 switch (data_type)
2159 {
2160 case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS8 >((const ImS8* )arg_1, (const ImS8* )arg_2);
2161 case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU8 >((const ImU8* )arg_1, (const ImU8* )arg_2);
2162 case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS16 >((const ImS16* )arg_1, (const ImS16* )arg_2);
2163 case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU16 >((const ImU16* )arg_1, (const ImU16* )arg_2);
2164 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS32 >((const ImS32* )arg_1, (const ImS32* )arg_2);
2165 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU32 >((const ImU32* )arg_1, (const ImU32* )arg_2);
2166 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImS64 >((const ImS64* )arg_1, (const ImS64* )arg_2);
2167 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeCompareT<ImU64 >((const ImU64* )arg_1, (const ImU64* )arg_2);
2168 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeCompareT<float >((const float* )arg_1, (const float* )arg_2);
2169 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeCompareT<double>((const double*)arg_1, (const double*)arg_2);
2170 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2171 }
2172 IM_ASSERT(0);
2173 return 0;
2174}
2175
2176template<typename T>
2177static bool DataTypeClampT(T* v, const T* v_min, const T* v_max)
2178{
2179 // Clamp, both sides are optional, return true if modified
2180 if (v_min && *v < *v_min) { *v = *v_min; return true; }
2181 if (v_max && *v > *v_max) { *v = *v_max; return true; }
2182 return false;
2183}
2184
2185bool ImGui::DataTypeClamp(ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max)
2186{
2187 switch (data_type)
2188 {
2189 case ImGuiDataType_S8: return DataTypeClampT<ImS8 >((ImS8* )p_data, (const ImS8* )p_min, (const ImS8* )p_max);
2190 case ImGuiDataType_U8: return DataTypeClampT<ImU8 >((ImU8* )p_data, (const ImU8* )p_min, (const ImU8* )p_max);
2191 case ImGuiDataType_S16: return DataTypeClampT<ImS16 >((ImS16* )p_data, (const ImS16* )p_min, (const ImS16* )p_max);
2192 case ImGuiDataType_U16: return DataTypeClampT<ImU16 >((ImU16* )p_data, (const ImU16* )p_min, (const ImU16* )p_max);
2193 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DataTypeClampT<ImS32 >((ImS32* )p_data, (const ImS32* )p_min, (const ImS32* )p_max);
2194 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DataTypeClampT<ImU32 >((ImU32* )p_data, (const ImU32* )p_min, (const ImU32* )p_max);
2195 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DataTypeClampT<ImS64 >((ImS64* )p_data, (const ImS64* )p_min, (const ImS64* )p_max);
2196 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DataTypeClampT<ImU64 >((ImU64* )p_data, (const ImU64* )p_min, (const ImU64* )p_max);
2197 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DataTypeClampT<float >((float* )p_data, (const float* )p_min, (const float* )p_max);
2198 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DataTypeClampT<double>((double*)p_data, (const double*)p_min, (const double*)p_max);
2199 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2200 }
2201 IM_ASSERT(0);
2202 return false;
2203}
2204
2205static float GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(int decimal_precision)
2206{
2207 static const float min_steps[10] = { 1.0f, 0.1f, 0.01f, 0.001f, 0.0001f, 0.00001f, 0.000001f, 0.0000001f, 0.00000001f, 0.000000001f };
2208 if (decimal_precision < 0)
2209 return FLT_MIN;
2210 return (decimal_precision < IM_ARRAYSIZE(min_steps)) ? min_steps[decimal_precision] : ImPow(10.0f, (float)-decimal_precision);
2211}
2212
2213template<typename TYPE>
2214TYPE ImGui::RoundScalarWithFormatT(const char* format, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v)
2215{
2216 IM_UNUSED(data_type);
2217 IM_ASSERT(data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float || data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2218 const char* fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(format);
2219 if (fmt_start[0] != '%' || fmt_start[1] == '%') // Don't apply if the value is not visible in the format string
2220 return v;
2221
2222 // Sanitize format
2223 char fmt_sanitized[32];
2224 ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting(fmt_start, fmt_sanitized, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_sanitized));
2225 fmt_start = fmt_sanitized;
2226
2227 // Format value with our rounding, and read back
2228 char v_str[64];
2229 ImFormatString(v_str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(v_str), fmt_start, v);
2230 const char* p = v_str;
2231 while (*p == ' ')
2232 p++;
2233 v = (TYPE)ImAtof(p);
2234
2235 return v;
2236}
2237
2238//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2239// [SECTION] Widgets: DragScalar, DragFloat, DragInt, etc.
2240//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2241// - DragBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2242// - DragBehavior() [Internal]
2243// - DragScalar()
2244// - DragScalarN()
2245// - DragFloat()
2246// - DragFloat2()
2247// - DragFloat3()
2248// - DragFloat4()
2249// - DragFloatRange2()
2250// - DragInt()
2251// - DragInt2()
2252// - DragInt3()
2253// - DragInt4()
2254// - DragIntRange2()
2255//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2256
2257// This is called by DragBehavior() when the widget is active (held by mouse or being manipulated with Nav controls)
2258template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2259bool ImGui::DragBehaviorT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE* v, float v_speed, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2260{
2261 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2262 const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
2263 const bool is_clamped = (v_min < v_max);
2264 const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
2265 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2266
2267 // Default tweak speed
2268 if (v_speed == 0.0f && is_clamped && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX))
2269 v_speed = (float)((v_max - v_min) * g.DragSpeedDefaultRatio);
2270
2271 // Inputs accumulates into g.DragCurrentAccum, which is flushed into the current value as soon as it makes a difference with our precision settings
2272 float adjust_delta = 0.0f;
2273 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && IsMousePosValid() && IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2274 {
2275 adjust_delta = g.IO.MouseDelta[axis];
2276 if (g.IO.KeyAlt)
2277 adjust_delta *= 1.0f / 100.0f;
2278 if (g.IO.KeyShift)
2279 adjust_delta *= 10.0f;
2280 }
2281 else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
2282 {
2283 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
2284 const bool tweak_slow = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakSlow);
2285 const bool tweak_fast = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakFast);
2286 const float tweak_factor = tweak_slow ? 1.0f / 1.0f : tweak_fast ? 10.0f : 1.0f;
2287 adjust_delta = GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis) * tweak_factor;
2288 v_speed = ImMax(v_speed, GetMinimumStepAtDecimalPrecision(decimal_precision));
2289 }
2290 adjust_delta *= v_speed;
2291
2292 // For vertical drag we currently assume that Up=higher value (like we do with vertical sliders). This may become a parameter.
2293 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2294 adjust_delta = -adjust_delta;
2295
2296 // For logarithmic use our range is effectively 0..1 so scale the delta into that range
2297 if (is_logarithmic && (v_max - v_min < FLT_MAX) && ((v_max - v_min) > 0.000001f)) // Epsilon to avoid /0
2298 adjust_delta /= (float)(v_max - v_min);
2299
2300 // Clear current value on activation
2301 // Avoid altering values and clamping when we are _already_ past the limits and heading in the same direction, so e.g. if range is 0..255, current value is 300 and we are pushing to the right side, keep the 300.
2302 bool is_just_activated = g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated;
2303 bool is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward = is_clamped && ((*v >= v_max && adjust_delta > 0.0f) || (*v <= v_min && adjust_delta < 0.0f));
2304 if (is_just_activated || is_already_past_limits_and_pushing_outward)
2305 {
2306 g.DragCurrentAccum = 0.0f;
2307 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2308 }
2309 else if (adjust_delta != 0.0f)
2310 {
2311 g.DragCurrentAccum += adjust_delta;
2312 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = true;
2313 }
2314
2315 if (!g.DragCurrentAccumDirty)
2316 return false;
2317
2318 TYPE v_cur = *v;
2319 FLOATTYPE v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = (FLOATTYPE)0.0f;
2320
2321 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2322 const float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Drag widgets have no deadzone (as it doesn't make sense)
2323 if (is_logarithmic)
2324 {
2325 // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
2326 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
2327 logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
2328
2329 // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2330 float v_old_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2331 float v_new_parametric = v_old_parametric + g.DragCurrentAccum;
2332 v_cur = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new_parametric, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2333 v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder = v_old_parametric;
2334 }
2335 else
2336 {
2337 v_cur += (SIGNEDTYPE)g.DragCurrentAccum;
2338 }
2339
2340 // Round to user desired precision based on format string
2341 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
2342 v_cur = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_cur);
2343
2344 // Preserve remainder after rounding has been applied. This also allow slow tweaking of values.
2345 g.DragCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2346 if (is_logarithmic)
2347 {
2348 // Convert to parametric space, apply delta, convert back
2349 float v_new_parametric = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_cur, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2350 g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)(v_new_parametric - v_old_ref_for_accum_remainder);
2351 }
2352 else
2353 {
2354 g.DragCurrentAccum -= (float)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_cur - (SIGNEDTYPE)*v);
2355 }
2356
2357 // Lose zero sign for float/double
2358 if (v_cur == (TYPE)-0)
2359 v_cur = (TYPE)0;
2360
2361 // Clamp values (+ handle overflow/wrap-around for integer types)
2362 if (*v != v_cur && is_clamped)
2363 {
2364 if (v_cur < v_min || (v_cur > *v && adjust_delta < 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2365 v_cur = v_min;
2366 if (v_cur > v_max || (v_cur < *v && adjust_delta > 0.0f && !is_floating_point))
2367 v_cur = v_max;
2368 }
2369
2370 // Apply result
2371 if (*v == v_cur)
2372 return false;
2373 *v = v_cur;
2374 return true;
2375}
2376
2377bool ImGui::DragBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_v, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2378{
2379 // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
2380 IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flags! Has the 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
2381
2382 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2383 if (g.ActiveId == id)
2384 {
2385 // Those are the things we can do easily outside the DragBehaviorT<> template, saves code generation.
2386 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse && !g.IO.MouseDown[0])
2387 ClearActiveID();
2388 else if ((g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) && g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2389 ClearActiveID();
2390 }
2391 if (g.ActiveId != id)
2392 return false;
2393 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
2394 return false;
2395
2396 switch (data_type)
2397 {
2398 case ImGuiDataType_S8: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS8*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS8*) p_min : IM_S8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS8*)p_max : IM_S8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS8*)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r; }
2399 case ImGuiDataType_U8: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU8*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU8*) p_min : IM_U8_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU8*)p_max : IM_U8_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU8*)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r; }
2400 case ImGuiDataType_S16: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS16*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS16*)p_min : IM_S16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS16*)p_max : IM_S16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImS16*)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r; }
2401 case ImGuiDataType_U16: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU16*)p_v; bool r = DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU16*)p_min : IM_U16_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU16*)p_max : IM_U16_MAX, format, flags); if (r) *(ImU16*)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r; }
2402 case ImGuiDataType_S32: return DragBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImS32*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS32* )p_min : IM_S32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS32* )p_max : IM_S32_MAX, format, flags);
2403 case ImGuiDataType_U32: return DragBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(data_type, (ImU32*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU32* )p_min : IM_U32_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU32* )p_max : IM_U32_MAX, format, flags);
2404 case ImGuiDataType_S64: return DragBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImS64*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImS64* )p_min : IM_S64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImS64* )p_max : IM_S64_MAX, format, flags);
2405 case ImGuiDataType_U64: return DragBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(data_type, (ImU64*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const ImU64* )p_min : IM_U64_MIN, p_max ? *(const ImU64* )p_max : IM_U64_MAX, format, flags);
2406 case ImGuiDataType_Float: return DragBehaviorT<float, float, float >(data_type, (float*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const float* )p_min : -FLT_MAX, p_max ? *(const float* )p_max : FLT_MAX, format, flags);
2407 case ImGuiDataType_Double: return DragBehaviorT<double,double,double>(data_type, (double*)p_v, v_speed, p_min ? *(const double*)p_min : -DBL_MAX, p_max ? *(const double*)p_max : DBL_MAX, format, flags);
2408 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
2409 }
2410 IM_ASSERT(0);
2411 return false;
2412}
2413
2414// Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a Drag widget, p_min and p_max are optional.
2415// Read code of e.g. DragFloat(), DragInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
2416bool ImGui::DragScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2417{
2418 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2419 if (window->SkipItems)
2420 return false;
2421
2422 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2423 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
2424 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
2425 const float w = CalcItemWidth();
2426
2427 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
2428 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
2429 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
2430
2431 const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
2432 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
2433 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable : 0))
2434 return false;
2435
2436 // Default format string when passing NULL
2437 if (format == NULL)
2438 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
2439
2440 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.InFlags);
2441 bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
2442 if (!temp_input_is_active)
2443 {
2444 // Tabbing or CTRL-clicking on Drag turns it into an InputText
2445 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, id);
2446 const bool double_clicked = (hovered && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2 && TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id));
2447 const bool make_active = (clicked || double_clicked || g.NavActivateId == id);
2448 if (make_active && (clicked || double_clicked))
2449 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
2450 if (make_active && temp_input_allowed)
2451 if ((clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || double_clicked || (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput)))
2452 temp_input_is_active = true;
2453
2454 // (Optional) simple click (without moving) turns Drag into an InputText
2455 if (g.IO.ConfigDragClickToInputText && temp_input_allowed && !temp_input_is_active)
2456 if (g.ActiveId == id && hovered && g.IO.MouseReleased[0] && !IsMouseDragPastThreshold(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * DRAG_MOUSE_THRESHOLD_FACTOR))
2457 {
2458 g.NavActivateId = id;
2459 g.NavActivateFlags = ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput;
2460 temp_input_is_active = true;
2461 }
2462
2463 if (make_active && !temp_input_is_active)
2464 {
2465 SetActiveID(id, window);
2466 SetFocusID(id, window);
2467 FocusWindow(window);
2468 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
2469 }
2470 }
2471
2472 if (temp_input_is_active)
2473 {
2474 // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is set
2475 const bool is_clamp_input = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp) != 0 && (p_min == NULL || p_max == NULL || DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_min, p_max) < 0);
2476 return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, is_clamp_input ? p_min : NULL, is_clamp_input ? p_max : NULL);
2477 }
2478
2479 // Draw frame
2480 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
2481 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
2482 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
2483
2484 // Drag behavior
2485 const bool value_changed = DragBehavior(id, data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2486 if (value_changed)
2487 MarkItemEdited(id);
2488
2489 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
2490 char value_buf[64];
2491 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
2492 if (g.LogEnabled)
2493 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
2494 RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
2495
2496 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
2497 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
2498
2499 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable : 0));
2500 return value_changed;
2501}
2502
2503bool ImGui::DragScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, float v_speed, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2504{
2505 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2506 if (window->SkipItems)
2507 return false;
2508
2509 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2510 bool value_changed = false;
2511 BeginGroup();
2512 PushID(label);
2513 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
2514 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
2515 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
2516 {
2517 PushID(i);
2518 if (i > 0)
2519 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2520 value_changed |= DragScalar("", data_type, p_data, v_speed, p_min, p_max, format, flags);
2521 PopID();
2522 PopItemWidth();
2523 p_data = (void*)((char*)p_data + type_size);
2524 }
2525 PopID();
2526
2527 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
2528 if (label != label_end)
2529 {
2530 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2531 TextEx(label, label_end);
2532 }
2533
2534 EndGroup();
2535 return value_changed;
2536}
2537
2538bool ImGui::DragFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2539{
2540 return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2541}
2542
2543bool ImGui::DragFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2544{
2545 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2546}
2547
2548bool ImGui::DragFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2549{
2550 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2551}
2552
2553bool ImGui::DragFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2554{
2555 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2556}
2557
2558// NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2559bool ImGui::DragFloatRange2(const char* label, float* v_current_min, float* v_current_max, float v_speed, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, const char* format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2560{
2561 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2562 if (window->SkipItems)
2563 return false;
2564
2565 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2566 PushID(label);
2567 BeginGroup();
2568 PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2569
2570 float min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? -FLT_MAX : v_min;
2571 float min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2572 ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2573 bool value_changed = DragScalar("##min", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_min, v_speed, &min_min, &min_max, format, min_flags);
2574 PopItemWidth();
2575 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2576
2577 float max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2578 float max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? FLT_MAX : v_max;
2579 ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2580 value_changed |= DragScalar("##max", ImGuiDataType_Float, v_current_max, v_speed, &max_min, &max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2581 PopItemWidth();
2582 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2583
2584 TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2585 EndGroup();
2586 PopID();
2587
2588 return value_changed;
2589}
2590
2591// NB: v_speed is float to allow adjusting the drag speed with more precision
2592bool ImGui::DragInt(const char* label, int* v, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2593{
2594 return DragScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2595}
2596
2597bool ImGui::DragInt2(const char* label, int v[2], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2598{
2599 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2600}
2601
2602bool ImGui::DragInt3(const char* label, int v[3], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2603{
2604 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2605}
2606
2607bool ImGui::DragInt4(const char* label, int v[4], float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2608{
2609 return DragScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, v_speed, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
2610}
2611
2612// NB: You likely want to specify the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp when using this.
2613bool ImGui::DragIntRange2(const char* label, int* v_current_min, int* v_current_max, float v_speed, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, const char* format_max, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
2614{
2615 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
2616 if (window->SkipItems)
2617 return false;
2618
2619 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2620 PushID(label);
2621 BeginGroup();
2622 PushMultiItemsWidths(2, CalcItemWidth());
2623
2624 int min_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MIN : v_min;
2625 int min_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_max : ImMin(v_max, *v_current_max);
2626 ImGuiSliderFlags min_flags = flags | ((min_min == min_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2627 bool value_changed = DragInt("##min", v_current_min, v_speed, min_min, min_max, format, min_flags);
2628 PopItemWidth();
2629 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2630
2631 int max_min = (v_min >= v_max) ? *v_current_min : ImMax(v_min, *v_current_min);
2632 int max_max = (v_min >= v_max) ? INT_MAX : v_max;
2633 ImGuiSliderFlags max_flags = flags | ((max_min == max_max) ? ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly : 0);
2634 value_changed |= DragInt("##max", v_current_max, v_speed, max_min, max_max, format_max ? format_max : format, max_flags);
2635 PopItemWidth();
2636 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
2637
2638 TextEx(label, FindRenderedTextEnd(label));
2639 EndGroup();
2640 PopID();
2641
2642 return value_changed;
2643}
2644
2645//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2646// [SECTION] Widgets: SliderScalar, SliderFloat, SliderInt, etc.
2647//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2648// - ScaleRatioFromValueT<> [Internal]
2649// - ScaleValueFromRatioT<> [Internal]
2650// - SliderBehaviorT<>() [Internal]
2651// - SliderBehavior() [Internal]
2652// - SliderScalar()
2653// - SliderScalarN()
2654// - SliderFloat()
2655// - SliderFloat2()
2656// - SliderFloat3()
2657// - SliderFloat4()
2658// - SliderAngle()
2659// - SliderInt()
2660// - SliderInt2()
2661// - SliderInt3()
2662// - SliderInt4()
2663// - VSliderScalar()
2664// - VSliderFloat()
2665// - VSliderInt()
2666//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
2667
2668// Convert a value v in the output space of a slider into a parametric position on the slider itself (the logical opposite of ScaleValueFromRatioT)
2669template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2670float ImGui::ScaleRatioFromValueT(ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE v, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2671{
2672 if (v_min == v_max)
2673 return 0.0f;
2674 IM_UNUSED(data_type);
2675
2676 const TYPE v_clamped = (v_min < v_max) ? ImClamp(v, v_min, v_max) : ImClamp(v, v_max, v_min);
2677 if (is_logarithmic)
2678 {
2679 bool flipped = v_max < v_min;
2680
2681 if (flipped) // Handle the case where the range is backwards
2682 ImSwap(v_min, v_max);
2683
2684 // Fudge min/max to avoid getting close to log(0)
2685 FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
2686 FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
2687
2688 // Awkward special cases - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
2689 if ((v_min == 0.0f) && (v_max < 0.0f))
2690 v_min_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2691 else if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
2692 v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2693
2694 float result;
2695 if (v_clamped <= v_min_fudged)
2696 result = 0.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but below our fudge
2697 else if (v_clamped >= v_max_fudged)
2698 result = 1.0f; // Workaround for values that are in-range but above our fudge
2699 else if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so split into two portions
2700 {
2701 float zero_point_center = (-(float)v_min) / ((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space. There's an argument we should take the logarithmic nature into account when calculating this, but for now this should do (and the most common case of a symmetrical range works fine)
2702 float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2703 float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2704 if (v == 0.0f)
2705 result = zero_point_center; // Special case for exactly zero
2706 else if (v < 0.0f)
2707 result = (1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon))) * zero_point_snap_L;
2708 else
2709 result = zero_point_snap_R + ((float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / logarithmic_zero_epsilon) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon)) * (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R));
2710 }
2711 else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
2712 result = 1.0f - (float)(ImLog(-(FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / -v_max_fudged) / ImLog(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged));
2713 else
2714 result = (float)(ImLog((FLOATTYPE)v_clamped / v_min_fudged) / ImLog(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged));
2715
2716 return flipped ? (1.0f - result) : result;
2717 }
2718 else
2719 {
2720 // Linear slider
2721 return (float)((FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_clamped - v_min) / (FLOATTYPE)(SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min));
2722 }
2723}
2724
2725// Convert a parametric position on a slider into a value v in the output space (the logical opposite of ScaleRatioFromValueT)
2726template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2727TYPE ImGui::ScaleValueFromRatioT(ImGuiDataType data_type, float t, TYPE v_min, TYPE v_max, bool is_logarithmic, float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_halfsize)
2728{
2729 // We special-case the extents because otherwise our logarithmic fudging can lead to "mathematically correct"
2730 // but non-intuitive behaviors like a fully-left slider not actually reaching the minimum value. Also generally simpler.
2731 if (t <= 0.0f || v_min == v_max)
2732 return v_min;
2733 if (t >= 1.0f)
2734 return v_max;
2735
2736 TYPE result = (TYPE)0;
2737 if (is_logarithmic)
2738 {
2739 // Fudge min/max to avoid getting silly results close to zero
2740 FLOATTYPE v_min_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_min) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_min < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_min;
2741 FLOATTYPE v_max_fudged = (ImAbs((FLOATTYPE)v_max) < logarithmic_zero_epsilon) ? ((v_max < 0.0f) ? -logarithmic_zero_epsilon : logarithmic_zero_epsilon) : (FLOATTYPE)v_max;
2742
2743 const bool flipped = v_max < v_min; // Check if range is "backwards"
2744 if (flipped)
2745 ImSwap(v_min_fudged, v_max_fudged);
2746
2747 // Awkward special case - we need ranges of the form (-100 .. 0) to convert to (-100 .. -epsilon), not (-100 .. epsilon)
2748 if ((v_max == 0.0f) && (v_min < 0.0f))
2749 v_max_fudged = -logarithmic_zero_epsilon;
2750
2751 float t_with_flip = flipped ? (1.0f - t) : t; // t, but flipped if necessary to account for us flipping the range
2752
2753 if ((v_min * v_max) < 0.0f) // Range crosses zero, so we have to do this in two parts
2754 {
2755 float zero_point_center = (-(float)ImMin(v_min, v_max)) / ImAbs((float)v_max - (float)v_min); // The zero point in parametric space
2756 float zero_point_snap_L = zero_point_center - zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2757 float zero_point_snap_R = zero_point_center + zero_deadzone_halfsize;
2758 if (t_with_flip >= zero_point_snap_L && t_with_flip <= zero_point_snap_R)
2759 result = (TYPE)0.0f; // Special case to make getting exactly zero possible (the epsilon prevents it otherwise)
2760 else if (t_with_flip < zero_point_center)
2761 result = (TYPE)-(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - (t_with_flip / zero_point_snap_L))));
2762 else
2763 result = (TYPE)(logarithmic_zero_epsilon * ImPow(v_max_fudged / logarithmic_zero_epsilon, (FLOATTYPE)((t_with_flip - zero_point_snap_R) / (1.0f - zero_point_snap_R))));
2764 }
2765 else if ((v_min < 0.0f) || (v_max < 0.0f)) // Entirely negative slider
2766 result = (TYPE)-(-v_max_fudged * ImPow(-v_min_fudged / -v_max_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)(1.0f - t_with_flip)));
2767 else
2768 result = (TYPE)(v_min_fudged * ImPow(v_max_fudged / v_min_fudged, (FLOATTYPE)t_with_flip));
2769 }
2770 else
2771 {
2772 // Linear slider
2773 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2774 if (is_floating_point)
2775 {
2776 result = ImLerp(v_min, v_max, t);
2777 }
2778 else if (t < 1.0)
2779 {
2780 // - For integer values we want the clicking position to match the grab box so we round above
2781 // This code is carefully tuned to work with large values (e.g. high ranges of U64) while preserving this property..
2782 // - Not doing a *1.0 multiply at the end of a range as it tends to be lossy. While absolute aiming at a large s64/u64
2783 // range is going to be imprecise anyway, with this check we at least make the edge values matches expected limits.
2784 FLOATTYPE v_new_off_f = (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_max - v_min) * t;
2785 result = (TYPE)((SIGNEDTYPE)v_min + (SIGNEDTYPE)(v_new_off_f + (FLOATTYPE)(v_min > v_max ? -0.5 : 0.5)));
2786 }
2787 }
2788
2789 return result;
2790}
2791
2792// FIXME: Try to move more of the code into shared SliderBehavior()
2793template<typename TYPE, typename SIGNEDTYPE, typename FLOATTYPE>
2794bool ImGui::SliderBehaviorT(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, TYPE* v, const TYPE v_min, const TYPE v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect* out_grab_bb)
2795{
2796 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2797 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
2798
2799 const ImGuiAxis axis = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
2800 const bool is_logarithmic = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic) != 0;
2801 const bool is_floating_point = (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Float) || (data_type == ImGuiDataType_Double);
2802 const float v_range_f = (float)(v_min < v_max ? v_max - v_min : v_min - v_max); // We don't need high precision for what we do with it.
2803
2804 // Calculate bounds
2805 const float grab_padding = 2.0f; // FIXME: Should be part of style.
2806 const float slider_sz = (bb.Max[axis] - bb.Min[axis]) - grab_padding * 2.0f;
2807 float grab_sz = style.GrabMinSize;
2808 if (!is_floating_point && v_range_f >= 0.0f) // v_range_f < 0 may happen on integer overflows
2809 grab_sz = ImMax(slider_sz / (v_range_f + 1), style.GrabMinSize); // For integer sliders: if possible have the grab size represent 1 unit
2810 grab_sz = ImMin(grab_sz, slider_sz);
2811 const float slider_usable_sz = slider_sz - grab_sz;
2812 const float slider_usable_pos_min = bb.Min[axis] + grab_padding + grab_sz * 0.5f;
2813 const float slider_usable_pos_max = bb.Max[axis] - grab_padding - grab_sz * 0.5f;
2814
2815 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2816 float zero_deadzone_halfsize = 0.0f; // Only valid when is_logarithmic is true
2817 if (is_logarithmic)
2818 {
2819 // When using logarithmic sliders, we need to clamp to avoid hitting zero, but our choice of clamp value greatly affects slider precision. We attempt to use the specified precision to estimate a good lower bound.
2820 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 1;
2821 logarithmic_zero_epsilon = ImPow(0.1f, (float)decimal_precision);
2822 zero_deadzone_halfsize = (style.LogSliderDeadzone * 0.5f) / ImMax(slider_usable_sz, 1.0f);
2823 }
2824
2825 // Process interacting with the slider
2826 bool value_changed = false;
2827 if (g.ActiveId == id)
2828 {
2829 bool set_new_value = false;
2830 float clicked_t = 0.0f;
2831 if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Mouse)
2832 {
2833 if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
2834 {
2835 ClearActiveID();
2836 }
2837 else
2838 {
2839 const float mouse_abs_pos = g.IO.MousePos[axis];
2840 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2841 {
2842 float grab_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2843 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2844 grab_t = 1.0f - grab_t;
2845 const float grab_pos = ImLerp(slider_usable_pos_min, slider_usable_pos_max, grab_t);
2846 const bool clicked_around_grab = (mouse_abs_pos >= grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f - 1.0f) && (mouse_abs_pos <= grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f + 1.0f); // No harm being extra generous here.
2847 g.SliderGrabClickOffset = (clicked_around_grab && is_floating_point) ? mouse_abs_pos - grab_pos : 0.0f;
2848 }
2849 if (slider_usable_sz > 0.0f)
2850 clicked_t = ImSaturate((mouse_abs_pos - g.SliderGrabClickOffset - slider_usable_pos_min) / slider_usable_sz);
2851 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2852 clicked_t = 1.0f - clicked_t;
2853 set_new_value = true;
2854 }
2855 }
2856 else if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
2857 {
2858 if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2859 {
2860 g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // Reset any stored nav delta upon activation
2861 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2862 }
2863
2864 float input_delta = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis) : -GetNavTweakPressedAmount(axis);
2865 if (input_delta != 0.0f)
2866 {
2867 const bool tweak_slow = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakSlow);
2868 const bool tweak_fast = IsKeyDown((g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad) ? ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast : ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakFast);
2869 const int decimal_precision = is_floating_point ? ImParseFormatPrecision(format, 3) : 0;
2870 if (decimal_precision > 0)
2871 {
2872 input_delta /= 100.0f; // Gamepad/keyboard tweak speeds in % of slider bounds
2873 if (tweak_slow)
2874 input_delta /= 10.0f;
2875 }
2876 else
2877 {
2878 if ((v_range_f >= -100.0f && v_range_f <= 100.0f && v_range_f != 0.0f) || tweak_slow)
2879 input_delta = ((input_delta < 0.0f) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) / v_range_f; // Gamepad/keyboard tweak speeds in integer steps
2880 else
2881 input_delta /= 100.0f;
2882 }
2883 if (tweak_fast)
2884 input_delta *= 10.0f;
2885
2886 g.SliderCurrentAccum += input_delta;
2887 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = true;
2888 }
2889
2890 float delta = g.SliderCurrentAccum;
2891 if (g.NavActivatePressedId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2892 {
2893 ClearActiveID();
2894 }
2895 else if (g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty)
2896 {
2897 clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2898
2899 if ((clicked_t >= 1.0f && delta > 0.0f) || (clicked_t <= 0.0f && delta < 0.0f)) // This is to avoid applying the saturation when already past the limits
2900 {
2901 set_new_value = false;
2902 g.SliderCurrentAccum = 0.0f; // If pushing up against the limits, don't continue to accumulate
2903 }
2904 else
2905 {
2906 set_new_value = true;
2907 float old_clicked_t = clicked_t;
2908 clicked_t = ImSaturate(clicked_t + delta);
2909
2910 // Calculate what our "new" clicked_t will be, and thus how far we actually moved the slider, and subtract this from the accumulator
2911 TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2912 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
2913 v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
2914 float new_clicked_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, v_new, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2915
2916 if (delta > 0)
2917 g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMin(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
2918 else
2919 g.SliderCurrentAccum -= ImMax(new_clicked_t - old_clicked_t, delta);
2920 }
2921
2922 g.SliderCurrentAccumDirty = false;
2923 }
2924 }
2925
2926 if (set_new_value)
2927 if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly))
2928 set_new_value = false;
2929
2930 if (set_new_value)
2931 {
2932 TYPE v_new = ScaleValueFromRatioT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, clicked_t, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2933
2934 // Round to user desired precision based on format string
2935 if (is_floating_point && !(flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat))
2936 v_new = RoundScalarWithFormatT<TYPE>(format, data_type, v_new);
2937
2938 // Apply result
2939 if (*v != v_new)
2940 {
2941 *v = v_new;
2942 value_changed = true;
2943 }
2944 }
2945 }
2946
2947 if (slider_sz < 1.0f)
2948 {
2949 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min, bb.Min);
2950 }
2951 else
2952 {
2953 // Output grab position so it can be displayed by the caller
2954 float grab_t = ScaleRatioFromValueT<TYPE, SIGNEDTYPE, FLOATTYPE>(data_type, *v, v_min, v_max, is_logarithmic, logarithmic_zero_epsilon, zero_deadzone_halfsize);
2955 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_Y)
2956 grab_t = 1.0f - grab_t;
2957 const float grab_pos = ImLerp(slider_usable_pos_min, slider_usable_pos_max, grab_t);
2958 if (axis == ImGuiAxis_X)
2959 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Min.y + grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.y - grab_padding);
2960 else
2961 *out_grab_bb = ImRect(bb.Min.x + grab_padding, grab_pos - grab_sz * 0.5f, bb.Max.x - grab_padding, grab_pos + grab_sz * 0.5f);
2962 }
2963
2964 return value_changed;
2965}
2966
2967// For 32-bit and larger types, slider bounds are limited to half the natural type range.
2968// So e.g. an integer Slider between INT_MAX-10 and INT_MAX will fail, but an integer Slider between INT_MAX/2-10 and INT_MAX/2 will be ok.
2969// It would be possible to lift that limitation with some work but it doesn't seem to be worth it for sliders.
2970bool ImGui::SliderBehavior(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_v, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect* out_grab_bb)
2971{
2972 // Read imgui.cpp "API BREAKING CHANGES" section for 1.78 if you hit this assert.
2973 IM_ASSERT((flags == 1 || (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_InvalidMask_) == 0) && "Invalid ImGuiSliderFlags flag! Has the 'float power' argument been mistakenly cast to flags? Call function with ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic flags instead.");
2974
2975 switch (data_type)
2976 {
2977 case ImGuiDataType_S8: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS8*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS8*)p_min, *(const ImS8*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS8*)p_v = (ImS8)v32; return r; }
2978 case ImGuiDataType_U8: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU8*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU8*)p_min, *(const ImU8*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU8*)p_v = (ImU8)v32; return r; }
2979 case ImGuiDataType_S16: { ImS32 v32 = (ImS32)*(ImS16*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_S32, &v32, *(const ImS16*)p_min, *(const ImS16*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImS16*)p_v = (ImS16)v32; return r; }
2980 case ImGuiDataType_U16: { ImU32 v32 = (ImU32)*(ImU16*)p_v; bool r = SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float>(bb, id, ImGuiDataType_U32, &v32, *(const ImU16*)p_min, *(const ImU16*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb); if (r) *(ImU16*)p_v = (ImU16)v32; return r; }
2981 case ImGuiDataType_S32:
2982 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS32*)p_min >= IM_S32_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS32*)p_max <= IM_S32_MAX / 2);
2983 return SliderBehaviorT<ImS32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImS32*)p_v, *(const ImS32*)p_min, *(const ImS32*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2984 case ImGuiDataType_U32:
2985 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU32*)p_max <= IM_U32_MAX / 2);
2986 return SliderBehaviorT<ImU32, ImS32, float >(bb, id, data_type, (ImU32*)p_v, *(const ImU32*)p_min, *(const ImU32*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2987 case ImGuiDataType_S64:
2988 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImS64*)p_min >= IM_S64_MIN / 2 && *(const ImS64*)p_max <= IM_S64_MAX / 2);
2989 return SliderBehaviorT<ImS64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImS64*)p_v, *(const ImS64*)p_min, *(const ImS64*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2990 case ImGuiDataType_U64:
2991 IM_ASSERT(*(const ImU64*)p_max <= IM_U64_MAX / 2);
2992 return SliderBehaviorT<ImU64, ImS64, double>(bb, id, data_type, (ImU64*)p_v, *(const ImU64*)p_min, *(const ImU64*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2993 case ImGuiDataType_Float:
2994 IM_ASSERT(*(const float*)p_min >= -FLT_MAX / 2.0f && *(const float*)p_max <= FLT_MAX / 2.0f);
2995 return SliderBehaviorT<float, float, float >(bb, id, data_type, (float*)p_v, *(const float*)p_min, *(const float*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2996 case ImGuiDataType_Double:
2997 IM_ASSERT(*(const double*)p_min >= -DBL_MAX / 2.0f && *(const double*)p_max <= DBL_MAX / 2.0f);
2998 return SliderBehaviorT<double, double, double>(bb, id, data_type, (double*)p_v, *(const double*)p_min, *(const double*)p_max, format, flags, out_grab_bb);
2999 case ImGuiDataType_COUNT: break;
3000 }
3001 IM_ASSERT(0);
3002 return false;
3003}
3004
3005// Note: p_data, p_min and p_max are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For a slider, they are all required.
3006// Read code of e.g. SliderFloat(), SliderInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3007bool ImGui::SliderScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3008{
3009 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3010 if (window->SkipItems)
3011 return false;
3012
3013 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3014 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3015 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3016 const float w = CalcItemWidth();
3017
3018 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3019 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(w, label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
3020 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3021
3022 const bool temp_input_allowed = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput) == 0;
3023 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3024 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable : 0))
3025 return false;
3026
3027 // Default format string when passing NULL
3028 if (format == NULL)
3029 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3030
3031 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.InFlags);
3032 bool temp_input_is_active = temp_input_allowed && TempInputIsActive(id);
3033 if (!temp_input_is_active)
3034 {
3035 // Tabbing or CTRL-clicking on Slider turns it into an input box
3036 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, id);
3037 const bool make_active = (clicked || g.NavActivateId == id);
3038 if (make_active && clicked)
3039 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
3040 if (make_active && temp_input_allowed)
3041 if ((clicked && g.IO.KeyCtrl) || (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput)))
3042 temp_input_is_active = true;
3043
3044 if (make_active && !temp_input_is_active)
3045 {
3046 SetActiveID(id, window);
3047 SetFocusID(id, window);
3048 FocusWindow(window);
3049 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
3050 }
3051 }
3052
3053 if (temp_input_is_active)
3054 {
3055 // Only clamp CTRL+Click input when ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp is set
3056 const bool is_clamp_input = (flags & ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp) != 0;
3057 return TempInputScalar(frame_bb, id, label, data_type, p_data, format, is_clamp_input ? p_min : NULL, is_clamp_input ? p_max : NULL);
3058 }
3059
3060 // Draw frame
3061 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3062 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
3063 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3064
3065 // Slider behavior
3066 ImRect grab_bb;
3067 const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags, &grab_bb);
3068 if (value_changed)
3069 MarkItemEdited(id);
3070
3071 // Render grab
3072 if (grab_bb.Max.x > grab_bb.Min.x)
3073 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3074
3075 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3076 char value_buf[64];
3077 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3078 if (g.LogEnabled)
3079 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
3080 RenderTextClipped(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
3081
3082 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3083 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3084
3085 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (temp_input_allowed ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable : 0));
3086 return value_changed;
3087}
3088
3089// Add multiple sliders on 1 line for compact edition of multiple components
3090bool ImGui::SliderScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* v, int components, const void* v_min, const void* v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3091{
3092 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3093 if (window->SkipItems)
3094 return false;
3095
3096 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3097 bool value_changed = false;
3098 BeginGroup();
3099 PushID(label);
3100 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3101 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3102 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3103 {
3104 PushID(i);
3105 if (i > 0)
3106 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3107 value_changed |= SliderScalar("", data_type, v, v_min, v_max, format, flags);
3108 PopID();
3109 PopItemWidth();
3110 v = (void*)((char*)v + type_size);
3111 }
3112 PopID();
3113
3114 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3115 if (label != label_end)
3116 {
3117 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3118 TextEx(label, label_end);
3119 }
3120
3121 EndGroup();
3122 return value_changed;
3123}
3124
3125bool ImGui::SliderFloat(const char* label, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3126{
3127 return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3128}
3129
3130bool ImGui::SliderFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3131{
3132 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3133}
3134
3135bool ImGui::SliderFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3136{
3137 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3138}
3139
3140bool ImGui::SliderFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3141{
3142 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3143}
3144
3145bool ImGui::SliderAngle(const char* label, float* v_rad, float v_degrees_min, float v_degrees_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3146{
3147 if (format == NULL)
3148 format = "%.0f deg";
3149 float v_deg = (*v_rad) * 360.0f / (2 * IM_PI);
3150 bool value_changed = SliderFloat(label, &v_deg, v_degrees_min, v_degrees_max, format, flags);
3151 *v_rad = v_deg * (2 * IM_PI) / 360.0f;
3152 return value_changed;
3153}
3154
3155bool ImGui::SliderInt(const char* label, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3156{
3157 return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3158}
3159
3160bool ImGui::SliderInt2(const char* label, int v[2], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3161{
3162 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3163}
3164
3165bool ImGui::SliderInt3(const char* label, int v[3], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3166{
3167 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3168}
3169
3170bool ImGui::SliderInt4(const char* label, int v[4], int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3171{
3172 return SliderScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3173}
3174
3175bool ImGui::VSliderScalar(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_min, const void* p_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3176{
3177 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3178 if (window->SkipItems)
3179 return false;
3180
3181 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3182 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3183 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
3184
3185 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
3186 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
3187 const ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
3188
3189 ItemSize(bb, style.FramePadding.y);
3190 if (!ItemAdd(frame_bb, id))
3191 return false;
3192
3193 // Default format string when passing NULL
3194 if (format == NULL)
3195 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3196
3197 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.InFlags);
3198 const bool clicked = hovered && IsMouseClicked(0, id);
3199 if (clicked || g.NavActivateId == id)
3200 {
3201 if (clicked)
3202 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
3203 SetActiveID(id, window);
3204 SetFocusID(id, window);
3205 FocusWindow(window);
3206 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
3207 }
3208
3209 // Draw frame
3210 const ImU32 frame_col = GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered : ImGuiCol_FrameBg);
3211 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
3212 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, frame_col, true, g.Style.FrameRounding);
3213
3214 // Slider behavior
3215 ImRect grab_bb;
3216 const bool value_changed = SliderBehavior(frame_bb, id, data_type, p_data, p_min, p_max, format, flags | ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical, &grab_bb);
3217 if (value_changed)
3218 MarkItemEdited(id);
3219
3220 // Render grab
3221 if (grab_bb.Max.y > grab_bb.Min.y)
3222 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(grab_bb.Min, grab_bb.Max, GetColorU32(g.ActiveId == id ? ImGuiCol_SliderGrabActive : ImGuiCol_SliderGrab), style.GrabRounding);
3223
3224 // Display value using user-provided display format so user can add prefix/suffix/decorations to the value.
3225 // For the vertical slider we allow centered text to overlap the frame padding
3226 char value_buf[64];
3227 const char* value_buf_end = value_buf + DataTypeFormatString(value_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(value_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3228 RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, value_buf, value_buf_end, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
3229 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
3230 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
3231
3232 return value_changed;
3233}
3234
3235bool ImGui::VSliderFloat(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, float* v, float v_min, float v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3236{
3237 return VSliderScalar(label, size, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3238}
3239
3240bool ImGui::VSliderInt(const char* label, const ImVec2& size, int* v, int v_min, int v_max, const char* format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags)
3241{
3242 return VSliderScalar(label, size, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, &v_min, &v_max, format, flags);
3243}
3244
3245//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3246// [SECTION] Widgets: InputScalar, InputFloat, InputInt, etc.
3247//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3248// - ImParseFormatFindStart() [Internal]
3249// - ImParseFormatFindEnd() [Internal]
3250// - ImParseFormatTrimDecorations() [Internal]
3251// - ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting() [Internal]
3252// - ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning() [Internal]
3253// - ImParseFormatPrecision() [Internal]
3254// - TempInputTextScalar() [Internal]
3255// - InputScalar()
3256// - InputScalarN()
3257// - InputFloat()
3258// - InputFloat2()
3259// - InputFloat3()
3260// - InputFloat4()
3261// - InputInt()
3262// - InputInt2()
3263// - InputInt3()
3264// - InputInt4()
3265// - InputDouble()
3266//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3267
3268// We don't use strchr() because our strings are usually very short and often start with '%'
3269const char* ImParseFormatFindStart(const char* fmt)
3270{
3271 while (char c = fmt[0])
3272 {
3273 if (c == '%' && fmt[1] != '%')
3274 return fmt;
3275 else if (c == '%')
3276 fmt++;
3277 fmt++;
3278 }
3279 return fmt;
3280}
3281
3282const char* ImParseFormatFindEnd(const char* fmt)
3283{
3284 // Printf/scanf types modifiers: I/L/h/j/l/t/w/z. Other uppercase letters qualify as types aka end of the format.
3285 if (fmt[0] != '%')
3286 return fmt;
3287 const unsigned int ignored_uppercase_mask = (1 << ('I'-'A')) | (1 << ('L'-'A'));
3288 const unsigned int ignored_lowercase_mask = (1 << ('h'-'a')) | (1 << ('j'-'a')) | (1 << ('l'-'a')) | (1 << ('t'-'a')) | (1 << ('w'-'a')) | (1 << ('z'-'a'));
3289 for (char c; (c = *fmt) != 0; fmt++)
3290 {
3291 if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z' && ((1 << (c - 'A')) & ignored_uppercase_mask) == 0)
3292 return fmt + 1;
3293 if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z' && ((1 << (c - 'a')) & ignored_lowercase_mask) == 0)
3294 return fmt + 1;
3295 }
3296 return fmt;
3297}
3298
3299// Extract the format out of a format string with leading or trailing decorations
3300// fmt = "blah blah" -> return ""
3301// fmt = "%.3f" -> return fmt
3302// fmt = "hello %.3f" -> return fmt + 6
3303// fmt = "%.3f hello" -> return buf written with "%.3f"
3304const char* ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(const char* fmt, char* buf, size_t buf_size)
3305{
3306 const char* fmt_start = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3307 if (fmt_start[0] != '%')
3308 return "";
3309 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_start);
3310 if (fmt_end[0] == 0) // If we only have leading decoration, we don't need to copy the data.
3311 return fmt_start;
3312 ImStrncpy(buf, fmt_start, ImMin((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_start) + 1, buf_size));
3313 return buf;
3314}
3315
3316// Sanitize format
3317// - Zero terminate so extra characters after format (e.g. "%f123") don't confuse atof/atoi
3318// - stb_sprintf.h supports several new modifiers which format numbers in a way that also makes them incompatible atof/atoi.
3319void ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting(const char* fmt_in, char* fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size)
3320{
3321 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_in);
3322 IM_UNUSED(fmt_out_size);
3323 IM_ASSERT((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_in + 1) < fmt_out_size); // Format is too long, let us know if this happens to you!
3324 while (fmt_in < fmt_end)
3325 {
3326 char c = *fmt_in++;
3327 if (c != '\'' && c != '$' && c != '_') // Custom flags provided by stb_sprintf.h. POSIX 2008 also supports '.
3328 *(fmt_out++) = c;
3329 }
3330 *fmt_out = 0; // Zero-terminate
3331}
3332
3333// - For scanning we need to remove all width and precision fields and flags "%+3.7f" -> "%f". BUT don't strip types like "%I64d" which includes digits. ! "%07I64d" -> "%I64d"
3334const char* ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning(const char* fmt_in, char* fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size)
3335{
3336 const char* fmt_end = ImParseFormatFindEnd(fmt_in);
3337 const char* fmt_out_begin = fmt_out;
3338 IM_UNUSED(fmt_out_size);
3339 IM_ASSERT((size_t)(fmt_end - fmt_in + 1) < fmt_out_size); // Format is too long, let us know if this happens to you!
3340 bool has_type = false;
3341 while (fmt_in < fmt_end)
3342 {
3343 char c = *fmt_in++;
3344 if (!has_type && ((c >= '0' && c <= '9') || c == '.' || c == '+' || c == '#'))
3345 continue;
3346 has_type |= ((c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')); // Stop skipping digits
3347 if (c != '\'' && c != '$' && c != '_') // Custom flags provided by stb_sprintf.h. POSIX 2008 also supports '.
3348 *(fmt_out++) = c;
3349 }
3350 *fmt_out = 0; // Zero-terminate
3351 return fmt_out_begin;
3352}
3353
