3354template<typename TYPE>
3355static const char* ImAtoi(const char* src, TYPE* output)
3356{
3357 int negative = 0;
3358 if (*src == '-') { negative = 1; src++; }
3359 if (*src == '+') { src++; }
3360 TYPE v = 0;
3361 while (*src >= '0' && *src <= '9')
3362 v = (v * 10) + (*src++ - '0');
3363 *output = negative ? -v : v;
3364 return src;
3365}
3366
3367// Parse display precision back from the display format string
3368// FIXME: This is still used by some navigation code path to infer a minimum tweak step, but we should aim to rework widgets so it isn't needed.
3369int ImParseFormatPrecision(const char* fmt, int default_precision)
3370{
3371 fmt = ImParseFormatFindStart(fmt);
3372 if (fmt[0] != '%')
3373 return default_precision;
3374 fmt++;
3375 while (*fmt >= '0' && *fmt <= '9')
3376 fmt++;
3377 int precision = INT_MAX;
3378 if (*fmt == '.')
3379 {
3380 fmt = ImAtoi<int>(fmt + 1, &precision);
3381 if (precision < 0 || precision > 99)
3382 precision = default_precision;
3383 }
3384 if (*fmt == 'e' || *fmt == 'E') // Maximum precision with scientific notation
3385 precision = -1;
3386 if ((*fmt == 'g' || *fmt == 'G') && precision == INT_MAX)
3387 precision = -1;
3388 return (precision == INT_MAX) ? default_precision : precision;
3389}
3390
3391// Create text input in place of another active widget (e.g. used when doing a CTRL+Click on drag/slider widgets)
3392// FIXME: Facilitate using this in variety of other situations.
3393bool ImGui::TempInputText(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const char* label, char* buf, int buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3394{
3395 // On the first frame, g.TempInputTextId == 0, then on subsequent frames it becomes == id.
3396 // We clear ActiveID on the first frame to allow the InputText() taking it back.
3397 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3398 const bool init = (g.TempInputId != id);
3399 if (init)
3400 ClearActiveID();
3401
3402 g.CurrentWindow->DC.CursorPos = bb.Min;
3403 bool value_changed = InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, buf_size, bb.GetSize(), flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem);
3404 if (init)
3405 {
3406 // First frame we started displaying the InputText widget, we expect it to take the active id.
3407 IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id);
3408 g.TempInputId = g.ActiveId;
3409 }
3410 return value_changed;
3411}
3412
3413// Note that Drag/Slider functions are only forwarding the min/max values clamping values if the ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp flag is set!
3414// This is intended: this way we allow CTRL+Click manual input to set a value out of bounds, for maximum flexibility.
3415// However this may not be ideal for all uses, as some user code may break on out of bound values.
3416bool ImGui::TempInputScalar(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const char* format, const void* p_clamp_min, const void* p_clamp_max)
3417{
3418 // FIXME: May need to clarify display behavior if format doesn't contain %.
3419 // "%d" -> "%d" / "There are %d items" -> "%d" / "items" -> "%d" (fallback). Also see #6405
3420 const ImGuiDataTypeInfo* type_info = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type);
3421 char fmt_buf[32];
3422 char data_buf[32];
3423 format = ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(format, fmt_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt_buf));
3424 if (format[0] == 0)
3425 format = type_info->PrintFmt;
3426 DataTypeFormatString(data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3427 ImStrTrimBlanks(data_buf);
3428
3429 ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited;
3430
3431 bool value_changed = false;
3432 if (TempInputText(bb, id, label, data_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(data_buf), flags))
3433 {
3434 // Backup old value
3435 size_t data_type_size = type_info->Size;
3436 ImGuiDataTypeTempStorage data_backup;
3437 memcpy(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size);
3438
3439 // Apply new value (or operations) then clamp
3440 DataTypeApplyFromText(data_buf, data_type, p_data, format);
3441 if (p_clamp_min || p_clamp_max)
3442 {
3443 if (p_clamp_min && p_clamp_max && DataTypeCompare(data_type, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max) > 0)
3444 ImSwap(p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3445 DataTypeClamp(data_type, p_data, p_clamp_min, p_clamp_max);
3446 }
3447
3448 // Only mark as edited if new value is different
3449 value_changed = memcmp(&data_backup, p_data, data_type_size) != 0;
3450 if (value_changed)
3451 MarkItemEdited(id);
3452 }
3453 return value_changed;
3454}
3455
3456// Note: p_data, p_step, p_step_fast are _pointers_ to a memory address holding the data. For an Input widget, p_step and p_step_fast are optional.
3457// Read code of e.g. InputFloat(), InputInt() etc. or examples in 'Demo->Widgets->Data Types' to understand how to use this function directly.
3458bool ImGui::InputScalar(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, const void* p_step, const void* p_step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3459{
3460 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3461 if (window->SkipItems)
3462 return false;
3463
3464 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3465 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
3466
3467 if (format == NULL)
3468 format = DataTypeGetInfo(data_type)->PrintFmt;
3469
3470 char buf[64];
3471 DataTypeFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), data_type, p_data, format);
3472
3473 flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll | (ImGuiInputTextFlags)ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited; // We call MarkItemEdited() ourselves by comparing the actual data rather than the string.
3474
3475 bool value_changed = false;
3476 if (p_step == NULL)
3477 {
3478 if (InputText(label, buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags))
3479 value_changed = DataTypeApplyFromText(buf, data_type, p_data, format);
3480 }
3481 else
3482 {
3483 const float button_size = GetFrameHeight();
3484
3485 BeginGroup(); // The only purpose of the group here is to allow the caller to query item data e.g. IsItemActive()
3486 PushID(label);
3487 SetNextItemWidth(ImMax(1.0f, CalcItemWidth() - (button_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * 2));
3488 if (InputText("", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), flags)) // PushId(label) + "" gives us the expected ID from outside point of view
3489 value_changed = DataTypeApplyFromText(buf, data_type, p_data, format);
3490 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable);
3491
3492 // Step buttons
3493 const ImVec2 backup_frame_padding = style.FramePadding;
3494 style.FramePadding.x = style.FramePadding.y;
3495 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat | ImGuiButtonFlags_DontClosePopups;
3496 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3497 BeginDisabled();
3498 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3499 if (ButtonEx("-", ImVec2(button_size, button_size), button_flags))
3500 {
3501 DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '-', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3502 value_changed = true;
3503 }
3504 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3505 if (ButtonEx("+", ImVec2(button_size, button_size), button_flags))
3506 {
3507 DataTypeApplyOp(data_type, '+', p_data, p_data, g.IO.KeyCtrl && p_step_fast ? p_step_fast : p_step);
3508 value_changed = true;
3509 }
3510 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
3511 EndDisabled();
3512
3513 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3514 if (label != label_end)
3515 {
3516 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3517 TextEx(label, label_end);
3518 }
3519 style.FramePadding = backup_frame_padding;
3520
3521 PopID();
3522 EndGroup();
3523 }
3524 if (value_changed)
3525 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
3526
3527 return value_changed;
3528}
3529
3530bool ImGui::InputScalarN(const char* label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void* p_data, int components, const void* p_step, const void* p_step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3531{
3532 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
3533 if (window->SkipItems)
3534 return false;
3535
3536 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3537 bool value_changed = false;
3538 BeginGroup();
3539 PushID(label);
3540 PushMultiItemsWidths(components, CalcItemWidth());
3541 size_t type_size = GDataTypeInfo[data_type].Size;
3542 for (int i = 0; i < components; i++)
3543 {
3544 PushID(i);
3545 if (i > 0)
3546 SameLine(0, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3547 value_changed |= InputScalar("", data_type, p_data, p_step, p_step_fast, format, flags);
3548 PopID();
3549 PopItemWidth();
3550 p_data = (void*)((char*)p_data + type_size);
3551 }
3552 PopID();
3553
3554 const char* label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
3555 if (label != label_end)
3556 {
3557 SameLine(0.0f, g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
3558 TextEx(label, label_end);
3559 }
3560
3561 EndGroup();
3562 return value_changed;
3563}
3564
3565bool ImGui::InputFloat(const char* label, float* v, float step, float step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3566{
3567 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0.0f ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0.0f ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3568}
3569
3570bool ImGui::InputFloat2(const char* label, float v[2], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3571{
3572 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 2, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3573}
3574
3575bool ImGui::InputFloat3(const char* label, float v[3], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3576{
3577 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 3, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3578}
3579
3580bool ImGui::InputFloat4(const char* label, float v[4], const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3581{
3582 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_Float, v, 4, NULL, NULL, format, flags);
3583}
3584
3585bool ImGui::InputInt(const char* label, int* v, int step, int step_fast, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3586{
3587 // Hexadecimal input provided as a convenience but the flag name is awkward. Typically you'd use InputText() to parse your own data, if you want to handle prefixes.
3588 const char* format = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal) ? "%08X" : "%d";
3589 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0 ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3590}
3591
3592bool ImGui::InputInt2(const char* label, int v[2], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3593{
3594 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 2, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3595}
3596
3597bool ImGui::InputInt3(const char* label, int v[3], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3598{
3599 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 3, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3600}
3601
3602bool ImGui::InputInt4(const char* label, int v[4], ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3603{
3604 return InputScalarN(label, ImGuiDataType_S32, v, 4, NULL, NULL, "%d", flags);
3605}
3606
3607bool ImGui::InputDouble(const char* label, double* v, double step, double step_fast, const char* format, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags)
3608{
3609 return InputScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_Double, (void*)v, (void*)(step > 0.0 ? &step : NULL), (void*)(step_fast > 0.0 ? &step_fast : NULL), format, flags);
3610}
3611
3612//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3613// [SECTION] Widgets: InputText, InputTextMultiline, InputTextWithHint
3614//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3615// - InputText()
3616// - InputTextWithHint()
3617// - InputTextMultiline()
3618// - InputTextGetCharInfo() [Internal]
3619// - InputTextReindexLines() [Internal]
3620// - InputTextReindexLinesRange() [Internal]
3621// - InputTextEx() [Internal]
3622// - DebugNodeInputTextState() [Internal]
3623//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
3624
3625bool ImGui::InputText(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3626{
3627 IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline()
3628 return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3629}
3630
3631bool ImGui::InputTextMultiline(const char* label, char* buf, size_t buf_size, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3632{
3633 return InputTextEx(label, NULL, buf, (int)buf_size, size, flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline, callback, user_data);
3634}
3635
3636bool ImGui::InputTextWithHint(const char* label, const char* hint, char* buf, size_t buf_size, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data)
3637{
3638 IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline)); // call InputTextMultiline() or InputTextEx() manually if you need multi-line + hint.
3639 return InputTextEx(label, hint, buf, (int)buf_size, ImVec2(0, 0), flags, callback, user_data);
3640}
3641
3642static int InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(const char* text_begin, const char** out_text_end)
3643{
3644 int line_count = 0;
3645 const char* s = text_begin;
3646 while (char c = *s++) // We are only matching for \n so we can ignore UTF-8 decoding
3647 if (c == '\n')
3648 line_count++;
3649 s--;
3650 if (s[0] != '\n' && s[0] != '\r')
3651 line_count++;
3652 *out_text_end = s;
3653 return line_count;
3654}
3655
3656static ImVec2 InputTextCalcTextSizeW(ImGuiContext* ctx, const ImWchar* text_begin, const ImWchar* text_end, const ImWchar** remaining, ImVec2* out_offset, bool stop_on_new_line)
3657{
3658 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3659 ImFont* font = g.Font;
3660 const float line_height = g.FontSize;
3661 const float scale = line_height / font->FontSize;
3662
3663 ImVec2 text_size = ImVec2(0, 0);
3664 float line_width = 0.0f;
3665
3666 const ImWchar* s = text_begin;
3667 while (s < text_end)
3668 {
3669 unsigned int c = (unsigned int)(*s++);
3670 if (c == '\n')
3671 {
3672 text_size.x = ImMax(text_size.x, line_width);
3673 text_size.y += line_height;
3674 line_width = 0.0f;
3675 if (stop_on_new_line)
3676 break;
3677 continue;
3678 }
3679 if (c == '\r')
3680 continue;
3681
3682 const float char_width = font->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)c) * scale;
3683 line_width += char_width;
3684 }
3685
3686 if (text_size.x < line_width)
3687 text_size.x = line_width;
3688
3689 if (out_offset)
3690 *out_offset = ImVec2(line_width, text_size.y + line_height); // offset allow for the possibility of sitting after a trailing \n
3691
3692 if (line_width > 0 || text_size.y == 0.0f) // whereas size.y will ignore the trailing \n
3693 text_size.y += line_height;
3694
3695 if (remaining)
3696 *remaining = s;
3697
3698 return text_size;
3699}
3700
3701// Wrapper for stb_textedit.h to edit text (our wrapper is for: statically sized buffer, single-line, wchar characters. InputText converts between UTF-8 and wchar)
3702namespace ImStb
3703{
3704
3705static int STB_TEXTEDIT_STRINGLEN(const ImGuiInputTextState* obj) { return obj->CurLenW; }
3706static ImWchar STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(const ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { IM_ASSERT(idx <= obj->CurLenW); return obj->TextW[idx]; }
3707static float STB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int line_start_idx, int char_idx) { ImWchar c = obj->TextW[line_start_idx + char_idx]; if (c == '\n') return IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH_NEWLINE; ImGuiContext& g = *obj->Ctx; return g.Font->GetCharAdvance(c) * (g.FontSize / g.Font->FontSize); }
3708static int STB_TEXTEDIT_KEYTOTEXT(int key) { return key >= 0x200000 ? 0 : key; }
3709static ImWchar STB_TEXTEDIT_NEWLINE = '\n';
3710static void STB_TEXTEDIT_LAYOUTROW(StbTexteditRow* r, ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int line_start_idx)
3711{
3712 const ImWchar* text = obj->TextW.Data;
3713 const ImWchar* text_remaining = NULL;
3714 const ImVec2 size = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(obj->Ctx, text + line_start_idx, text + obj->CurLenW, &text_remaining, NULL, true);
3715 r->x0 = 0.0f;
3716 r->x1 = size.x;
3717 r->baseline_y_delta = size.y;
3718 r->ymin = 0.0f;
3719 r->ymax = size.y;
3720 r->num_chars = (int)(text_remaining - (text + line_start_idx));
3721}
3722
3723static bool is_separator(unsigned int c)
3724{
3725 return c==',' || c==';' || c=='(' || c==')' || c=='{' || c=='}' || c=='[' || c==']' || c=='|' || c=='\n' || c=='\r' || c=='.' || c=='!';
3726}
3727
3728static int is_word_boundary_from_right(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
3729{
3730 // When ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password is set, we don't want actions such as CTRL+Arrow to leak the fact that underlying data are blanks or separators.
3731 if ((obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) || idx <= 0)
3732 return 0;
3733
3734 bool prev_white = ImCharIsBlankW(obj->TextW[idx - 1]);
3735 bool prev_separ = is_separator(obj->TextW[idx - 1]);
3736 bool curr_white = ImCharIsBlankW(obj->TextW[idx]);
3737 bool curr_separ = is_separator(obj->TextW[idx]);
3738 return ((prev_white || prev_separ) && !(curr_separ || curr_white)) || (curr_separ && !prev_separ);
3739}
3740static int is_word_boundary_from_left(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx)
3741{
3742 if ((obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) || idx <= 0)
3743 return 0;
3744
3745 bool prev_white = ImCharIsBlankW(obj->TextW[idx]);
3746 bool prev_separ = is_separator(obj->TextW[idx]);
3747 bool curr_white = ImCharIsBlankW(obj->TextW[idx - 1]);
3748 bool curr_separ = is_separator(obj->TextW[idx - 1]);
3749 return ((prev_white) && !(curr_separ || curr_white)) || (curr_separ && !prev_separ);
3750}
3751static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { idx--; while (idx >= 0 && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx)) idx--; return idx < 0 ? 0 : idx; }
3752static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { idx++; int len = obj->CurLenW; while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_left(obj, idx)) idx++; return idx > len ? len : idx; }
3753static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_WIN(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { idx++; int len = obj->CurLenW; while (idx < len && !is_word_boundary_from_right(obj, idx)) idx++; return idx > len ? len : idx; }
3754static int STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int idx) { ImGuiContext& g = *obj->Ctx; if (g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors) return STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(obj, idx); else return STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_WIN(obj, idx); }
3755#define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDLEFT_IMPL // They need to be #define for stb_textedit.h
3756#define STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_IMPL
3757
3758static void STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int pos, int n)
3759{
3760 ImWchar* dst = obj->TextW.Data + pos;
3761
3762 // We maintain our buffer length in both UTF-8 and wchar formats
3763 obj->Edited = true;
3764 obj->CurLenA -= ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(dst, dst + n);
3765 obj->CurLenW -= n;
3766
3767 // Offset remaining text (FIXME-OPT: Use memmove)
3768 const ImWchar* src = obj->TextW.Data + pos + n;
3769 while (ImWchar c = *src++)
3770 *dst++ = c;
3771 *dst = '\0';
3772}
3773
3774static bool STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(ImGuiInputTextState* obj, int pos, const ImWchar* new_text, int new_text_len)
3775{
3776 const bool is_resizable = (obj->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
3777 const int text_len = obj->CurLenW;
3778 IM_ASSERT(pos <= text_len);
3779
3780 const int new_text_len_utf8 = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(new_text, new_text + new_text_len);
3781 if (!is_resizable && (new_text_len_utf8 + obj->CurLenA + 1 > obj->BufCapacityA))
3782 return false;
3783
3784 // Grow internal buffer if needed
3785 if (new_text_len + text_len + 1 > obj->TextW.Size)
3786 {
3787 if (!is_resizable)
3788 return false;
3789 IM_ASSERT(text_len < obj->TextW.Size);
3790 obj->TextW.resize(text_len + ImClamp(new_text_len * 4, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1);
3791 }
3792
3793 ImWchar* text = obj->TextW.Data;
3794 if (pos != text_len)
3795 memmove(text + pos + new_text_len, text + pos, (size_t)(text_len - pos) * sizeof(ImWchar));
3796 memcpy(text + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len * sizeof(ImWchar));
3797
3798 obj->Edited = true;
3799 obj->CurLenW += new_text_len;
3800 obj->CurLenA += new_text_len_utf8;
3801 obj->TextW[obj->CurLenW] = '\0';
3802
3803 return true;
3804}
3805
3806// We don't use an enum so we can build even with conflicting symbols (if another user of stb_textedit.h leak their STB_TEXTEDIT_K_* symbols)
3807#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT 0x200000 // keyboard input to move cursor left
3808#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT 0x200001 // keyboard input to move cursor right
3809#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP 0x200002 // keyboard input to move cursor up
3810#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN 0x200003 // keyboard input to move cursor down
3811#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART 0x200004 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of line
3812#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND 0x200005 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of line
3813#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART 0x200006 // keyboard input to move cursor to start of text
3814#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND 0x200007 // keyboard input to move cursor to end of text
3815#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE 0x200008 // keyboard input to delete selection or character under cursor
3816#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE 0x200009 // keyboard input to delete selection or character left of cursor
3817#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO 0x20000A // keyboard input to perform undo
3818#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO 0x20000B // keyboard input to perform redo
3819#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT 0x20000C // keyboard input to move cursor left one word
3820#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT 0x20000D // keyboard input to move cursor right one word
3821#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP 0x20000E // keyboard input to move cursor up a page
3822#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN 0x20000F // keyboard input to move cursor down a page
3823#define STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT 0x400000
3824
3825#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_IMPLEMENTATION
3826#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_memmove memmove
3827#include "imstb_textedit.h"
3828
3829// stb_textedit internally allows for a single undo record to do addition and deletion, but somehow, calling
3830// the stb_textedit_paste() function creates two separate records, so we perform it manually. (FIXME: Report to nothings/stb?)
3831static void stb_textedit_replace(ImGuiInputTextState* str, STB_TexteditState* state, const IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE* text, int text_len)
3832{
3833 stb_text_makeundo_replace(str, state, 0, str->CurLenW, text_len);
3834 ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_DELETECHARS(str, 0, str->CurLenW);
3835 state->cursor = state->select_start = state->select_end = 0;
3836 if (text_len <= 0)
3837 return;
3838 if (ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS(str, 0, text, text_len))
3839 {
3840 state->cursor = state->select_start = state->select_end = text_len;
3841 state->has_preferred_x = 0;
3842 return;
3843 }
3844 IM_ASSERT(0); // Failed to insert character, normally shouldn't happen because of how we currently use stb_textedit_replace()
3845}
3846
3847} // namespace ImStb
3848
3849void ImGuiInputTextState::OnKeyPressed(int key)
3850{
3851 stb_textedit_key(this, &Stb, key);
3852 CursorFollow = true;
3853 CursorAnimReset();
3854}
3855
3856ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::ImGuiInputTextCallbackData()
3857{
3858 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3859}
3860
3861// Public API to manipulate UTF-8 text
3862// We expose UTF-8 to the user (unlike the STB_TEXTEDIT_* functions which are manipulating wchar)
3863// FIXME: The existence of this rarely exercised code path is a bit of a nuisance.
3864void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::DeleteChars(int pos, int bytes_count)
3865{
3866 IM_ASSERT(pos + bytes_count <= BufTextLen);
3867 char* dst = Buf + pos;
3868 const char* src = Buf + pos + bytes_count;
3869 while (char c = *src++)
3870 *dst++ = c;
3871 *dst = '\0';
3872
3873 if (CursorPos >= pos + bytes_count)
3874 CursorPos -= bytes_count;
3875 else if (CursorPos >= pos)
3876 CursorPos = pos;
3877 SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
3878 BufDirty = true;
3879 BufTextLen -= bytes_count;
3880}
3881
3882void ImGuiInputTextCallbackData::InsertChars(int pos, const char* new_text, const char* new_text_end)
3883{
3884 // Accept null ranges
3885 if (new_text == new_text_end)
3886 return;
3887
3888 const bool is_resizable = (Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
3889 const int new_text_len = new_text_end ? (int)(new_text_end - new_text) : (int)strlen(new_text);
3890 if (new_text_len + BufTextLen >= BufSize)
3891 {
3892 if (!is_resizable)
3893 return;
3894
3895 // Contrary to STB_TEXTEDIT_INSERTCHARS() this is working in the UTF8 buffer, hence the mildly similar code (until we remove the U16 buffer altogether!)
3896 ImGuiContext& g = *Ctx;
3897 ImGuiInputTextState* edit_state = &g.InputTextState;
3898 IM_ASSERT(edit_state->ID != 0 && g.ActiveId == edit_state->ID);
3899 IM_ASSERT(Buf == edit_state->TextA.Data);
3900 int new_buf_size = BufTextLen + ImClamp(new_text_len * 4, 32, ImMax(256, new_text_len)) + 1;
3901 edit_state->TextA.reserve(new_buf_size + 1);
3902 Buf = edit_state->TextA.Data;
3903 BufSize = edit_state->BufCapacityA = new_buf_size;
3904 }
3905
3906 if (BufTextLen != pos)
3907 memmove(Buf + pos + new_text_len, Buf + pos, (size_t)(BufTextLen - pos));
3908 memcpy(Buf + pos, new_text, (size_t)new_text_len * sizeof(char));
3909 Buf[BufTextLen + new_text_len] = '\0';
3910
3911 if (CursorPos >= pos)
3912 CursorPos += new_text_len;
3913 SelectionStart = SelectionEnd = CursorPos;
3914 BufDirty = true;
3915 BufTextLen += new_text_len;
3916}
3917
3918// Return false to discard a character.
3919static bool InputTextFilterCharacter(ImGuiContext* ctx, unsigned int* p_char, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* user_data, ImGuiInputSource input_source)
3920{
3921 IM_ASSERT(input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard || input_source == ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard);
3922 unsigned int c = *p_char;
3923
3924 // Filter non-printable (NB: isprint is unreliable! see #2467)
3925 bool apply_named_filters = true;
3926 if (c < 0x20)
3927 {
3928 bool pass = false;
3929 pass |= (c == '\n') && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0; // Note that an Enter KEY will emit \r and be ignored (we poll for KEY in InputText() code)
3930 pass |= (c == '\t') && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput) != 0;
3931 if (!pass)
3932 return false;
3933 apply_named_filters = false; // Override named filters below so newline and tabs can still be inserted.
3934 }
3935
3936 if (input_source != ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard)
3937 {
3938 // We ignore Ascii representation of delete (emitted from Backspace on OSX, see #2578, #2817)
3939 if (c == 127)
3940 return false;
3941
3942 // Filter private Unicode range. GLFW on OSX seems to send private characters for special keys like arrow keys (FIXME)
3943 if (c >= 0xE000 && c <= 0xF8FF)
3944 return false;
3945 }
3946
3947 // Filter Unicode ranges we are not handling in this build
3948 if (c > IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX)
3949 return false;
3950
3951 // Generic named filters
3952 if (apply_named_filters && (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)))
3953 {
3954 // The libc allows overriding locale, with e.g. 'setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "de_DE.UTF-8");' which affect the output/input of printf/scanf to use e.g. ',' instead of '.'.
3955 // The standard mandate that programs starts in the "C" locale where the decimal point is '.'.
3956 // We don't really intend to provide widespread support for it, but out of empathy for people stuck with using odd API, we support the bare minimum aka overriding the decimal point.
3957 // Change the default decimal_point with:
3958 // ImGui::GetIO()->PlatformLocaleDecimalPoint = *localeconv()->decimal_point;
3959 // Users of non-default decimal point (in particular ',') may be affected by word-selection logic (is_word_boundary_from_right/is_word_boundary_from_left) functions.
3960 ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3961 const unsigned c_decimal_point = (unsigned int)g.IO.PlatformLocaleDecimalPoint;
3962 if (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific))
3963 if (c == '.' || c == ',')
3964 c = c_decimal_point;
3965
3966 // Full-width -> half-width conversion for numeric fields (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halfwidth_and_Fullwidth_Forms_(Unicode_block)
3967 // While this is mostly convenient, this has the side-effect for uninformed users accidentally inputting full-width characters that they may
3968 // scratch their head as to why it works in numerical fields vs in generic text fields it would require support in the font.
3969 if (flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal))
3970 if (c >= 0xFF01 && c <= 0xFF5E)
3971 c = c - 0xFF01 + 0x21;
3972
3973 // Allow 0-9 . - + * /
3974 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal)
3975 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/'))
3976 return false;
3977
3978 // Allow 0-9 . - + * / e E
3979 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsScientific)
3980 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && (c != c_decimal_point) && (c != '-') && (c != '+') && (c != '*') && (c != '/') && (c != 'e') && (c != 'E'))
3981 return false;
3982
3983 // Allow 0-9 a-F A-F
3984 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal)
3985 if (!(c >= '0' && c <= '9') && !(c >= 'a' && c <= 'f') && !(c >= 'A' && c <= 'F'))
3986 return false;
3987
3988 // Turn a-z into A-Z
3989 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase)
3990 if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z')
3991 c += (unsigned int)('A' - 'a');
3992
3993 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank)
3994 if (ImCharIsBlankW(c))
3995 return false;
3996
3997 *p_char = c;
3998 }
3999
4000 // Custom callback filter
4001 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter)
4002 {
4003 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4004 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4005 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
4006 callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter;
4007 callback_data.EventChar = (ImWchar)c;
4008 callback_data.Flags = flags;
4009 callback_data.UserData = user_data;
4010 if (callback(&callback_data) != 0)
4011 return false;
4012 *p_char = callback_data.EventChar;
4013 if (!callback_data.EventChar)
4014 return false;
4015 }
4016
4017 return true;
4018}
4019
4020// Find the shortest single replacement we can make to get the new text from the old text.
4021// Important: needs to be run before TextW is rewritten with the new characters because calling STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR() at the end.
4022// FIXME: Ideally we should transition toward (1) making InsertChars()/DeleteChars() update undo-stack (2) discourage (and keep reconcile) or obsolete (and remove reconcile) accessing buffer directly.
4023static void InputTextReconcileUndoStateAfterUserCallback(ImGuiInputTextState* state, const char* new_buf_a, int new_length_a)
4024{
4025 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4026 const ImWchar* old_buf = state->TextW.Data;
4027 const int old_length = state->CurLenW;
4028 const int new_length = ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(new_buf_a, new_buf_a + new_length_a);
4029 g.TempBuffer.reserve_discard((new_length + 1) * sizeof(ImWchar));
4030 ImWchar* new_buf = (ImWchar*)(void*)g.TempBuffer.Data;
4031 ImTextStrFromUtf8(new_buf, new_length + 1, new_buf_a, new_buf_a + new_length_a);
4032
4033 const int shorter_length = ImMin(old_length, new_length);
4034 int first_diff;
4035 for (first_diff = 0; first_diff < shorter_length; first_diff++)
4036 if (old_buf[first_diff] != new_buf[first_diff])
4037 break;
4038 if (first_diff == old_length && first_diff == new_length)
4039 return;
4040
4041 int old_last_diff = old_length - 1;
4042 int new_last_diff = new_length - 1;
4043 for (; old_last_diff >= first_diff && new_last_diff >= first_diff; old_last_diff--, new_last_diff--)
4044 if (old_buf[old_last_diff] != new_buf[new_last_diff])
4045 break;
4046
4047 const int insert_len = new_last_diff - first_diff + 1;
4048 const int delete_len = old_last_diff - first_diff + 1;
4049 if (insert_len > 0 || delete_len > 0)
4050 if (IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE* p = stb_text_createundo(&state->Stb.undostate, first_diff, delete_len, insert_len))
4051 for (int i = 0; i < delete_len; i++)
4052 p[i] = ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(state, first_diff + i);
4053}
4054
4055// As InputText() retain textual data and we currently provide a path for user to not retain it (via local variables)
4056// we need some form of hook to reapply data back to user buffer on deactivation frame. (#4714)
4057// It would be more desirable that we discourage users from taking advantage of the "user not retaining data" trick,
4058// but that more likely be attractive when we do have _NoLiveEdit flag available.
4059void ImGui::InputTextDeactivateHook(ImGuiID id)
4060{
4061 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4062 ImGuiInputTextState* state = &g.InputTextState;
4063 if (id == 0 || state->ID != id)
4064 return;
4065 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID = state->ID;
4066 if (state->Flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly)
4067 {
4068 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.resize(0); // In theory this data won't be used, but clear to be neat.
4069 }
4070 else
4071 {
4072 IM_ASSERT(state->TextA.Data != 0);
4073 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.resize(state->CurLenA + 1);
4074 memcpy(g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data, state->TextA.Data, state->CurLenA + 1);
4075 }
4076}
4077
4078// Edit a string of text
4079// - buf_size account for the zero-terminator, so a buf_size of 6 can hold "Hello" but not "Hello!".
4080// This is so we can easily call InputText() on static arrays using ARRAYSIZE() and to match
4081// Note that in std::string world, capacity() would omit 1 byte used by the zero-terminator.
4082// - When active, hold on a privately held copy of the text (and apply back to 'buf'). So changing 'buf' while the InputText is active has no effect.
4083// - If you want to use ImGui::InputText() with std::string, see misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h
4084// (FIXME: Rather confusing and messy function, among the worse part of our codebase, expecting to rewrite a V2 at some point.. Partly because we are
4085// doing UTF8 > U16 > UTF8 conversions on the go to easily interface with stb_textedit. Ideally should stay in UTF-8 all the time. See https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/188)
4086bool ImGui::InputTextEx(const char* label, const char* hint, char* buf, int buf_size, const ImVec2& size_arg, ImGuiInputTextFlags flags, ImGuiInputTextCallback callback, void* callback_user_data)
4087{
4088 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4089 if (window->SkipItems)
4090 return false;
4091
4092 IM_ASSERT(buf != NULL && buf_size >= 0);
4093 IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline))); // Can't use both together (they both use up/down keys)
4094 IM_ASSERT(!((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput))); // Can't use both together (they both use tab key)
4095
4096 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4097 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
4098 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
4099
4100 const bool RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE = false;
4101 const bool is_multiline = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline) != 0;
4102
4103 if (is_multiline) // Open group before calling GetID() because groups tracks id created within their scope (including the scrollbar)
4104 BeginGroup();
4105 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
4106 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
4107 const ImVec2 frame_size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), (is_multiline ? g.FontSize * 8.0f : label_size.y) + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f); // Arbitrary default of 8 lines high for multi-line
4108 const ImVec2 total_size = ImVec2(frame_size.x + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f), frame_size.y);
4109
4110 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
4111 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Min + total_size);
4112
4113 ImGuiWindow* draw_window = window;
4114 ImVec2 inner_size = frame_size;
4115 ImGuiLastItemData item_data_backup;
4116 if (is_multiline)
4117 {
4118 ImVec2 backup_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
4119 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4120 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
4121 {
4122 EndGroup();
4123 return false;
4124 }
4125 item_data_backup = g.LastItemData;
4126 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_pos;
4127
4128 // Prevent NavActivation from Tabbing when our widget accepts Tab inputs: this allows cycling through widgets without stopping.
4129 if (g.NavActivateId == id && (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_FromTabbing) && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput))
4130 g.NavActivateId = 0;
4131
4132 // Prevent NavActivate reactivating in BeginChild() when we are already active.
4133 const ImGuiID backup_activate_id = g.NavActivateId;
4134 if (g.ActiveId == id) // Prevent reactivation
4135 g.NavActivateId = 0;
4136
4137 // We reproduce the contents of BeginChildFrame() in order to provide 'label' so our window internal data are easier to read/debug.
4138 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
4139 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
4140 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
4141 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Ensure no clip rect so mouse hover can reach FramePadding edges
4142 bool child_visible = BeginChildEx(label, id, frame_bb.GetSize(), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
4143 g.NavActivateId = backup_activate_id;
4144 PopStyleVar(3);
4145 PopStyleColor();
4146 if (!child_visible)
4147 {
4148 EndChild();
4149 EndGroup();
4150 return false;
4151 }
4152 draw_window = g.CurrentWindow; // Child window
4153 draw_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext |= (1 << draw_window->DC.NavLayerCurrent); // This is to ensure that EndChild() will display a navigation highlight so we can "enter" into it.
4154 draw_window->DC.CursorPos += style.FramePadding;
4155 inner_size.x -= draw_window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
4156 }
4157 else
4158 {
4159 // Support for internal ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem flag, which could be redesigned as an ItemFlags if needed (with test performed in ItemAdd)
4160 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
4161 if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem))
4162 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, id, &frame_bb, ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable))
4163 return false;
4164 }
4165 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.InFlags);
4166 if (hovered)
4167 g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_TextInput;
4168
4169 // We are only allowed to access the state if we are already the active widget.
4170 ImGuiInputTextState* state = GetInputTextState(id);
4171
4172 if (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly)
4173 flags |= ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly;
4174 const bool is_readonly = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly) != 0;
4175 const bool is_password = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password) != 0;
4176 const bool is_undoable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoUndoRedo) == 0;
4177 const bool is_resizable = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) != 0;
4178 if (is_resizable)
4179 IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL); // Must provide a callback if you set the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize flag!
4180
4181 const bool input_requested_by_nav = (g.ActiveId != id) && ((g.NavActivateId == id) && ((g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput) || (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)));
4182
4183 const bool user_clicked = hovered && io.MouseClicked[0];
4184 const bool user_scroll_finish = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4185 const bool user_scroll_active = is_multiline && state != NULL && g.ActiveId == GetWindowScrollbarID(draw_window, ImGuiAxis_Y);
4186 bool clear_active_id = false;
4187 bool select_all = false;
4188
4189 float scroll_y = is_multiline ? draw_window->Scroll.y : FLT_MAX;
4190
4191 const bool init_reload_from_user_buf = (state != NULL && state->ReloadUserBuf);
4192 const bool init_changed_specs = (state != NULL && state->Stb.single_line != !is_multiline); // state != NULL means its our state.
4193 const bool init_make_active = (user_clicked || user_scroll_finish || input_requested_by_nav);
4194 const bool init_state = (init_make_active || user_scroll_active);
4195 if ((init_state && g.ActiveId != id) || init_changed_specs || init_reload_from_user_buf)
4196 {
4197 // Access state even if we don't own it yet.
4198 state = &g.InputTextState;
4199 state->CursorAnimReset();
4200 state->ReloadUserBuf = false;
4201
4202 // Backup state of deactivating item so they'll have a chance to do a write to output buffer on the same frame they report IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit (#4714)
4203 InputTextDeactivateHook(state->ID);
4204
4205 // From the moment we focused we are normally ignoring the content of 'buf' (unless we are in read-only mode)
4206 const int buf_len = (int)strlen(buf);
4207 if (!init_reload_from_user_buf)
4208 {
4209 // Take a copy of the initial buffer value.
4210 state->InitialTextA.resize(buf_len + 1); // UTF-8. we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4211 memcpy(state->InitialTextA.Data, buf, buf_len + 1);
4212 }
4213
4214 // Preserve cursor position and undo/redo stack if we come back to same widget
4215 // FIXME: Since we reworked this on 2022/06, may want to differentiate recycle_cursor vs recycle_undostate?
4216 bool recycle_state = (state->ID == id && !init_changed_specs && !init_reload_from_user_buf);
4217 if (recycle_state && (state->CurLenA != buf_len || (state->TextAIsValid && strncmp(state->TextA.Data, buf, buf_len) != 0)))
4218 recycle_state = false;
4219
4220 // Start edition
4221 const char* buf_end = NULL;
4222 state->ID = id;
4223 state->TextW.resize(buf_size + 1); // wchar count <= UTF-8 count. we use +1 to make sure that .Data is always pointing to at least an empty string.
4224 state->TextA.resize(0);
4225 state->TextAIsValid = false; // TextA is not valid yet (we will display buf until then)
4226 state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, buf_size, buf, NULL, &buf_end);
4227 state->CurLenA = (int)(buf_end - buf); // We can't get the result from ImStrncpy() above because it is not UTF-8 aware. Here we'll cut off malformed UTF-8.
4228
4229 if (recycle_state)
4230 {
4231 // Recycle existing cursor/selection/undo stack but clamp position
4232 // Note a single mouse click will override the cursor/position immediately by calling stb_textedit_click handler.
4233 state->CursorClamp();
4234 }
4235 else
4236 {
4237 state->ScrollX = 0.0f;
4238 stb_textedit_initialize_state(&state->Stb, !is_multiline);
4239 }
4240
4241 if (init_reload_from_user_buf)
4242 {
4243 state->Stb.select_start = state->ReloadSelectionStart;
4244 state->Stb.cursor = state->Stb.select_end = state->ReloadSelectionEnd;
4245 state->CursorClamp();
4246 }
4247 else if (!is_multiline)
4248 {
4249 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AutoSelectAll)
4250 select_all = true;
4251 if (input_requested_by_nav && (!recycle_state || !(g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_TryToPreserveState)))
4252 select_all = true;
4253 if (user_clicked && io.KeyCtrl)
4254 select_all = true;
4255 }
4256
4257 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AlwaysOverwrite)
4258 state->Stb.insert_mode = 1; // stb field name is indeed incorrect (see #2863)
4259 }
4260
4261 const bool is_osx = io.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
4262 if (g.ActiveId != id && init_make_active)
4263 {
4264 IM_ASSERT(state && state->ID == id);
4265 SetActiveID(id, window);
4266 SetFocusID(id, window);
4267 FocusWindow(window);
4268 }
4269 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4270 {
4271 // Declare some inputs, the other are registered and polled via Shortcut() routing system.
4272 if (user_clicked)
4273 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft, id);
4274 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Left) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Right);
4275 if (is_multiline || (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory))
4276 g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask |= (1 << ImGuiDir_Up) | (1 << ImGuiDir_Down);
4277 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_Enter, id);
4278 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, id);
4279 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_Home, id);
4280 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_End, id);
4281 if (is_multiline)
4282 {
4283 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_PageUp, id);
4284 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_PageDown, id);
4285 }
4286 if (is_osx)
4287 SetKeyOwner(ImGuiMod_Alt, id);
4288 }
4289
4290 // We have an edge case if ActiveId was set through another widget (e.g. widget being swapped), clear id immediately (don't wait until the end of the function)
4291 if (g.ActiveId == id && state == NULL)
4292 ClearActiveID();
4293
4294 // Release focus when we click outside
4295 if (g.ActiveId == id && io.MouseClicked[0] && !init_state && !init_make_active) //-V560
4296 clear_active_id = true;
4297
4298 // Lock the decision of whether we are going to take the path displaying the cursor or selection
4299 bool render_cursor = (g.ActiveId == id) || (state && user_scroll_active);
4300 bool render_selection = state && (state->HasSelection() || select_all) && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
4301 bool value_changed = false;
4302 bool validated = false;
4303
4304 // When read-only we always use the live data passed to the function
4305 // FIXME-OPT: Because our selection/cursor code currently needs the wide text we need to convert it when active, which is not ideal :(
4306 if (is_readonly && state != NULL && (render_cursor || render_selection))
4307 {
4308 const char* buf_end = NULL;
4309 state->TextW.resize(buf_size + 1);
4310 state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, state->TextW.Size, buf, NULL, &buf_end);
4311 state->CurLenA = (int)(buf_end - buf);
4312 state->CursorClamp();
4313 render_selection &= state->HasSelection();
4314 }
4315
4316 // Select the buffer to render.
4317 const bool buf_display_from_state = (render_cursor || render_selection || g.ActiveId == id) && !is_readonly && state && state->TextAIsValid;
4318 const bool is_displaying_hint = (hint != NULL && (buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf)[0] == 0);
4319
4320 // Password pushes a temporary font with only a fallback glyph
4321 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
4322 {
4323 const ImFontGlyph* glyph = g.Font->FindGlyph('*');
4324 ImFont* password_font = &g.InputTextPasswordFont;
4325 password_font->FontSize = g.Font->FontSize;
4326 password_font->Scale = g.Font->Scale;
4327 password_font->Ascent = g.Font->Ascent;
4328 password_font->Descent = g.Font->Descent;
4329 password_font->ContainerAtlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
4330 password_font->FallbackGlyph = glyph;
4331 password_font->FallbackAdvanceX = glyph->AdvanceX;
4332 IM_ASSERT(password_font->Glyphs.empty() && password_font->IndexAdvanceX.empty() && password_font->IndexLookup.empty());
4333 PushFont(password_font);
4334 }
4335
4336 // Process mouse inputs and character inputs
4337 int backup_current_text_length = 0;
4338 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4339 {
4340 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4341 backup_current_text_length = state->CurLenA;
4342 state->Edited = false;
4343 state->BufCapacityA = buf_size;
4344 state->Flags = flags;
4345
4346 // Although we are active we don't prevent mouse from hovering other elements unless we are interacting right now with the widget.
4347 // Down the line we should have a cleaner library-wide concept of Selected vs Active.
4348 g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = !io.MouseDown[0];
4349
4350 // Edit in progress
4351 const float mouse_x = (io.MousePos.x - frame_bb.Min.x - style.FramePadding.x) + state->ScrollX;
4352 const float mouse_y = (is_multiline ? (io.MousePos.y - draw_window->DC.CursorPos.y) : (g.FontSize * 0.5f));
4353
4354 if (select_all)
4355 {
4356 state->SelectAll();
4357 state->SelectedAllMouseLock = true;
4358 }
4359 else if (hovered && io.MouseClickedCount[0] >= 2 && !io.KeyShift)
4360 {
4361 stb_textedit_click(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4362 const int multiclick_count = (io.MouseClickedCount[0] - 2);
4363 if ((multiclick_count % 2) == 0)
4364 {
4365 // Double-click: Select word
4366 // We always use the "Mac" word advance for double-click select vs CTRL+Right which use the platform dependent variant:
4367 // FIXME: There are likely many ways to improve this behavior, but there's no "right" behavior (depends on use-case, software, OS)
4368 const bool is_bol = (state->Stb.cursor == 0) || ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(state, state->Stb.cursor - 1) == '\n';
4369 if (STB_TEXT_HAS_SELECTION(&state->Stb) || !is_bol)
4370 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT);
4371 //state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4372 if (!STB_TEXT_HAS_SELECTION(&state->Stb))
4373 ImStb::stb_textedit_prep_selection_at_cursor(&state->Stb);
4374 state->Stb.cursor = ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_MOVEWORDRIGHT_MAC(state, state->Stb.cursor);
4375 state->Stb.select_end = state->Stb.cursor;
4376 ImStb::stb_textedit_clamp(state, &state->Stb);
4377 }
4378 else
4379 {
4380 // Triple-click: Select line
4381 const bool is_eol = ImStb::STB_TEXTEDIT_GETCHAR(state, state->Stb.cursor) == '\n';
4382 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART);
4383 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4384 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4385 if (!is_eol && is_multiline)
4386 {
4387 ImSwap(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4388 state->Stb.cursor = state->Stb.select_end;
4389 }
4390 state->CursorFollow = false;
4391 }
4392 state->CursorAnimReset();
4393 }
4394 else if (io.MouseClicked[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock)
4395 {
4396 if (hovered)
4397 {
4398 if (io.KeyShift)
4399 stb_textedit_drag(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4400 else
4401 stb_textedit_click(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4402 state->CursorAnimReset();
4403 }
4404 }
4405 else if (io.MouseDown[0] && !state->SelectedAllMouseLock && (io.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || io.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f))
4406 {
4407 stb_textedit_drag(state, &state->Stb, mouse_x, mouse_y);
4408 state->CursorAnimReset();
4409 state->CursorFollow = true;
4410 }
4411 if (state->SelectedAllMouseLock && !io.MouseDown[0])
4412 state->SelectedAllMouseLock = false;
4413
4414 // We expect backends to emit a Tab key but some also emit a Tab character which we ignore (#2467, #1336)
4415 // (For Tab and Enter: Win32/SFML/Allegro are sending both keys and chars, GLFW and SDL are only sending keys. For Space they all send all threes)
4416 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput) && !is_readonly)
4417 {
4418 if (Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab, id, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
4419 {
4420 unsigned int c = '\t'; // Insert TAB
4421 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4422 state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4423 }
4424 // FIXME: Implement Shift+Tab
4425 /*
4426 if (Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab | ImGuiMod_Shift, id, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
4427 {
4428 }
4429 */
4430 }
4431
4432 // Process regular text input (before we check for Return because using some IME will effectively send a Return?)
4433 // We ignore CTRL inputs, but need to allow ALT+CTRL as some keyboards (e.g. German) use AltGR (which _is_ Alt+Ctrl) to input certain characters.
4434 const bool ignore_char_inputs = (io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt) || (is_osx && io.KeySuper);
4435 if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0)
4436 {
4437 if (!ignore_char_inputs && !is_readonly && !input_requested_by_nav)
4438 for (int n = 0; n < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; n++)
4439 {
4440 // Insert character if they pass filtering
4441 unsigned int c = (unsigned int)io.InputQueueCharacters[n];
4442 if (c == '\t') // Skip Tab, see above.
4443 continue;
4444 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4445 state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4446 }
4447
4448 // Consume characters
4449 io.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4450 }
4451 }
4452
4453 // Process other shortcuts/key-presses
4454 bool revert_edit = false;
4455 if (g.ActiveId == id && !g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated && !clear_active_id)
4456 {
4457 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4458
4459 const int row_count_per_page = ImMax((int)((inner_size.y - style.FramePadding.y) / g.FontSize), 1);
4460 state->Stb.row_count_per_page = row_count_per_page;
4461
4462 const int k_mask = (io.KeyShift ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT : 0);
4463 const bool is_wordmove_key_down = is_osx ? io.KeyAlt : io.KeyCtrl; // OS X style: Text editing cursor movement using Alt instead of Ctrl
4464 const bool is_startend_key_down = is_osx && io.KeySuper && !io.KeyCtrl && !io.KeyAlt; // OS X style: Line/Text Start and End using Cmd+Arrows instead of Home/End
4465
4466 // Using Shortcut() with ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (default policy) to allow routing operations for other code (e.g. calling window trying to use CTRL+A and CTRL+B: formet would be handled by InputText)
4467 // Otherwise we could simply assume that we own the keys as we are active.
4468 const ImGuiInputFlags f_repeat = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat;
4469 const bool is_cut = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_X, id, f_repeat) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Delete, id, f_repeat)) && !is_readonly && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4470 const bool is_copy = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_C, id) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_Insert, id)) && !is_password && (!is_multiline || state->HasSelection());
4471 const bool is_paste = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_V, id, f_repeat) || Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Insert, id, f_repeat)) && !is_readonly;
4472 const bool is_undo = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_Z, id, f_repeat)) && !is_readonly && is_undoable;
4473 const bool is_redo = (Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_Y, id, f_repeat) || (is_osx && Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Z, id, f_repeat))) && !is_readonly && is_undoable;
4474 const bool is_select_all = Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Shortcut | ImGuiKey_A, id);
4475
4476 // We allow validate/cancel with Nav source (gamepad) to makes it easier to undo an accidental NavInput press with no keyboard wired, but otherwise it isn't very useful.
4477 const bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
4478 const bool is_enter_pressed = IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter, true) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_KeypadEnter, true);
4479 const bool is_gamepad_validate = nav_gamepad_active && (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate, false) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadInput, false));
4480 const bool is_cancel = Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Escape, id, f_repeat) || (nav_gamepad_active && Shortcut(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel, id, f_repeat));
4481
4482 // FIXME: Should use more Shortcut() and reduce IsKeyPressed()+SetKeyOwner(), but requires modifiers combination to be taken account of.
4483 if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow)) { state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LEFT) | k_mask); }
4484 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_RightArrow)) { state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND : is_wordmove_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_RIGHT) | k_mask); }
4485 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_UpArrow) && is_multiline) { if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMax(draw_window->Scroll.y - g.FontSize, 0.0f)); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UP) | k_mask); }
4486 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_DownArrow) && is_multiline) { if (io.KeyCtrl) SetScrollY(draw_window, ImMin(draw_window->Scroll.y + g.FontSize, GetScrollMaxY())); else state->OnKeyPressed((is_startend_key_down ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DOWN) | k_mask); }
4487 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageUp) && is_multiline) { state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGUP | k_mask); scroll_y -= row_count_per_page * g.FontSize; }
4488 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_PageDown) && is_multiline) { state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_PGDOWN | k_mask); scroll_y += row_count_per_page * g.FontSize; }
4489 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Home)) { state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTSTART | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | k_mask); }
4490 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_End)) { state->OnKeyPressed(io.KeyCtrl ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_TEXTEND | k_mask : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINEEND | k_mask); }
4491 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Delete) && !is_readonly && !is_cut)
4492 {
4493 if (!state->HasSelection())
4494 {
4495 // OSX doesn't seem to have Super+Delete to delete until end-of-line, so we don't emulate that (as opposed to Super+Backspace)
4496 if (is_wordmove_key_down)
4497 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDRIGHT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4498 }
4499 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_DELETE | k_mask);
4500 }
4501 else if (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace) && !is_readonly)
4502 {
4503 if (!state->HasSelection())
4504 {
4505 if (is_wordmove_key_down)
4506 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_WORDLEFT | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4507 else if (is_osx && io.KeySuper && !io.KeyAlt && !io.KeyCtrl)
4508 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_LINESTART | STB_TEXTEDIT_K_SHIFT);
4509 }
4510 state->OnKeyPressed(STB_TEXTEDIT_K_BACKSPACE | k_mask);
4511 }
4512 else if (is_enter_pressed || is_gamepad_validate)
4513 {
4514 // Determine if we turn Enter into a \n character
4515 bool ctrl_enter_for_new_line = (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine) != 0;
4516 if (!is_multiline || is_gamepad_validate || (ctrl_enter_for_new_line && !io.KeyCtrl) || (!ctrl_enter_for_new_line && io.KeyCtrl))
4517 {
4518 validated = true;
4519 if (io.ConfigInputTextEnterKeepActive && !is_multiline)
4520 state->SelectAll(); // No need to scroll
4521 else
4522 clear_active_id = true;
4523 }
4524 else if (!is_readonly)
4525 {
4526 unsigned int c = '\n'; // Insert new line
4527 if (InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard))
4528 state->OnKeyPressed((int)c);
4529 }
4530 }
4531 else if (is_cancel)
4532 {
4533 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll)
4534 {
4535 if (buf[0] != 0)
4536 {
4537 revert_edit = true;
4538 }
4539 else
4540 {
4541 render_cursor = render_selection = false;
4542 clear_active_id = true;
4543 }
4544 }
4545 else
4546 {
4547 clear_active_id = revert_edit = true;
4548 render_cursor = render_selection = false;
4549 }
4550 }
4551 else if (is_undo || is_redo)
4552 {
4553 state->OnKeyPressed(is_undo ? STB_TEXTEDIT_K_UNDO : STB_TEXTEDIT_K_REDO);
4554 state->ClearSelection();
4555 }
4556 else if (is_select_all)
4557 {
4558 state->SelectAll();
4559 state->CursorFollow = true;
4560 }
4561 else if (is_cut || is_copy)
4562 {
4563 // Cut, Copy
4564 if (io.SetClipboardTextFn)
4565 {
4566 const int ib = state->HasSelection() ? ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end) : 0;
4567 const int ie = state->HasSelection() ? ImMax(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end) : state->CurLenW;
4568 const int clipboard_data_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(state->TextW.Data + ib, state->TextW.Data + ie) + 1;
4569 char* clipboard_data = (char*)IM_ALLOC(clipboard_data_len * sizeof(char));
4570 ImTextStrToUtf8(clipboard_data, clipboard_data_len, state->TextW.Data + ib, state->TextW.Data + ie);
4571 SetClipboardText(clipboard_data);
4572 MemFree(clipboard_data);
4573 }
4574 if (is_cut)
4575 {
4576 if (!state->HasSelection())
4577 state->SelectAll();
4578 state->CursorFollow = true;
4579 stb_textedit_cut(state, &state->Stb);
4580 }
4581 }
4582 else if (is_paste)
4583 {
4584 if (const char* clipboard = GetClipboardText())
4585 {
4586 // Filter pasted buffer
4587 const int clipboard_len = (int)strlen(clipboard);
4588 ImWchar* clipboard_filtered = (ImWchar*)IM_ALLOC((clipboard_len + 1) * sizeof(ImWchar));
4589 int clipboard_filtered_len = 0;
4590 for (const char* s = clipboard; *s != 0; )
4591 {
4592 unsigned int c;
4593 s += ImTextCharFromUtf8(&c, s, NULL);
4594 if (!InputTextFilterCharacter(&g, &c, flags, callback, callback_user_data, ImGuiInputSource_Clipboard))
4595 continue;
4596 clipboard_filtered[clipboard_filtered_len++] = (ImWchar)c;
4597 }
4598 clipboard_filtered[clipboard_filtered_len] = 0;
4599 if (clipboard_filtered_len > 0) // If everything was filtered, ignore the pasting operation
4600 {
4601 stb_textedit_paste(state, &state->Stb, clipboard_filtered, clipboard_filtered_len);
4602 state->CursorFollow = true;
4603 }
4604 MemFree(clipboard_filtered);
4605 }
4606 }
4607
4608 // Update render selection flag after events have been handled, so selection highlight can be displayed during the same frame.
4609 render_selection |= state->HasSelection() && (RENDER_SELECTION_WHEN_INACTIVE || render_cursor);
4610 }
4611
4612 // Process callbacks and apply result back to user's buffer.
4613 const char* apply_new_text = NULL;
4614 int apply_new_text_length = 0;
4615 if (g.ActiveId == id)
4616 {
4617 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4618 if (revert_edit && !is_readonly)
4619 {
4620 if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EscapeClearsAll)
4621 {
4622 // Clear input
4623 IM_ASSERT(buf[0] != 0);
4624 apply_new_text = "";
4625 apply_new_text_length = 0;
4626 value_changed = true;
4627 IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE empty_string;
4628 stb_textedit_replace(state, &state->Stb, &empty_string, 0);
4629 }
4630 else if (strcmp(buf, state->InitialTextA.Data) != 0)
4631 {
4632 // Restore initial value. Only return true if restoring to the initial value changes the current buffer contents.
4633 // Push records into the undo stack so we can CTRL+Z the revert operation itself
4634 apply_new_text = state->InitialTextA.Data;
4635 apply_new_text_length = state->InitialTextA.Size - 1;
4636 value_changed = true;
4637 ImVector<ImWchar> w_text;
4638 if (apply_new_text_length > 0)
4639 {
4640 w_text.resize(ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(apply_new_text, apply_new_text + apply_new_text_length) + 1);
4641 ImTextStrFromUtf8(w_text.Data, w_text.Size, apply_new_text, apply_new_text + apply_new_text_length);
4642 }
4643 stb_textedit_replace(state, &state->Stb, w_text.Data, (apply_new_text_length > 0) ? (w_text.Size - 1) : 0);
4644 }
4645 }
4646
4647 // Apply ASCII value
4648 if (!is_readonly)
4649 {
4650 state->TextAIsValid = true;
4651 state->TextA.resize(state->TextW.Size * 4 + 1);
4652 ImTextStrToUtf8(state->TextA.Data, state->TextA.Size, state->TextW.Data, NULL);
4653 }
4654
4655 // When using 'ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue' as a special case we reapply the live buffer back to the input buffer
4656 // before clearing ActiveId, even though strictly speaking it wasn't modified on this frame.
4657 // If we didn't do that, code like InputInt() with ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue would fail.
4658 // This also allows the user to use InputText() with ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue without maintaining any user-side storage
4659 // (please note that if you use this property along ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize you can end up with your temporary string object
4660 // unnecessarily allocating once a frame, either store your string data, either if you don't then don't use ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize).
4661 const bool apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer = !revert_edit || (validated && (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0);
4662 if (apply_edit_back_to_user_buffer)
4663 {
4664 // Apply new value immediately - copy modified buffer back
4665 // Note that as soon as the input box is active, the in-widget value gets priority over any underlying modification of the input buffer
4666 // FIXME: We actually always render 'buf' when calling DrawList->AddText, making the comment above incorrect.
4667 // FIXME-OPT: CPU waste to do this every time the widget is active, should mark dirty state from the stb_textedit callbacks.
4668
4669 // User callback
4670 if ((flags & (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)) != 0)
4671 {
4672 IM_ASSERT(callback != NULL);
4673
4674 // The reason we specify the usage semantic (Completion/History) is that Completion needs to disable keyboard TABBING at the moment.
4675 ImGuiInputTextFlags event_flag = 0;
4676 ImGuiKey event_key = ImGuiKey_None;
4677 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion) != 0 && Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Tab, id))
4678 {
4679 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion;
4680 event_key = ImGuiKey_Tab;
4681 }
4682 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_UpArrow))
4683 {
4684 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
4685 event_key = ImGuiKey_UpArrow;
4686 }
4687 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory) != 0 && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_DownArrow))
4688 {
4689 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory;
4690 event_key = ImGuiKey_DownArrow;
4691 }
4692 else if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit) && state->Edited)
4693 {
4694 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit;
4695 }
4696 else if (flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways)
4697 {
4698 event_flag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackAlways;
4699 }
4700
4701 if (event_flag)
4702 {
4703 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4704 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
4705 callback_data.EventFlag = event_flag;
4706 callback_data.Flags = flags;
4707 callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
4708
4709 char* callback_buf = is_readonly ? buf : state->TextA.Data;
4710 callback_data.EventKey = event_key;
4711 callback_data.Buf = callback_buf;
4712 callback_data.BufTextLen = state->CurLenA;
4713 callback_data.BufSize = state->BufCapacityA;
4714 callback_data.BufDirty = false;
4715
4716 // We have to convert from wchar-positions to UTF-8-positions, which can be pretty slow (an incentive to ditch the ImWchar buffer, see https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/188)
4717 ImWchar* text = state->TextW.Data;
4718 const int utf8_cursor_pos = callback_data.CursorPos = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.cursor);
4719 const int utf8_selection_start = callback_data.SelectionStart = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.select_start);
4720 const int utf8_selection_end = callback_data.SelectionEnd = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(text, text + state->Stb.select_end);
4721
4722 // Call user code
4723 callback(&callback_data);
4724
4725 // Read back what user may have modified
4726 callback_buf = is_readonly ? buf : state->TextA.Data; // Pointer may have been invalidated by a resize callback
4727 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Buf == callback_buf); // Invalid to modify those fields
4728 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufSize == state->BufCapacityA);
4729 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.Flags == flags);
4730 const bool buf_dirty = callback_data.BufDirty;
4731 if (callback_data.CursorPos != utf8_cursor_pos || buf_dirty) { state->Stb.cursor = ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.CursorPos); state->CursorFollow = true; }
4732 if (callback_data.SelectionStart != utf8_selection_start || buf_dirty) { state->Stb.select_start = (callback_data.SelectionStart == callback_data.CursorPos) ? state->Stb.cursor : ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.SelectionStart); }
4733 if (callback_data.SelectionEnd != utf8_selection_end || buf_dirty) { state->Stb.select_end = (callback_data.SelectionEnd == callback_data.SelectionStart) ? state->Stb.select_start : ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(callback_data.Buf, callback_data.Buf + callback_data.SelectionEnd); }
4734 if (buf_dirty)
4735 {
4736 IM_ASSERT(!is_readonly);
4737 IM_ASSERT(callback_data.BufTextLen == (int)strlen(callback_data.Buf)); // You need to maintain BufTextLen if you change the text!
4738 InputTextReconcileUndoStateAfterUserCallback(state, callback_data.Buf, callback_data.BufTextLen); // FIXME: Move the rest of this block inside function and rename to InputTextReconcileStateAfterUserCallback() ?
4739 if (callback_data.BufTextLen > backup_current_text_length && is_resizable)
4740 state->TextW.resize(state->TextW.Size + (callback_data.BufTextLen - backup_current_text_length)); // Worse case scenario resize
4741 state->CurLenW = ImTextStrFromUtf8(state->TextW.Data, state->TextW.Size, callback_data.Buf, NULL);
4742 state->CurLenA = callback_data.BufTextLen; // Assume correct length and valid UTF-8 from user, saves us an extra strlen()
4743 state->CursorAnimReset();
4744 }
4745 }
4746 }
4747
4748 // Will copy result string if modified
4749 if (!is_readonly && strcmp(state->TextA.Data, buf) != 0)
4750 {
4751 apply_new_text = state->TextA.Data;
4752 apply_new_text_length = state->CurLenA;
4753 value_changed = true;
4754 }
4755 }
4756 }
4757
4758 // Handle reapplying final data on deactivation (see InputTextDeactivateHook() for details)
4759 if (g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID == id)
4760 {
4761 if (g.ActiveId != id && IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() && !is_readonly && strcmp(g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data, buf) != 0)
4762 {
4763 apply_new_text = g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Data;
4764 apply_new_text_length = g.InputTextDeactivatedState.TextA.Size - 1;
4765 value_changed = true;
4766 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("InputText(): apply Deactivated data for 0x%08X: \"%.*s\".\n", id, apply_new_text_length, apply_new_text);
4767 }
4768 g.InputTextDeactivatedState.ID = 0;
4769 }
4770
4771 // Copy result to user buffer. This can currently only happen when (g.ActiveId == id)
4772 if (apply_new_text != NULL)
4773 {
4774 // We cannot test for 'backup_current_text_length != apply_new_text_length' here because we have no guarantee that the size
4775 // of our owned buffer matches the size of the string object held by the user, and by design we allow InputText() to be used
4776 // without any storage on user's side.
4777 IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length >= 0);
4778 if (is_resizable)
4779 {
4780 ImGuiInputTextCallbackData callback_data;
4781 callback_data.Ctx = &g;
4782 callback_data.EventFlag = ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize;
4783 callback_data.Flags = flags;
4784 callback_data.Buf = buf;
4785 callback_data.BufTextLen = apply_new_text_length;
4786 callback_data.BufSize = ImMax(buf_size, apply_new_text_length + 1);
4787 callback_data.UserData = callback_user_data;
4788 callback(&callback_data);
4789 buf = callback_data.Buf;
4790 buf_size = callback_data.BufSize;
4791 apply_new_text_length = ImMin(callback_data.BufTextLen, buf_size - 1);
4792 IM_ASSERT(apply_new_text_length <= buf_size);
4793 }
4794 //IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINT("InputText(\"%s\"): apply_new_text length %d\n", label, apply_new_text_length);
4795
4796 // If the underlying buffer resize was denied or not carried to the next frame, apply_new_text_length+1 may be >= buf_size.
4797 ImStrncpy(buf, apply_new_text, ImMin(apply_new_text_length + 1, buf_size));
4798 }
4799
4800 // Release active ID at the end of the function (so e.g. pressing Return still does a final application of the value)
4801 // Otherwise request text input ahead for next frame.
4802 if (g.ActiveId == id && clear_active_id)
4803 ClearActiveID();
4804 else if (g.ActiveId == id)
4805 g.WantTextInputNextFrame = 1;
4806
4807 // Render frame
4808 if (!is_multiline)
4809 {
4810 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id);
4811 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
4812 }
4813
4814 const ImVec4 clip_rect(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y, frame_bb.Min.x + inner_size.x, frame_bb.Min.y + inner_size.y); // Not using frame_bb.Max because we have adjusted size
4815 ImVec2 draw_pos = is_multiline ? draw_window->DC.CursorPos : frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding;
4816 ImVec2 text_size(0.0f, 0.0f);
4817
4818 // Set upper limit of single-line InputTextEx() at 2 million characters strings. The current pathological worst case is a long line
4819 // without any carriage return, which would makes ImFont::RenderText() reserve too many vertices and probably crash. Avoid it altogether.
4820 // Note that we only use this limit on single-line InputText(), so a pathologically large line on a InputTextMultiline() would still crash.
4821 const int buf_display_max_length = 2 * 1024 * 1024;
4822 const char* buf_display = buf_display_from_state ? state->TextA.Data : buf; //-V595
4823 const char* buf_display_end = NULL; // We have specialized paths below for setting the length
4824 if (is_displaying_hint)
4825 {
4826 buf_display = hint;
4827 buf_display_end = hint + strlen(hint);
4828 }
4829
4830 // Render text. We currently only render selection when the widget is active or while scrolling.
4831 // FIXME: We could remove the '&& render_cursor' to keep rendering selection when inactive.
4832 if (render_cursor || render_selection)
4833 {
4834 IM_ASSERT(state != NULL);
4835 if (!is_displaying_hint)
4836 buf_display_end = buf_display + state->CurLenA;
4837
4838 // Render text (with cursor and selection)
4839 // This is going to be messy. We need to:
4840 // - Display the text (this alone can be more easily clipped)
4841 // - Handle scrolling, highlight selection, display cursor (those all requires some form of 1d->2d cursor position calculation)
4842 // - Measure text height (for scrollbar)
4843 // We are attempting to do most of that in **one main pass** to minimize the computation cost (non-negligible for large amount of text) + 2nd pass for selection rendering (we could merge them by an extra refactoring effort)
4844 // FIXME: This should occur on buf_display but we'd need to maintain cursor/select_start/select_end for UTF-8.
4845 const ImWchar* text_begin = state->TextW.Data;
4846 ImVec2 cursor_offset, select_start_offset;
4847
4848 {
4849 // Find lines numbers straddling 'cursor' (slot 0) and 'select_start' (slot 1) positions.
4850 const ImWchar* searches_input_ptr[2] = { NULL, NULL };
4851 int searches_result_line_no[2] = { -1000, -1000 };
4852 int searches_remaining = 0;
4853 if (render_cursor)
4854 {
4855 searches_input_ptr[0] = text_begin + state->Stb.cursor;
4856 searches_result_line_no[0] = -1;
4857 searches_remaining++;
4858 }
4859 if (render_selection)
4860 {
4861 searches_input_ptr[1] = text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4862 searches_result_line_no[1] = -1;
4863 searches_remaining++;
4864 }
4865
4866 // Iterate all lines to find our line numbers
4867 // In multi-line mode, we never exit the loop until all lines are counted, so add one extra to the searches_remaining counter.
4868 searches_remaining += is_multiline ? 1 : 0;
4869 int line_count = 0;
4870 //for (const ImWchar* s = text_begin; (s = (const ImWchar*)wcschr((const wchar_t*)s, (wchar_t)'\n')) != NULL; s++) // FIXME-OPT: Could use this when wchar_t are 16-bit
4871 for (const ImWchar* s = text_begin; *s != 0; s++)
4872 if (*s == '\n')
4873 {
4874 line_count++;
4875 if (searches_result_line_no[0] == -1 && s >= searches_input_ptr[0]) { searches_result_line_no[0] = line_count; if (--searches_remaining <= 0) break; }
4876 if (searches_result_line_no[1] == -1 && s >= searches_input_ptr[1]) { searches_result_line_no[1] = line_count; if (--searches_remaining <= 0) break; }
4877 }
4878 line_count++;
4879 if (searches_result_line_no[0] == -1)
4880 searches_result_line_no[0] = line_count;
4881 if (searches_result_line_no[1] == -1)
4882 searches_result_line_no[1] = line_count;
4883
4884 // Calculate 2d position by finding the beginning of the line and measuring distance
4885 cursor_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(&g, ImStrbolW(searches_input_ptr[0], text_begin), searches_input_ptr[0]).x;
4886 cursor_offset.y = searches_result_line_no[0] * g.FontSize;
4887 if (searches_result_line_no[1] >= 0)
4888 {
4889 select_start_offset.x = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(&g, ImStrbolW(searches_input_ptr[1], text_begin), searches_input_ptr[1]).x;
4890 select_start_offset.y = searches_result_line_no[1] * g.FontSize;
4891 }
4892
4893 // Store text height (note that we haven't calculated text width at all, see GitHub issues #383, #1224)
4894 if (is_multiline)
4895 text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, line_count * g.FontSize);
4896 }
4897
4898 // Scroll
4899 if (render_cursor && state->CursorFollow)
4900 {
4901 // Horizontal scroll in chunks of quarter width
4902 if (!(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoHorizontalScroll))
4903 {
4904 const float scroll_increment_x = inner_size.x * 0.25f;
4905 const float visible_width = inner_size.x - style.FramePadding.x;
4906 if (cursor_offset.x < state->ScrollX)
4907 state->ScrollX = IM_TRUNC(ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.x - scroll_increment_x));
4908 else if (cursor_offset.x - visible_width >= state->ScrollX)
4909 state->ScrollX = IM_TRUNC(cursor_offset.x - visible_width + scroll_increment_x);
4910 }
4911 else
4912 {
4913 state->ScrollX = 0.0f;
4914 }
4915
4916 // Vertical scroll
4917 if (is_multiline)
4918 {
4919 // Test if cursor is vertically visible
4920 if (cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize < scroll_y)
4921 scroll_y = ImMax(0.0f, cursor_offset.y - g.FontSize);
4922 else if (cursor_offset.y - (inner_size.y - style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f) >= scroll_y)
4923 scroll_y = cursor_offset.y - inner_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
4924 const float scroll_max_y = ImMax((text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f) - inner_size.y, 0.0f);
4925 scroll_y = ImClamp(scroll_y, 0.0f, scroll_max_y);
4926 draw_pos.y += (draw_window->Scroll.y - scroll_y); // Manipulate cursor pos immediately avoid a frame of lag
4927 draw_window->Scroll.y = scroll_y;
4928 }
4929
4930 state->CursorFollow = false;
4931 }
4932
4933 // Draw selection
4934 const ImVec2 draw_scroll = ImVec2(state->ScrollX, 0.0f);
4935 if (render_selection)
4936 {
4937 const ImWchar* text_selected_begin = text_begin + ImMin(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4938 const ImWchar* text_selected_end = text_begin + ImMax(state->Stb.select_start, state->Stb.select_end);
4939
4940 ImU32 bg_color = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TextSelectedBg, render_cursor ? 1.0f : 0.6f); // FIXME: current code flow mandate that render_cursor is always true here, we are leaving the transparent one for tests.
4941 float bg_offy_up = is_multiline ? 0.0f : -1.0f; // FIXME: those offsets should be part of the style? they don't play so well with multi-line selection.
4942 float bg_offy_dn = is_multiline ? 0.0f : 2.0f;
4943 ImVec2 rect_pos = draw_pos + select_start_offset - draw_scroll;
4944 for (const ImWchar* p = text_selected_begin; p < text_selected_end; )
4945 {
4946 if (rect_pos.y > clip_rect.w + g.FontSize)
4947 break;
4948 if (rect_pos.y < clip_rect.y)
4949 {
4950 //p = (const ImWchar*)wmemchr((const wchar_t*)p, '\n', text_selected_end - p); // FIXME-OPT: Could use this when wchar_t are 16-bit
4951 //p = p ? p + 1 : text_selected_end;
4952 while (p < text_selected_end)
4953 if (*p++ == '\n')
4954 break;
4955 }
4956 else
4957 {
4958 ImVec2 rect_size = InputTextCalcTextSizeW(&g, p, text_selected_end, &p, NULL, true);
4959 if (rect_size.x <= 0.0f) rect_size.x = IM_TRUNC(g.Font->GetCharAdvance((ImWchar)' ') * 0.50f); // So we can see selected empty lines
4960 ImRect rect(rect_pos + ImVec2(0.0f, bg_offy_up - g.FontSize), rect_pos + ImVec2(rect_size.x, bg_offy_dn));
4961 rect.ClipWith(clip_rect);
4962 if (rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
4963 draw_window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(rect.Min, rect.Max, bg_color);
4964 }
4965 rect_pos.x = draw_pos.x - draw_scroll.x;
4966 rect_pos.y += g.FontSize;
4967 }
4968 }
4969
4970 // We test for 'buf_display_max_length' as a way to avoid some pathological cases (e.g. single-line 1 MB string) which would make ImDrawList crash.
4971 if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
4972 {
4973 ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
4974 draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos - draw_scroll, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
4975 }
4976
4977 // Draw blinking cursor
4978 if (render_cursor)
4979 {
4980 state->CursorAnim += io.DeltaTime;
4981 bool cursor_is_visible = (!g.IO.ConfigInputTextCursorBlink) || (state->CursorAnim <= 0.0f) || ImFmod(state->CursorAnim, 1.20f) <= 0.80f;
4982 ImVec2 cursor_screen_pos = ImTrunc(draw_pos + cursor_offset - draw_scroll);
