4983 ImRect cursor_screen_rect(cursor_screen_pos.x, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize + 0.5f, cursor_screen_pos.x + 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - 1.5f);
4984 if (cursor_is_visible && cursor_screen_rect.Overlaps(clip_rect))
4985 draw_window->DrawList->AddLine(cursor_screen_rect.Min, cursor_screen_rect.GetBL(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
4986
4987 // Notify OS of text input position for advanced IME (-1 x offset so that Windows IME can cover our cursor. Bit of an extra nicety.)
4988 if (!is_readonly)
4989 {
4990 g.PlatformImeData.WantVisible = true;
4991 g.PlatformImeData.InputPos = ImVec2(cursor_screen_pos.x - 1.0f, cursor_screen_pos.y - g.FontSize);
4992 g.PlatformImeData.InputLineHeight = g.FontSize;
4993 }
4994 }
4995 }
4996 else
4997 {
4998 // Render text only (no selection, no cursor)
4999 if (is_multiline)
5000 text_size = ImVec2(inner_size.x, InputTextCalcTextLenAndLineCount(buf_display, &buf_display_end) * g.FontSize); // We don't need width
5001 else if (!is_displaying_hint && g.ActiveId == id)
5002 buf_display_end = buf_display + state->CurLenA;
5003 else if (!is_displaying_hint)
5004 buf_display_end = buf_display + strlen(buf_display);
5005
5006 if (is_multiline || (buf_display_end - buf_display) < buf_display_max_length)
5007 {
5008 ImU32 col = GetColorU32(is_displaying_hint ? ImGuiCol_TextDisabled : ImGuiCol_Text);
5009 draw_window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize, draw_pos, col, buf_display, buf_display_end, 0.0f, is_multiline ? NULL : &clip_rect);
5010 }
5011 }
5012
5013 if (is_password && !is_displaying_hint)
5014 PopFont();
5015
5016 if (is_multiline)
5017 {
5018 // For focus requests to work on our multiline we need to ensure our child ItemAdd() call specifies the ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable (ref issue #4761)...
5019 Dummy(ImVec2(text_size.x, text_size.y + style.FramePadding.y));
5020 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable | ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop;
5021 EndChild();
5022 item_data_backup.StatusFlags |= (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow);
5023
5024 // ...and then we need to undo the group overriding last item data, which gets a bit messy as EndGroup() tries to forward scrollbar being active...
5025 // FIXME: This quite messy/tricky, should attempt to get rid of the child window.
5026 EndGroup();
5027 if (g.LastItemData.ID == 0)
5028 {
5029 g.LastItemData.ID = id;
5030 g.LastItemData.InFlags = item_data_backup.InFlags;
5031 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = item_data_backup.StatusFlags;
5032 }
5033 }
5034
5035 // Log as text
5036 if (g.LogEnabled && (!is_password || is_displaying_hint))
5037 {
5038 LogSetNextTextDecoration("{", "}");
5039 LogRenderedText(&draw_pos, buf_display, buf_display_end);
5040 }
5041
5042 if (label_size.x > 0)
5043 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), label);
5044
5045 if (value_changed && !(flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_NoMarkEdited))
5046 MarkItemEdited(id);
5047
5048 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable);
5049 if ((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue) != 0)
5050 return validated;
5051 else
5052 return value_changed;
5053}
5054
5055void ImGui::DebugNodeInputTextState(ImGuiInputTextState* state)
5056{
5057#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
5058 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5059 ImStb::STB_TexteditState* stb_state = &state->Stb;
5060 ImStb::StbUndoState* undo_state = &stb_state->undostate;
5061 Text("ID: 0x%08X, ActiveID: 0x%08X", state->ID, g.ActiveId);
5062 DebugLocateItemOnHover(state->ID);
5063 Text("CurLenW: %d, CurLenA: %d, Cursor: %d, Selection: %d..%d", state->CurLenW, state->CurLenA, stb_state->cursor, stb_state->select_start, stb_state->select_end);
5064 Text("has_preferred_x: %d (%.2f)", stb_state->has_preferred_x, stb_state->preferred_x);
5065 Text("undo_point: %d, redo_point: %d, undo_char_point: %d, redo_char_point: %d", undo_state->undo_point, undo_state->redo_point, undo_state->undo_char_point, undo_state->redo_char_point);
5066 if (BeginChild("undopoints", ImVec2(0.0f, GetTextLineHeight() * 10), ImGuiChildFlags_Border | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY)) // Visualize undo state
5067 {
5068 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0, 0));
5069 for (int n = 0; n < IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_UNDOSTATECOUNT; n++)
5070 {
5071 ImStb::StbUndoRecord* undo_rec = &undo_state->undo_rec[n];
5072 const char undo_rec_type = (n < undo_state->undo_point) ? 'u' : (n >= undo_state->redo_point) ? 'r' : ' ';
5073 if (undo_rec_type == ' ')
5074 BeginDisabled();
5075 char buf[64] = "";
5076 if (undo_rec_type != ' ' && undo_rec->char_storage != -1)
5077 ImTextStrToUtf8(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), undo_state->undo_char + undo_rec->char_storage, undo_state->undo_char + undo_rec->char_storage + undo_rec->insert_length);
5078 Text("%c [%02d] where %03d, insert %03d, delete %03d, char_storage %03d \"%s\"",
5079 undo_rec_type, n, undo_rec->where, undo_rec->insert_length, undo_rec->delete_length, undo_rec->char_storage, buf);
5080 if (undo_rec_type == ' ')
5081 EndDisabled();
5082 }
5083 PopStyleVar();
5084 }
5085 EndChild();
5086#else
5087 IM_UNUSED(state);
5088#endif
5089}
5090
5091//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5092// [SECTION] Widgets: ColorEdit, ColorPicker, ColorButton, etc.
5093//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5094// - ColorEdit3()
5095// - ColorEdit4()
5096// - ColorPicker3()
5097// - RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard() [Internal]
5098// - ColorPicker4()
5099// - ColorButton()
5100// - SetColorEditOptions()
5101// - ColorTooltip() [Internal]
5102// - ColorEditOptionsPopup() [Internal]
5103// - ColorPickerOptionsPopup() [Internal]
5104//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
5105
5106bool ImGui::ColorEdit3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5107{
5108 return ColorEdit4(label, col, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5109}
5110
5111static void ColorEditRestoreH(const float* col, float* H)
5112{
5113 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5114 IM_ASSERT(g.ColorEditCurrentID != 0);
5115 if (g.ColorEditSavedID != g.ColorEditCurrentID || g.ColorEditSavedColor != ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0)))
5116 return;
5117 *H = g.ColorEditSavedHue;
5118}
5119
5120// ColorEdit supports RGB and HSV inputs. In case of RGB input resulting color may have undefined hue and/or saturation.
5121// Since widget displays both RGB and HSV values we must preserve hue and saturation to prevent these values resetting.
5122static void ColorEditRestoreHS(const float* col, float* H, float* S, float* V)
5123{
5124 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5125 IM_ASSERT(g.ColorEditCurrentID != 0);
5126 if (g.ColorEditSavedID != g.ColorEditCurrentID || g.ColorEditSavedColor != ImGui::ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0)))
5127 return;
5128
5129 // When S == 0, H is undefined.
5130 // When H == 1 it wraps around to 0.
5131 if (*S == 0.0f || (*H == 0.0f && g.ColorEditSavedHue == 1))
5132 *H = g.ColorEditSavedHue;
5133
5134 // When V == 0, S is undefined.
5135 if (*V == 0.0f)
5136 *S = g.ColorEditSavedSat;
5137}
5138
5139// Edit colors components (each component in 0.0f..1.0f range).
5140// See enum ImGuiColorEditFlags_ for available options. e.g. Only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5141// With typical options: Left-click on color square to open color picker. Right-click to open option menu. CTRL-Click over input fields to edit them and TAB to go to next item.
5142bool ImGui::ColorEdit4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5143{
5144 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5145 if (window->SkipItems)
5146 return false;
5147
5148 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5149 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5150 const float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
5151 const char* label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
5152 float w_full = CalcItemWidth();
5153 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5154
5155 BeginGroup();
5156 PushID(label);
5157 const bool set_current_color_edit_id = (g.ColorEditCurrentID == 0);
5158 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5159 g.ColorEditCurrentID = window->IDStack.back();
5160
5161 // If we're not showing any slider there's no point in doing any HSV conversions
5162 const ImGuiColorEditFlags flags_untouched = flags;
5163 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs)
5164 flags = (flags & (~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions;
5165
5166 // Context menu: display and modify options (before defaults are applied)
5167 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5168 ColorEditOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5169
5170 // Read stored options
5171 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_))
5172 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
5173 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_))
5174 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
5175 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5176 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5177 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5178 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_);
5179 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_));
5180 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5181 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5182
5183 const bool alpha = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) == 0;
5184 const bool hdr = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR) != 0;
5185 const int components = alpha ? 4 : 3;
5186 const float w_button = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview) ? 0.0f : (square_sz + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5187 const float w_inputs = ImMax(w_full - w_button, 1.0f);
5188 w_full = w_inputs + w_button;
5189
5190 // Convert to the formats we need
5191 float f[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f };
5192 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
5193 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5194 else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV))
5195 {
5196 // Hue is lost when converting from grayscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5197 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5198 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &f[0], &f[1], &f[2]);
5199 }
5200 int i[4] = { IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[0]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[1]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[2]), IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(f[3]) };
5201
5202 bool value_changed = false;
5203 bool value_changed_as_float = false;
5204
5205 const ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5206 const float inputs_offset_x = (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left) ? w_button : 0.0f;
5207 window->DC.CursorPos.x = pos.x + inputs_offset_x;
5208
5209 if ((flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV)) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5210 {
5211 // RGB/HSV 0..255 Sliders
5212 const float w_items = w_inputs - style.ItemInnerSpacing.x * (components - 1);
5213
5214 const bool hide_prefix = (IM_TRUNC(w_items / components) <= CalcTextSize((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) ? "M:0.000" : "M:000").x);
5215 static const char* ids[4] = { "##X", "##Y", "##Z", "##W" };
5216 static const char* fmt_table_int[3][4] =
5217 {
5218 { "%3d", "%3d", "%3d", "%3d" }, // Short display
5219 { "R:%3d", "G:%3d", "B:%3d", "A:%3d" }, // Long display for RGBA
5220 { "H:%3d", "S:%3d", "V:%3d", "A:%3d" } // Long display for HSVA
5221 };
5222 static const char* fmt_table_float[3][4] =
5223 {
5224 { "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f", "%0.3f" }, // Short display
5225 { "R:%0.3f", "G:%0.3f", "B:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" }, // Long display for RGBA
5226 { "H:%0.3f", "S:%0.3f", "V:%0.3f", "A:%0.3f" } // Long display for HSVA
5227 };
5228 const int fmt_idx = hide_prefix ? 0 : (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) ? 2 : 1;
5229
5230 float prev_split = 0.0f;
5231 for (int n = 0; n < components; n++)
5232 {
5233 if (n > 0)
5234 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5235 float next_split = IM_TRUNC(w_items * (n + 1) / components);
5236 SetNextItemWidth(ImMax(next_split - prev_split, 1.0f));
5237 prev_split = next_split;
5238
5239 // FIXME: When ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR flag is passed HS values snap in weird ways when SV values go below 0.
5240 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float)
5241 {
5242 value_changed |= DragFloat(ids[n], &f[n], 1.0f / 255.0f, 0.0f, hdr ? 0.0f : 1.0f, fmt_table_float[fmt_idx][n]);
5243 value_changed_as_float |= value_changed;
5244 }
5245 else
5246 {
5247 value_changed |= DragInt(ids[n], &i[n], 1.0f, 0, hdr ? 0 : 255, fmt_table_int[fmt_idx][n]);
5248 }
5249 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5250 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5251 }
5252 }
5253 else if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0 && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5254 {
5255 // RGB Hexadecimal Input
5256 char buf[64];
5257 if (alpha)
5258 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[3], 0, 255));
5259 else
5260 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", ImClamp(i[0], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[1], 0, 255), ImClamp(i[2], 0, 255));
5261 SetNextItemWidth(w_inputs);
5262 if (InputText("##Text", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase))
5263 {
5264 value_changed = true;
5265 char* p = buf;
5266 while (*p == '#' || ImCharIsBlankA(*p))
5267 p++;
5268 i[0] = i[1] = i[2] = 0;
5269 i[3] = 0xFF; // alpha default to 255 is not parsed by scanf (e.g. inputting #FFFFFF omitting alpha)
5270 int r;
5271 if (alpha)
5272 r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int*)&i[0], (unsigned int*)&i[1], (unsigned int*)&i[2], (unsigned int*)&i[3]); // Treat at unsigned (%X is unsigned)
5273 else
5274 r = sscanf(p, "%02X%02X%02X", (unsigned int*)&i[0], (unsigned int*)&i[1], (unsigned int*)&i[2]);
5275 IM_UNUSED(r); // Fixes C6031: Return value ignored: 'sscanf'.
5276 }
5277 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5278 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5279 }
5280
5281 ImGuiWindow* picker_active_window = NULL;
5282 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview))
5283 {
5284 const float button_offset_x = ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) || (style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)) ? 0.0f : w_inputs + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5285 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(pos.x + button_offset_x, pos.y);
5286
5287 const ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], alpha ? col[3] : 1.0f);
5288 if (ColorButton("##ColorButton", col_v4, flags))
5289 {
5290 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker))
5291 {
5292 // Store current color and open a picker
5293 g.ColorPickerRef = col_v4;
5294 OpenPopup("picker");
5295 SetNextWindowPos(g.LastItemData.Rect.GetBL() + ImVec2(0.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
5296 }
5297 }
5298 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5299 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5300
5301 if (BeginPopup("picker"))
5302 {
5303 if (g.CurrentWindow->BeginCount == 1)
5304 {
5305 picker_active_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5306 if (label != label_display_end)
5307 {
5308 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5309 Spacing();
5310 }
5311 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar;
5312 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = (flags_untouched & picker_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
5313 SetNextItemWidth(square_sz * 12.0f); // Use 256 + bar sizes?
5314 value_changed |= ColorPicker4("##picker", col, picker_flags, &g.ColorPickerRef.x);
5315 }
5316 EndPopup();
5317 }
5318 }
5319
5320 if (label != label_display_end && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5321 {
5322 // Position not necessarily next to last submitted button (e.g. if style.ColorButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left),
5323 // but we need to use SameLine() to setup baseline correctly. Might want to refactor SameLine() to simplify this.
5324 SameLine(0.0f, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5325 window->DC.CursorPos.x = pos.x + ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) ? w_button : w_full + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5326 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5327 }
5328
5329 // Convert back
5330 if (value_changed && picker_active_window == NULL)
5331 {
5332 if (!value_changed_as_float)
5333 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5334 f[n] = i[n] / 255.0f;
5335 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
5336 {
5337 g.ColorEditSavedHue = f[0];
5338 g.ColorEditSavedSat = f[1];
5339 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5340 g.ColorEditSavedID = g.ColorEditCurrentID;
5341 g.ColorEditSavedColor = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(f[0], f[1], f[2], 0));
5342 }
5343 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5344 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(f[0], f[1], f[2], f[0], f[1], f[2]);
5345
5346 col[0] = f[0];
5347 col[1] = f[1];
5348 col[2] = f[2];
5349 if (alpha)
5350 col[3] = f[3];
5351 }
5352
5353 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5354 g.ColorEditCurrentID = 0;
5355 PopID();
5356 EndGroup();
5357
5358 // Drag and Drop Target
5359 // NB: The flag test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropTarget() does the same test.
5360 if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) && !(g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropTarget())
5361 {
5362 bool accepted_drag_drop = false;
5363 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F))
5364 {
5365 memcpy((float*)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * 3); // Preserve alpha if any //-V512 //-V1086
5366 value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5367 }
5368 if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = AcceptDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F))
5369 {
5370 memcpy((float*)col, payload->Data, sizeof(float) * components);
5371 value_changed = accepted_drag_drop = true;
5372 }
5373
5374 // Drag-drop payloads are always RGB
5375 if (accepted_drag_drop && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV))
5376 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5377 EndDragDropTarget();
5378 }
5379
5380 // When picker is being actively used, use its active id so IsItemActive() will function on ColorEdit4().
5381 if (picker_active_window && g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow == picker_active_window)
5382 g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveId;
5383
5384 if (value_changed && g.LastItemData.ID != 0) // In case of ID collision, the second EndGroup() won't catch g.ActiveId
5385 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
5386
5387 return value_changed;
5388}
5389
5390bool ImGui::ColorPicker3(const char* label, float col[3], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5391{
5392 float col4[4] = { col[0], col[1], col[2], 1.0f };
5393 if (!ColorPicker4(label, col4, flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
5394 return false;
5395 col[0] = col4[0]; col[1] = col4[1]; col[2] = col4[2];
5396 return true;
5397}
5398
5399// Helper for ColorPicker4()
5400static void RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(ImDrawList* draw_list, ImVec2 pos, ImVec2 half_sz, float bar_w, float alpha)
5401{
5402 ImU32 alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha);
5403 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x + 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(0,0,0,alpha8));
5404 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Right, IM_COL32(255,255,255,alpha8));
5405 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x - 1, pos.y), ImVec2(half_sz.x + 2, half_sz.y + 1), ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(0,0,0,alpha8));
5406 ImGui::RenderArrowPointingAt(draw_list, ImVec2(pos.x + bar_w - half_sz.x, pos.y), half_sz, ImGuiDir_Left, IM_COL32(255,255,255,alpha8));
5407}
5408
5409// Note: ColorPicker4() only accesses 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5410// (In C++ the 'float col[4]' notation for a function argument is equivalent to 'float* col', we only specify a size to facilitate understanding of the code.)
5411// FIXME: we adjust the big color square height based on item width, which may cause a flickering feedback loop (if automatic height makes a vertical scrollbar appears, affecting automatic width..)
5412// FIXME: this is trying to be aware of style.Alpha but not fully correct. Also, the color wheel will have overlapping glitches with (style.Alpha < 1.0)
5413bool ImGui::ColorPicker4(const char* label, float col[4], ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, const float* ref_col)
5414{
5415 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5416 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5417 if (window->SkipItems)
5418 return false;
5419
5420 ImDrawList* draw_list = window->DrawList;
5421 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5422 ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
5423
5424 const float width = CalcItemWidth();
5425 const bool is_readonly = ((g.NextItemData.ItemFlags | g.CurrentItemFlags) & ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly) != 0;
5426 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
5427
5428 PushID(label);
5429 const bool set_current_color_edit_id = (g.ColorEditCurrentID == 0);
5430 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5431 g.ColorEditCurrentID = window->IDStack.back();
5432 BeginGroup();
5433
5434 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5435 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview;
5436
5437 // Context menu: display and store options.
5438 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5439 ColorPickerOptionsPopup(col, flags);
5440
5441 // Read stored options
5442 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_))
5443 flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
5444 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5445 flags |= ((g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) ? g.ColorEditOptions : ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_) & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
5446 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5447 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check that only 1 is selected
5448 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5449 flags |= (g.ColorEditOptions & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5450
5451 // Setup
5452 int components = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4;
5453 bool alpha_bar = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5454 ImVec2 picker_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
5455 float square_sz = GetFrameHeight();
5456 float bars_width = square_sz; // Arbitrary smallish width of Hue/Alpha picking bars
5457 float sv_picker_size = ImMax(bars_width * 1, width - (alpha_bar ? 2 : 1) * (bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x)); // Saturation/Value picking box
5458 float bar0_pos_x = picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5459 float bar1_pos_x = bar0_pos_x + bars_width + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5460 float bars_triangles_half_sz = IM_TRUNC(bars_width * 0.20f);
5461
5462 float backup_initial_col[4];
5463 memcpy(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float));
5464
5465 float wheel_thickness = sv_picker_size * 0.08f;
5466 float wheel_r_outer = sv_picker_size * 0.50f;
5467 float wheel_r_inner = wheel_r_outer - wheel_thickness;
5468 ImVec2 wheel_center(picker_pos.x + (sv_picker_size + bars_width)*0.5f, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size * 0.5f);
5469
5470 // Note: the triangle is displayed rotated with triangle_pa pointing to Hue, but most coordinates stays unrotated for logic.
5471 float triangle_r = wheel_r_inner - (int)(sv_picker_size * 0.027f);
5472 ImVec2 triangle_pa = ImVec2(triangle_r, 0.0f); // Hue point.
5473 ImVec2 triangle_pb = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * -0.866025f); // Black point.
5474 ImVec2 triangle_pc = ImVec2(triangle_r * -0.5f, triangle_r * +0.866025f); // White point.
5475
5476 float H = col[0], S = col[1], V = col[2];
5477 float R = col[0], G = col[1], B = col[2];
5478 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5479 {
5480 // Hue is lost when converting from grayscale rgb (saturation=0). Restore it.
5481 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
5482 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &H, &S, &V);
5483 }
5484 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5485 {
5486 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
5487 }
5488
5489 bool value_changed = false, value_changed_h = false, value_changed_sv = false;
5490
5491 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav, true);
5492 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
5493 {
5494 // Hue wheel + SV triangle logic
5495 InvisibleButton("hsv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5496 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5497 {
5498 ImVec2 initial_off = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - wheel_center;
5499 ImVec2 current_off = g.IO.MousePos - wheel_center;
5500 float initial_dist2 = ImLengthSqr(initial_off);
5501 if (initial_dist2 >= (wheel_r_inner - 1) * (wheel_r_inner - 1) && initial_dist2 <= (wheel_r_outer + 1) * (wheel_r_outer + 1))
5502 {
5503 // Interactive with Hue wheel
5504 H = ImAtan2(current_off.y, current_off.x) / IM_PI * 0.5f;
5505 if (H < 0.0f)
5506 H += 1.0f;
5507 value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5508 }
5509 float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5510 float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(-H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5511 if (ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, ImRotate(initial_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle)))
5512 {
5513 // Interacting with SV triangle
5514 ImVec2 current_off_unrotated = ImRotate(current_off, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5515 if (!ImTriangleContainsPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated))
5516 current_off_unrotated = ImTriangleClosestPoint(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated);
5517 float uu, vv, ww;
5518 ImTriangleBarycentricCoords(triangle_pa, triangle_pb, triangle_pc, current_off_unrotated, uu, vv, ww);
5519 V = ImClamp(1.0f - vv, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5520 S = ImClamp(uu / V, 0.0001f, 1.0f);
5521 value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5522 }
5523 }
5524 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5525 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5526 }
5527 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
5528 {
5529 // SV rectangle logic
5530 InvisibleButton("sv", ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size));
5531 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5532 {
5533 S = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.x - picker_pos.x) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5534 V = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5535 ColorEditRestoreH(col, &H); // Greatly reduces hue jitter and reset to 0 when hue == 255 and color is rapidly modified using SV square.
5536 value_changed = value_changed_sv = true;
5537 }
5538 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions))
5539 OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5540
5541 // Hue bar logic
5542 SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5543 InvisibleButton("hue", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5544 if (IsItemActive() && !is_readonly)
5545 {
5546 H = ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5547 value_changed = value_changed_h = true;
5548 }
5549 }
5550
5551 // Alpha bar logic
5552 if (alpha_bar)
5553 {
5554 SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y));
5555 InvisibleButton("alpha", ImVec2(bars_width, sv_picker_size));
5556 if (IsItemActive())
5557 {
5558 col[3] = 1.0f - ImSaturate((io.MousePos.y - picker_pos.y) / (sv_picker_size - 1));
5559 value_changed = true;
5560 }
5561 }
5562 PopItemFlag(); // ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav
5563
5564 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5565 {
5566 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5567 BeginGroup();
5568 }
5569
5570 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5571 {
5572 const char* label_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
5573 if (label != label_display_end)
5574 {
5575 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5576 SameLine(0, style.ItemInnerSpacing.x);
5577 TextEx(label, label_display_end);
5578 }
5579 }
5580
5581 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview))
5582 {
5583 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus, true);
5584 ImVec4 col_v4(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5585 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel))
5586 Text("Current");
5587
5588 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip;
5589 ColorButton("##current", col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2));
5590 if (ref_col != NULL)
5591 {
5592 Text("Original");
5593 ImVec4 ref_col_v4(ref_col[0], ref_col[1], ref_col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : ref_col[3]);
5594 if (ColorButton("##original", ref_col_v4, (flags & sub_flags_to_forward), ImVec2(square_sz * 3, square_sz * 2)))
5595 {
5596 memcpy(col, ref_col, components * sizeof(float));
5597 value_changed = true;
5598 }
5599 }
5600 PopItemFlag();
5601 EndGroup();
5602 }
5603
5604 // Convert back color to RGB
5605 if (value_changed_h || value_changed_sv)
5606 {
5607 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5608 {
5609 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5610 g.ColorEditSavedHue = H;
5611 g.ColorEditSavedSat = S;
5612 g.ColorEditSavedID = g.ColorEditCurrentID;
5613 g.ColorEditSavedColor = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(col[0], col[1], col[2], 0));
5614 }
5615 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5616 {
5617 col[0] = H;
5618 col[1] = S;
5619 col[2] = V;
5620 }
5621 }
5622
5623 // R,G,B and H,S,V slider color editor
5624 bool value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = false;
5625 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs) == 0)
5626 {
5627 PushItemWidth((alpha_bar ? bar1_pos_x : bar0_pos_x) + bars_width - picker_pos.x);
5628 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags_to_forward = ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_HDR | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSmallPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf;
5629 ImGuiColorEditFlags sub_flags = (flags & sub_flags_to_forward) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoPicker;
5630 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5631 if (ColorEdit4("##rgb", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB))
5632 {
5633 // FIXME: Hackily differentiating using the DragInt (ActiveId != 0 && !ActiveIdAllowOverlap) vs. using the InputText or DropTarget.
5634 // For the later we don't want to run the hue-wrap canceling code. If you are well versed in HSV picker please provide your input! (See #2050)
5635 value_changed_fix_hue_wrap = (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap);
5636 value_changed = true;
5637 }
5638 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5639 value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hsv", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV);
5640 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex || (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5641 value_changed |= ColorEdit4("##hex", col, sub_flags | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex);
5642 PopItemWidth();
5643 }
5644
5645 // Try to cancel hue wrap (after ColorEdit4 call), if any
5646 if (value_changed_fix_hue_wrap && (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB))
5647 {
5648 float new_H, new_S, new_V;
5649 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(col[0], col[1], col[2], new_H, new_S, new_V);
5650 if (new_H <= 0 && H > 0)
5651 {
5652 if (new_V <= 0 && V != new_V)
5653 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, new_V <= 0 ? V * 0.5f : new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5654 else if (new_S <= 0)
5655 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, new_S <= 0 ? S * 0.5f : new_S, new_V, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5656 }
5657 }
5658
5659 if (value_changed)
5660 {
5661 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB)
5662 {
5663 R = col[0];
5664 G = col[1];
5665 B = col[2];
5666 ColorConvertRGBtoHSV(R, G, B, H, S, V);
5667 ColorEditRestoreHS(col, &H, &S, &V); // Fix local Hue as display below will use it immediately.
5668 }
5669 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5670 {
5671 H = col[0];
5672 S = col[1];
5673 V = col[2];
5674 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, S, V, R, G, B);
5675 }
5676 }
5677
5678 const int style_alpha8 = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(style.Alpha);
5679 const ImU32 col_black = IM_COL32(0,0,0,style_alpha8);
5680 const ImU32 col_white = IM_COL32(255,255,255,style_alpha8);
5681 const ImU32 col_midgrey = IM_COL32(128,128,128,style_alpha8);
5682 const ImU32 col_hues[6 + 1] = { IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,0,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,255,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(0,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,255,style_alpha8), IM_COL32(255,0,0,style_alpha8) };
5683
5684 ImVec4 hue_color_f(1, 1, 1, style.Alpha); ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(H, 1, 1, hue_color_f.x, hue_color_f.y, hue_color_f.z);
5685 ImU32 hue_color32 = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(hue_color_f);
5686 ImU32 user_col32_striped_of_alpha = ColorConvertFloat4ToU32(ImVec4(R, G, B, style.Alpha)); // Important: this is still including the main rendering/style alpha!!
5687
5688 ImVec2 sv_cursor_pos;
5689
5690 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel)
5691 {
5692 // Render Hue Wheel
5693 const float aeps = 0.5f / wheel_r_outer; // Half a pixel arc length in radians (2pi cancels out).
5694 const int segment_per_arc = ImMax(4, (int)wheel_r_outer / 12);
5695 for (int n = 0; n < 6; n++)
5696 {
5697 const float a0 = (n) /6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI - aeps;
5698 const float a1 = (n+1.0f)/6.0f * 2.0f * IM_PI + aeps;
5699 const int vert_start_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
5700 draw_list->PathArcTo(wheel_center, (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer)*0.5f, a0, a1, segment_per_arc);
5701 draw_list->PathStroke(col_white, 0, wheel_thickness);
5702 const int vert_end_idx = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size;
5703
5704 // Paint colors over existing vertices
5705 ImVec2 gradient_p0(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a0) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a0) * wheel_r_inner);
5706 ImVec2 gradient_p1(wheel_center.x + ImCos(a1) * wheel_r_inner, wheel_center.y + ImSin(a1) * wheel_r_inner);
5707 ShadeVertsLinearColorGradientKeepAlpha(draw_list, vert_start_idx, vert_end_idx, gradient_p0, gradient_p1, col_hues[n], col_hues[n + 1]);
5708 }
5709
5710 // Render Cursor + preview on Hue Wheel
5711 float cos_hue_angle = ImCos(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5712 float sin_hue_angle = ImSin(H * 2.0f * IM_PI);
5713 ImVec2 hue_cursor_pos(wheel_center.x + cos_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f, wheel_center.y + sin_hue_angle * (wheel_r_inner + wheel_r_outer) * 0.5f);
5714 float hue_cursor_rad = value_changed_h ? wheel_thickness * 0.65f : wheel_thickness * 0.55f;
5715 int hue_cursor_segments = draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(hue_cursor_rad); // Lock segment count so the +1 one matches others.
5716 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, hue_color32, hue_cursor_segments);
5717 draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, hue_cursor_segments);
5718 draw_list->AddCircle(hue_cursor_pos, hue_cursor_rad, col_white, hue_cursor_segments);
5719
5720 // Render SV triangle (rotated according to hue)
5721 ImVec2 tra = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pa, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5722 ImVec2 trb = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pb, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5723 ImVec2 trc = wheel_center + ImRotate(triangle_pc, cos_hue_angle, sin_hue_angle);
5724 ImVec2 uv_white = GetFontTexUvWhitePixel();
5725 draw_list->PrimReserve(3, 3);
5726 draw_list->PrimVtx(tra, uv_white, hue_color32);
5727 draw_list->PrimVtx(trb, uv_white, col_black);
5728 draw_list->PrimVtx(trc, uv_white, col_white);
5729 draw_list->AddTriangle(tra, trb, trc, col_midgrey, 1.5f);
5730 sv_cursor_pos = ImLerp(ImLerp(trc, tra, ImSaturate(S)), trb, ImSaturate(1 - V));
5731 }
5732 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar)
5733 {
5734 // Render SV Square
5735 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), col_white, hue_color32, hue_color32, col_white);
5736 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0, 0, col_black, col_black);
5737 RenderFrameBorder(picker_pos, picker_pos + ImVec2(sv_picker_size, sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
5738 sv_cursor_pos.x = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.x + ImSaturate(S) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.x + 2, picker_pos.x + sv_picker_size - 2); // Sneakily prevent the circle to stick out too much
5739 sv_cursor_pos.y = ImClamp(IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + ImSaturate(1 - V) * sv_picker_size), picker_pos.y + 2, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size - 2);
5740
5741 // Render Hue Bar
5742 for (int i = 0; i < 6; ++i)
5743 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y + i * (sv_picker_size / 6)), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + (i + 1) * (sv_picker_size / 6)), col_hues[i], col_hues[i], col_hues[i + 1], col_hues[i + 1]);
5744 float bar0_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + H * sv_picker_size);
5745 RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2(bar0_pos_x, picker_pos.y), ImVec2(bar0_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size), 0.0f);
5746 RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar0_pos_x - 1, bar0_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
5747 }
5748
5749 // Render cursor/preview circle (clamp S/V within 0..1 range because floating points colors may lead HSV values to be out of range)
5750 float sv_cursor_rad = value_changed_sv ? wheel_thickness * 0.55f : wheel_thickness * 0.40f;
5751 int sv_cursor_segments = draw_list->_CalcCircleAutoSegmentCount(sv_cursor_rad); // Lock segment count so the +1 one matches others.
5752 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, sv_cursor_segments);
5753 draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad + 1, col_midgrey, sv_cursor_segments);
5754 draw_list->AddCircle(sv_cursor_pos, sv_cursor_rad, col_white, sv_cursor_segments);
5755
5756 // Render alpha bar
5757 if (alpha_bar)
5758 {
5759 float alpha = ImSaturate(col[3]);
5760 ImRect bar1_bb(bar1_pos_x, picker_pos.y, bar1_pos_x + bars_width, picker_pos.y + sv_picker_size);
5761 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(draw_list, bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0, bar1_bb.GetWidth() / 2.0f, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
5762 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK, user_col32_striped_of_alpha & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK);
5763 float bar1_line_y = IM_ROUND(picker_pos.y + (1.0f - alpha) * sv_picker_size);
5764 RenderFrameBorder(bar1_bb.Min, bar1_bb.Max, 0.0f);
5765 RenderArrowsForVerticalBar(draw_list, ImVec2(bar1_pos_x - 1, bar1_line_y), ImVec2(bars_triangles_half_sz + 1, bars_triangles_half_sz), bars_width + 2.0f, style.Alpha);
5766 }
5767
5768 EndGroup();
5769
5770 if (value_changed && memcmp(backup_initial_col, col, components * sizeof(float)) == 0)
5771 value_changed = false;
5772 if (value_changed && g.LastItemData.ID != 0) // In case of ID collision, the second EndGroup() won't catch g.ActiveId
5773 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
5774
5775 if (set_current_color_edit_id)
5776 g.ColorEditCurrentID = 0;
5777 PopID();
5778
5779 return value_changed;
5780}
5781
5782// A little color square. Return true when clicked.
5783// FIXME: May want to display/ignore the alpha component in the color display? Yet show it in the tooltip.
5784// 'desc_id' is not called 'label' because we don't display it next to the button, but only in the tooltip.
5785// Note that 'col' may be encoded in HSV if ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV is set.
5786bool ImGui::ColorButton(const char* desc_id, const ImVec4& col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
5787{
5788 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5789 if (window->SkipItems)
5790 return false;
5791
5792 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5793 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(desc_id);
5794 const float default_size = GetFrameHeight();
5795 const ImVec2 size(size_arg.x == 0.0f ? default_size : size_arg.x, size_arg.y == 0.0f ? default_size : size_arg.y);
5796 const ImRect bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size);
5797 ItemSize(bb, (size.y >= default_size) ? g.Style.FramePadding.y : 0.0f);
5798 if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
5799 return false;
5800
5801 bool hovered, held;
5802 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held);
5803
5804 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5805 flags &= ~(ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf);
5806
5807 ImVec4 col_rgb = col;
5808 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5809 ColorConvertHSVtoRGB(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z);
5810
5811 ImVec4 col_rgb_without_alpha(col_rgb.x, col_rgb.y, col_rgb.z, 1.0f);
5812 float grid_step = ImMin(size.x, size.y) / 2.99f;
5813 float rounding = ImMin(g.Style.FrameRounding, grid_step * 0.5f);
5814 ImRect bb_inner = bb;
5815 float off = 0.0f;
5816 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
5817 {
5818 off = -0.75f; // The border (using Col_FrameBg) tends to look off when color is near-opaque and rounding is enabled. This offset seemed like a good middle ground to reduce those artifacts.
5819 bb_inner.Expand(off);
5820 }
5821 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf) && col_rgb.w < 1.0f)
5822 {
5823 float mid_x = IM_ROUND((bb_inner.Min.x + bb_inner.Max.x) * 0.5f);
5824 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, ImVec2(bb_inner.Min.x + grid_step, bb_inner.Min.y), bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_rgb), grid_step, ImVec2(-grid_step + off, off), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersRight);
5825 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, ImVec2(mid_x, bb_inner.Max.y), GetColorU32(col_rgb_without_alpha), rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersLeft);
5826 }
5827 else
5828 {
5829 // Because GetColorU32() multiplies by the global style Alpha and we don't want to display a checkerboard if the source code had no alpha
5830 ImVec4 col_source = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview) ? col_rgb : col_rgb_without_alpha;
5831 if (col_source.w < 1.0f)
5832 RenderColorRectWithAlphaCheckerboard(window->DrawList, bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), grid_step, ImVec2(off, off), rounding);
5833 else
5834 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb_inner.Min, bb_inner.Max, GetColorU32(col_source), rounding);
5835 }
5836 RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
5837 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoBorder) == 0)
5838 {
5839 if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f)
5840 RenderFrameBorder(bb.Min, bb.Max, rounding);
5841 else
5842 window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), rounding); // Color button are often in need of some sort of border
5843 }
5844
5845 // Drag and Drop Source
5846 // NB: The ActiveId test is merely an optional micro-optimization, BeginDragDropSource() does the same test.
5847 if (g.ActiveId == id && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop) && BeginDragDropSource())
5848 {
5849 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5850 SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 3, ImGuiCond_Once);
5851 else
5852 SetDragDropPayload(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F, &col_rgb, sizeof(float) * 4, ImGuiCond_Once);
5853 ColorButton(desc_id, col, flags);
5854 SameLine();
5855 TextEx("Color");
5856 EndDragDropSource();
5857 }
5858
5859 // Tooltip
5860 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip) && hovered && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip))
5861 ColorTooltip(desc_id, &col.x, flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf));
5862
5863 return pressed;
5864}
5865
5866// Initialize/override default color options
5867void ImGui::SetColorEditOptions(ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5868{
5869 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5870 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) == 0)
5871 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_;
5872 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) == 0)
5873 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_;
5874 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) == 0)
5875 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_;
5876 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_) == 0)
5877 flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_DefaultOptions_ & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_;
5878 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5879 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5880 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5881 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_)); // Check only 1 option is selected
5882 g.ColorEditOptions = flags;
5883}
5884
5885// Note: only access 3 floats if ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha flag is set.
5886void ImGui::ColorTooltip(const char* text, const float* col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5887{
5888 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5889
5890 if (!BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePrevious, ImGuiWindowFlags_None))
5891 return;
5892 const char* text_end = text ? FindRenderedTextEnd(text, NULL) : text;
5893 if (text_end > text)
5894 {
5895 TextEx(text, text_end);
5896 Separator();
5897 }
5898
5899 ImVec2 sz(g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2, g.FontSize * 3 + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
5900 ImVec4 cf(col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5901 int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
5902 ColorButton("##preview", cf, (flags & (ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_ | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreview | ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaPreviewHalf)) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip, sz);
5903 SameLine();
5904 if ((flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputRGB) || !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputMask_))
5905 {
5906 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5907 Text("#%02X%02X%02X\nR: %d, G: %d, B: %d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, cr, cg, cb, col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5908 else
5909 Text("#%02X%02X%02X%02X\nR:%d, G:%d, B:%d, A:%d\n(%.3f, %.3f, %.3f, %.3f)", cr, cg, cb, ca, cr, cg, cb, ca, col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
5910 }
5911 else if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_InputHSV)
5912 {
5913 if (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha)
5914 Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2]);
5915 else
5916 Text("H: %.3f, S: %.3f, V: %.3f, A: %.3f", col[0], col[1], col[2], col[3]);
5917 }
5918 EndTooltip();
5919}
5920
5921void ImGui::ColorEditOptionsPopup(const float* col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5922{
5923 bool allow_opt_inputs = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_);
5924 bool allow_opt_datatype = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_);
5925 if ((!allow_opt_inputs && !allow_opt_datatype) || !BeginPopup("context"))
5926 return;
5927 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5928 g.LockMarkEdited++;
5929 ImGuiColorEditFlags opts = g.ColorEditOptions;
5930 if (allow_opt_inputs)
5931 {
5932 if (RadioButton("RGB", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayRGB;
5933 if (RadioButton("HSV", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHSV;
5934 if (RadioButton("Hex", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_DisplayHex;
5935 }
5936 if (allow_opt_datatype)
5937 {
5938 if (allow_opt_inputs) Separator();
5939 if (RadioButton("0..255", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Uint8;
5940 if (RadioButton("0.00..1.00", (opts & ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float) != 0)) opts = (opts & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_DataTypeMask_) | ImGuiColorEditFlags_Float;
5941 }
5942
5943 if (allow_opt_inputs || allow_opt_datatype)
5944 Separator();
5945 if (Button("Copy as..", ImVec2(-1, 0)))
5946 OpenPopup("Copy");
5947 if (BeginPopup("Copy"))
5948 {
5949 int cr = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[0]), cg = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[1]), cb = IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[2]), ca = (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 255 : IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(col[3]);
5950 char buf[64];
5951 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff, %.3ff)", col[0], col[1], col[2], (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 1.0f : col[3]);
5952 if (Selectable(buf))
5953 SetClipboardText(buf);
5954 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%d,%d,%d,%d)", cr, cg, cb, ca);
5955 if (Selectable(buf))
5956 SetClipboardText(buf);
5957 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb);
5958 if (Selectable(buf))
5959 SetClipboardText(buf);
5960 if (!(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha))
5961 {
5962 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "#%02X%02X%02X%02X", cr, cg, cb, ca);
5963 if (Selectable(buf))
5964 SetClipboardText(buf);
5965 }
5966 EndPopup();
5967 }
5968
5969 g.ColorEditOptions = opts;
5970 EndPopup();
5971 g.LockMarkEdited--;
5972}
5973
5974void ImGui::ColorPickerOptionsPopup(const float* ref_col, ImGuiColorEditFlags flags)
5975{
5976 bool allow_opt_picker = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5977 bool allow_opt_alpha_bar = !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) && !(flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
5978 if ((!allow_opt_picker && !allow_opt_alpha_bar) || !BeginPopup("context"))
5979 return;
5980 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5981 g.LockMarkEdited++;
5982 if (allow_opt_picker)
5983 {
5984 ImVec2 picker_size(g.FontSize * 8, ImMax(g.FontSize * 8 - (GetFrameHeight() + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x), 1.0f)); // FIXME: Picker size copied from main picker function
5985 PushItemWidth(picker_size.x);
5986 for (int picker_type = 0; picker_type < 2; picker_type++)
5987 {
5988 // Draw small/thumbnail version of each picker type (over an invisible button for selection)
5989 if (picker_type > 0) Separator();
5990 PushID(picker_type);
5991 ImGuiColorEditFlags picker_flags = ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoOptions | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoLabel | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoSidePreview | (flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha);
5992 if (picker_type == 0) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueBar;
5993 if (picker_type == 1) picker_flags |= ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerHueWheel;
5994 ImVec2 backup_pos = GetCursorScreenPos();
5995 if (Selectable("##selectable", false, 0, picker_size)) // By default, Selectable() is closing popup
5996 g.ColorEditOptions = (g.ColorEditOptions & ~ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_) | (picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_PickerMask_);
5997 SetCursorScreenPos(backup_pos);
5998 ImVec4 previewing_ref_col;
5999 memcpy(&previewing_ref_col, ref_col, sizeof(float) * ((picker_flags & ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoAlpha) ? 3 : 4));
6000 ColorPicker4("##previewing_picker", &previewing_ref_col.x, picker_flags);
6001 PopID();
6002 }
6003 PopItemWidth();
6004 }
6005 if (allow_opt_alpha_bar)
6006 {
6007 if (allow_opt_picker) Separator();
6008 CheckboxFlags("Alpha Bar", &g.ColorEditOptions, ImGuiColorEditFlags_AlphaBar);
6009 }
6010 EndPopup();
6011 g.LockMarkEdited--;
6012}
6013
6014//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6015// [SECTION] Widgets: TreeNode, CollapsingHeader, etc.
6016//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6017// - TreeNode()
6018// - TreeNodeV()
6019// - TreeNodeEx()
6020// - TreeNodeExV()
6021// - TreeNodeBehavior() [Internal]
6022// - TreePush()
6023// - TreePop()
6024// - GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
6025// - SetNextItemOpen()
6026// - CollapsingHeader()
6027//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6028
6029bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, ...)
6030{
6031 va_list args;
6032 va_start(args, fmt);
6033 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
6034 va_end(args);
6035 return is_open;
6036}
6037
6038bool ImGui::TreeNode(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, ...)
6039{
6040 va_list args;
6041 va_start(args, fmt);
6042 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
6043 va_end(args);
6044 return is_open;
6045}
6046
6047bool ImGui::TreeNode(const char* label)
6048{
6049 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6050 if (window->SkipItems)
6051 return false;
6052 return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), 0, label, NULL);
6053}
6054
6055bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const char* str_id, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6056{
6057 return TreeNodeExV(str_id, 0, fmt, args);
6058}
6059
6060bool ImGui::TreeNodeV(const void* ptr_id, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6061{
6062 return TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, 0, fmt, args);
6063}
6064
6065bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6066{
6067 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6068 if (window->SkipItems)
6069 return false;
6070
6071 return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), flags, label, NULL);
6072}
6073
6074bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...)
6075{
6076 va_list args;
6077 va_start(args, fmt);
6078 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(str_id, flags, fmt, args);
6079 va_end(args);
6080 return is_open;
6081}
6082
6083bool ImGui::TreeNodeEx(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, ...)
6084{
6085 va_list args;
6086 va_start(args, fmt);
6087 bool is_open = TreeNodeExV(ptr_id, flags, fmt, args);
6088 va_end(args);
6089 return is_open;
6090}
6091
6092bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const char* str_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6093{
6094 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6095 if (window->SkipItems)
6096 return false;
6097
6098 const char* label, *label_end;
6099 ImFormatStringToTempBufferV(&label, &label_end, fmt, args);
6100 return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(str_id), flags, label, label_end);
6101}
6102
6103bool ImGui::TreeNodeExV(const void* ptr_id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* fmt, va_list args)
6104{
6105 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6106 if (window->SkipItems)
6107 return false;
6108
6109 const char* label, *label_end;
6110 ImFormatStringToTempBufferV(&label, &label_end, fmt, args);
6111 return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(ptr_id), flags, label, label_end);
6112}
6113
6114void ImGui::TreeNodeSetOpen(ImGuiID id, bool open)
6115{
6116 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6117 ImGuiStorage* storage = g.CurrentWindow->DC.StateStorage;
6118 storage->SetInt(id, open ? 1 : 0);
6119}
6120
6121bool ImGui::TreeNodeUpdateNextOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6122{
6123 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf)
6124 return true;
6125
6126 // We only write to the tree storage if the user clicks (or explicitly use the SetNextItemOpen function)
6127 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6128 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6129 ImGuiStorage* storage = window->DC.StateStorage;
6130
6131 bool is_open;
6132 if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen)
6133 {
6134 if (g.NextItemData.OpenCond & ImGuiCond_Always)
6135 {
6136 is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
6137 TreeNodeSetOpen(id, is_open);
6138 }
6139 else
6140 {
6141 // We treat ImGuiCond_Once and ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver the same because tree node state are not saved persistently.
6142 const int stored_value = storage->GetInt(id, -1);
6143 if (stored_value == -1)
6144 {
6145 is_open = g.NextItemData.OpenVal;
6146 TreeNodeSetOpen(id, is_open);
6147 }
6148 else
6149 {
6150 is_open = stored_value != 0;
6151 }
6152 }
6153 }
6154 else
6155 {
6156 is_open = storage->GetInt(id, (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen) ? 1 : 0) != 0;
6157 }
6158
6159 // When logging is enabled, we automatically expand tree nodes (but *NOT* collapsing headers.. seems like sensible behavior).
6160 // NB- If we are above max depth we still allow manually opened nodes to be logged.
6161 if (g.LogEnabled && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoAutoOpenOnLog) && (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef) < g.LogDepthToExpand)
6162 is_open = true;
6163
6164 return is_open;
6165}
6166
6167bool ImGui::TreeNodeBehavior(ImGuiID id, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags, const char* label, const char* label_end)
6168{
6169 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6170 if (window->SkipItems)
6171 return false;
6172
6173 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6174 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6175 const bool display_frame = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed) != 0;
6176 const ImVec2 padding = (display_frame || (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_FramePadding)) ? style.FramePadding : ImVec2(style.FramePadding.x, ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, style.FramePadding.y));
6177
6178 if (!label_end)
6179 label_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(label);
6180 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, label_end, false);
6181
6182 // We vertically grow up to current line height up the typical widget height.
6183 const float frame_height = ImMax(ImMin(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2), label_size.y + padding.y * 2);
6184 const bool span_all_columns = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns) != 0 && (g.CurrentTable != NULL);
6185 ImRect frame_bb;
6186 frame_bb.Min.x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x : (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth) ? window->WorkRect.Min.x : window->DC.CursorPos.x;
6187 frame_bb.Min.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
6188 frame_bb.Max.x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x : window->WorkRect.Max.x;
6189 frame_bb.Max.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y + frame_height;
6190 if (display_frame)
6191 {
6192 // Framed header expand a little outside the default padding, to the edge of InnerClipRect
6193 // (FIXME: May remove this at some point and make InnerClipRect align with WindowPadding.x instead of WindowPadding.x*0.5f)
6194 frame_bb.Min.x -= IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f - 1.0f);
6195 frame_bb.Max.x += IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
6196 }
6197
6198 const float text_offset_x = g.FontSize + (display_frame ? padding.x * 3 : padding.x * 2); // Collapsing arrow width + Spacing
6199 const float text_offset_y = ImMax(padding.y, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset); // Latch before ItemSize changes it
6200 const float text_width = g.FontSize + (label_size.x > 0.0f ? label_size.x + padding.x * 2 : 0.0f); // Include collapsing
6201 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + text_offset_x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + text_offset_y);
6202 ItemSize(ImVec2(text_width, frame_height), padding.y);
6203
6204 // For regular tree nodes, we arbitrary allow to click past 2 worth of ItemSpacing
6205 ImRect interact_bb = frame_bb;
6206 if (!display_frame && (flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns)) == 0)
6207 interact_bb.Max.x = frame_bb.Min.x + text_width + style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f;
6208
6209 // Modify ClipRect for the ItemAdd(), faster than doing a PushColumnsBackground/PushTableBackgroundChannel for every Selectable..
6210 const float backup_clip_rect_min_x = window->ClipRect.Min.x;
6211 const float backup_clip_rect_max_x = window->ClipRect.Max.x;
6212 if (span_all_columns)
6213 {
6214 window->ClipRect.Min.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x;
6215 window->ClipRect.Max.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x;
6216 }
6217
6218 // Compute open and multi-select states before ItemAdd() as it clear NextItem data.
6219 bool is_open = TreeNodeUpdateNextOpen(id, flags);
6220 bool item_add = ItemAdd(interact_bb, id);
6221 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect;
6222 g.LastItemData.DisplayRect = frame_bb;
6223
6224 if (span_all_columns)
6225 {
6226 window->ClipRect.Min.x = backup_clip_rect_min_x;
6227 window->ClipRect.Max.x = backup_clip_rect_max_x;
6228 }
6229
6230 // If a NavLeft request is happening and ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere enabled:
6231 // Store data for the current depth to allow returning to this node from any child item.
6232 // For this purpose we essentially compare if g.NavIdIsAlive went from 0 to 1 between TreeNode() and TreePop().
6233 // It will become tempting to enable ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere by default or move it to ImGuiStyle.
6234 // Currently only supports 32 level deep and we are fine with (1 << Depth) overflowing into a zero, easy to increase.
6235 if (is_open && !g.NavIdIsAlive && (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere) && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6236 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
6237 {
6238 g.NavTreeNodeStack.resize(g.NavTreeNodeStack.Size + 1);
6239 ImGuiNavTreeNodeData* nav_tree_node_data = &g.NavTreeNodeStack.back();
6240 nav_tree_node_data->ID = id;
6241 nav_tree_node_data->InFlags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
6242 nav_tree_node_data->NavRect = g.LastItemData.NavRect;
6243 window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask |= (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6244 }
6245
6246 const bool is_leaf = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf) != 0;
6247 if (!item_add)
6248 {
6249 if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6250 TreePushOverrideID(id);
6251 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6252 return is_open;
6253 }
6254
6255 if (span_all_columns)
6256 {
6257 TablePushBackgroundChannel();
6258 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect;
6259 g.LastItemData.ClipRect = window->ClipRect;
6260 }
6261
6262 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
6263 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap) || (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap))
6264 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap;
6265 if (!is_leaf)
6266 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
6267
6268 // We allow clicking on the arrow section with keyboard modifiers held, in order to easily
6269 // allow browsing a tree while preserving selection with code implementing multi-selection patterns.
6270 // When clicking on the rest of the tree node we always disallow keyboard modifiers.
6271 const float arrow_hit_x1 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) - style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6272 const float arrow_hit_x2 = (text_pos.x - text_offset_x) + (g.FontSize + padding.x * 2.0f) + style.TouchExtraPadding.x;
6273 const bool is_mouse_x_over_arrow = (g.IO.MousePos.x >= arrow_hit_x1 && g.IO.MousePos.x < arrow_hit_x2);
6274 if (window != g.HoveredWindow || !is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6275 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoKeyModifiers;
6276
6277 // Open behaviors can be altered with the _OpenOnArrow and _OnOnDoubleClick flags.
6278 // Some alteration have subtle effects (e.g. toggle on MouseUp vs MouseDown events) due to requirements for multi-selection and drag and drop support.
6279 // - Single-click on label = Toggle on MouseUp (default, when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6280 // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=0)
6281 // - Single-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDown (when _OpenOnArrow=1)
6282 // - Double-click on label = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1)
6283 // - Double-click on arrow = Toggle on MouseDoubleClick (when _OpenOnDoubleClick=1 and _OpenOnArrow=0)
6284 // It is rather standard that arrow click react on Down rather than Up.
6285 // We set ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease on OpenOnDoubleClick because we want the item to be active on the initial MouseDown in order for drag and drop to work.
6286 if (is_mouse_x_over_arrow)
6287 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick;
6288 else if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick)
6289 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick;
6290 else
6291 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease;
6292
6293 bool selected = (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected) != 0;
6294 const bool was_selected = selected;
6295
6296 bool hovered, held;
6297 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(interact_bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
6298 bool toggled = false;
6299 if (!is_leaf)
6300 {
6301 if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId != id)
6302 {
6303 if ((flags & (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick)) == 0 || (g.NavActivateId == id))
6304 toggled = true;
6305 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow)
6306 toggled |= is_mouse_x_over_arrow && !g.NavDisableMouseHover; // Lightweight equivalent of IsMouseHoveringRect() since ButtonBehavior() already did the job
6307 if ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick) && g.IO.MouseClickedCount[0] == 2)
6308 toggled = true;
6309 }
6310 else if (pressed && g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId == id)
6311 {
6312 IM_ASSERT(button_flags & ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold);
6313 if (!is_open) // When using Drag and Drop "hold to open" we keep the node highlighted after opening, but never close it again.
6314 toggled = true;
6315 }
6316
6317 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && is_open)
6318 {
6319 toggled = true;
6320 NavClearPreferredPosForAxis(ImGuiAxis_X);
6321 NavMoveRequestCancel();
6322 }
6323 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && !is_open) // If there's something upcoming on the line we may want to give it the priority?
6324 {
6325 toggled = true;
6326 NavClearPreferredPosForAxis(ImGuiAxis_X);
6327 NavMoveRequestCancel();
6328 }
6329
6330 if (toggled)
6331 {
6332 is_open = !is_open;
6333 window->DC.StateStorage->SetInt(id, is_open);
6334 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen;
6335 }
6336 }
6337
6338 // In this branch, TreeNodeBehavior() cannot toggle the selection so this will never trigger.
6339 if (selected != was_selected) //-V547
6340 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
6341
6342 // Render
6343 const ImU32 text_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
6344 ImGuiNavHighlightFlags nav_highlight_flags = ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_Compact;
6345 if (display_frame)
6346 {
6347 // Framed type
6348 const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6349 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, true, style.FrameRounding);
6350 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id, nav_highlight_flags);
6351 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6352 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.60f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6353 else if (!is_leaf)
6354 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y), text_col, is_open ? ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_UpsideDownArrow) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down) : ImGuiDir_Right, 1.0f);
6355 else // Leaf without bullet, left-adjusted text
6356 text_pos.x -= text_offset_x -padding.x;
6357 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton)
6358 frame_bb.Max.x -= g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x;
6359
6360 if (g.LogEnabled)
6361 LogSetNextTextDecoration("###", "###");
6362 }
6363 else
6364 {
6365 // Unframed typed for tree nodes
6366 if (hovered || selected)
6367 {
6368 const ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6369 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, bg_col, false);
6370 }
6371 RenderNavHighlight(frame_bb, id, nav_highlight_flags);
6372 if (flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet)
6373 RenderBullet(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x * 0.5f, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.5f), text_col);
6374 else if (!is_leaf)
6375 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, ImVec2(text_pos.x - text_offset_x + padding.x, text_pos.y + g.FontSize * 0.15f), text_col, is_open ? ((flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_UpsideDownArrow) ? ImGuiDir_Up : ImGuiDir_Down) : ImGuiDir_Right, 0.70f);
6376 if (g.LogEnabled)
6377 LogSetNextTextDecoration(">", NULL);
6378 }
6379
6380 if (span_all_columns)
6381 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6382
6383 // Label
6384 if (display_frame)
6385 RenderTextClipped(text_pos, frame_bb.Max, label, label_end, &label_size);
6386 else
6387 RenderText(text_pos, label, label_end, false);
6388
6389 if (is_open && !(flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen))
6390 TreePushOverrideID(id);
6391 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | (is_leaf ? 0 : ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable) | (is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
6392 return is_open;
6393}
6394
6395void ImGui::TreePush(const char* str_id)
6396{
6397 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6398 Indent();
6399 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6400 PushID(str_id);
6401}
6402
6403void ImGui::TreePush(const void* ptr_id)
6404{
6405 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6406 Indent();
6407 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6408 PushID(ptr_id);
6409}
6410
6411void ImGui::TreePushOverrideID(ImGuiID id)
6412{
6413 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6414 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6415 Indent();
6416 window->DC.TreeDepth++;
6417 PushOverrideID(id);
6418}
6419
6420void ImGui::TreePop()
6421{
6422 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6423 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6424 Unindent();
6425
6426 window->DC.TreeDepth--;
6427 ImU32 tree_depth_mask = (1 << window->DC.TreeDepth);
6428
6429 // Handle Left arrow to move to parent tree node (when ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere is enabled)
6430 if (window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask & tree_depth_mask) // Only set during request
6431 {
6432 ImGuiNavTreeNodeData* nav_tree_node_data = &g.NavTreeNodeStack.back();
6433 IM_ASSERT(nav_tree_node_data->ID == window->IDStack.back());
6434 if (g.NavIdIsAlive && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
6435 NavMoveRequestResolveWithPastTreeNode(&g.NavMoveResultLocal, nav_tree_node_data);
6436 g.NavTreeNodeStack.pop_back();
6437 }
6438 window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask &= tree_depth_mask - 1;
6439
6440 IM_ASSERT(window->IDStack.Size > 1); // There should always be 1 element in the IDStack (pushed during window creation). If this triggers you called TreePop/PopID too much.
6441 PopID();
6442}
6443
6444// Horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode() or Bullet()
6445float ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing()
6446{
6447 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6448 return g.FontSize + (g.Style.FramePadding.x * 2.0f);
6449}
6450
6451// Set next TreeNode/CollapsingHeader open state.
6452void ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(bool is_open, ImGuiCond cond)
6453{
6454 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6455 if (g.CurrentWindow->SkipItems)
6456 return;
6457 g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen;
6458 g.NextItemData.OpenVal = is_open;
6459 g.NextItemData.OpenCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
6460}
6461
6462// CollapsingHeader returns true when opened but do not indent nor push into the ID stack (because of the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen flag).
6463// This is basically the same as calling TreeNodeEx(label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader). You can remove the _NoTreePushOnOpen flag if you want behavior closer to normal TreeNode().
6464bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char* label, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6465{
6466 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6467 if (window->SkipItems)
6468 return false;
6469
6470 return TreeNodeBehavior(window->GetID(label), flags | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader, label);
6471}
6472
6473// p_visible == NULL : regular collapsing header
6474// p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == true : show a small close button on the corner of the header, clicking the button will set *p_visible = false
6475// p_visible != NULL && *p_visible == false : do not show the header at all
6476// Do not mistake this with the Open state of the header itself, which you can adjust with SetNextItemOpen() or ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen.
6477bool ImGui::CollapsingHeader(const char* label, bool* p_visible, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags)
6478{
6479 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6480 if (window->SkipItems)
6481 return false;
6482
6483 if (p_visible && !*p_visible)
6484 return false;
6485
6486 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6487 flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_CollapsingHeader;
6488 if (p_visible)
6489 flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap | (ImGuiTreeNodeFlags)ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton;
6490 bool is_open = TreeNodeBehavior(id, flags, label);
6491 if (p_visible != NULL)
6492 {
6493 // Create a small overlapping close button
6494 // FIXME: We can evolve this into user accessible helpers to add extra buttons on title bars, headers, etc.
6495 // FIXME: CloseButton can overlap into text, need find a way to clip the text somehow.
6496 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6497 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
6498 float button_size = g.FontSize;
6499 float button_x = ImMax(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max.x - g.Style.FramePadding.x - button_size);
6500 float button_y = g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.y + g.Style.FramePadding.y;
6501 ImGuiID close_button_id = GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, id);
6502 if (CloseButton(close_button_id, ImVec2(button_x, button_y)))
6503 *p_visible = false;
6504 g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
6505 }
6506
6507 return is_open;
6508}
6509
6510//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6511// [SECTION] Widgets: Selectable
6512//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6513// - Selectable()
6514//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6515
6516// Tip: pass a non-visible label (e.g. "##hello") then you can use the space to draw other text or image.
6517// But you need to make sure the ID is unique, e.g. enclose calls in PushID/PopID or use ##unique_id.
6518// With this scheme, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns and ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap are also frequently used flags.
6519// FIXME: Selectable() with (size.x == 0.0f) and (SelectableTextAlign.x > 0.0f) followed by SameLine() is currently not supported.
6520bool ImGui::Selectable(const char* label, bool selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
6521{
6522 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6523 if (window->SkipItems)
6524 return false;
6525
6526 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6527 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6528
6529 // Submit label or explicit size to ItemSize(), whereas ItemAdd() will submit a larger/spanning rectangle.
6530 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
6531 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
6532 ImVec2 size(size_arg.x != 0.0f ? size_arg.x : label_size.x, size_arg.y != 0.0f ? size_arg.y : label_size.y);
6533 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
6534 pos.y += window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
6535 ItemSize(size, 0.0f);
6536
6537 // Fill horizontal space
6538 // We don't support (size < 0.0f) in Selectable() because the ItemSpacing extension would make explicitly right-aligned sizes not visibly match other widgets.
6539 const bool span_all_columns = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns) != 0;
6540 const float min_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x : pos.x;
6541 const float max_x = span_all_columns ? window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x : window->WorkRect.Max.x;
6542 if (size_arg.x == 0.0f || (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth))
6543 size.x = ImMax(label_size.x, max_x - min_x);
6544
6545 // Text stays at the submission position, but bounding box may be extended on both sides
6546 const ImVec2 text_min = pos;
6547 const ImVec2 text_max(min_x + size.x, pos.y + size.y);
6548
6549 // Selectables are meant to be tightly packed together with no click-gap, so we extend their box to cover spacing between selectable.
6550 ImRect bb(min_x, pos.y, text_max.x, text_max.y);
6551 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoPadWithHalfSpacing) == 0)
6552 {
6553 const float spacing_x = span_all_columns ? 0.0f : style.ItemSpacing.x;
6554 const float spacing_y = style.ItemSpacing.y;
6555 const float spacing_L = IM_TRUNC(spacing_x * 0.50f);
6556 const float spacing_U = IM_TRUNC(spacing_y * 0.50f);
6557 bb.Min.x -= spacing_L;
6558 bb.Min.y -= spacing_U;
6559 bb.Max.x += (spacing_x - spacing_L);
6560 bb.Max.y += (spacing_y - spacing_U);
6561 }
6562 //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255)); }
6563
6564 // Modify ClipRect for the ItemAdd(), faster than doing a PushColumnsBackground/PushTableBackgroundChannel for every Selectable..
6565 const float backup_clip_rect_min_x = window->ClipRect.Min.x;
6566 const float backup_clip_rect_max_x = window->ClipRect.Max.x;
6567 if (span_all_columns)
6568 {
6569 window->ClipRect.Min.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Min.x;
6570 window->ClipRect.Max.x = window->ParentWorkRect.Max.x;
6571 }
6572
6573 const bool disabled_item = (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6574 const bool item_add = ItemAdd(bb, id, NULL, disabled_item ? ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled : ImGuiItemFlags_None);
6575 if (span_all_columns)
6576 {
6577 window->ClipRect.Min.x = backup_clip_rect_min_x;
6578 window->ClipRect.Max.x = backup_clip_rect_max_x;
6579 }
6580
6581 if (!item_add)
6582 return false;
6583
6584 const bool disabled_global = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6585 if (disabled_item && !disabled_global) // Only testing this as an optimization
6586 BeginDisabled();
6587
6588 // FIXME: We can standardize the behavior of those two, we could also keep the fast path of override ClipRect + full push on render only,
6589 // which would be advantageous since most selectable are not selected.
6590 if (span_all_columns)
6591 {
6592 if (g.CurrentTable)
6593 TablePushBackgroundChannel();
6594 else if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6595 PushColumnsBackground();
6596 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect;
6597 g.LastItemData.ClipRect = window->ClipRect;
6598 }
6599
6600 // We use NoHoldingActiveID on menus so user can click and _hold_ on a menu then drag to browse child entries
6601 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = 0;
6602 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoldingActiveId; }
6603 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_NoSetKeyOwner; }
6604 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick; }
6605 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease; }
6606 if (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowDoubleClick) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick; }
6607 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap) || (g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap)) { button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap; }
6608
6609 const bool was_selected = selected;
6610 bool hovered, held;
6611 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
6612
6613 // Auto-select when moved into
6614 // - This will be more fully fleshed in the range-select branch
6615 // - This is not exposed as it won't nicely work with some user side handling of shift/control
6616 // - We cannot do 'if (g.NavJustMovedToId != id) { selected = false; pressed = was_selected; }' for two reasons
6617 // - (1) it would require focus scope to be set, need exposing PushFocusScope() or equivalent (e.g. BeginSelection() calling PushFocusScope())
6618 // - (2) usage will fail with clipped items
