6619 // The multi-select API aim to fix those issues, e.g. may be replaced with a BeginSelection() API.
6620 if ((flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav) && g.NavJustMovedToId != 0 && g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId == g.CurrentFocusScopeId)
6621 if (g.NavJustMovedToId == id)
6622 selected = pressed = true;
6623
6624 // Update NavId when clicking or when Hovering (this doesn't happen on most widgets), so navigation can be resumed with gamepad/keyboard
6625 if (pressed || (hovered && (flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover)))
6626 {
6627 if (!g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow == window && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
6628 {
6629 SetNavID(id, window->DC.NavLayerCurrent, g.CurrentFocusScopeId, WindowRectAbsToRel(window, bb)); // (bb == NavRect)
6630 g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
6631 }
6632 }
6633 if (pressed)
6634 MarkItemEdited(id);
6635
6636 // In this branch, Selectable() cannot toggle the selection so this will never trigger.
6637 if (selected != was_selected) //-V547
6638 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection;
6639
6640 // Render
6641 if (hovered || selected)
6642 {
6643 const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((held && hovered) ? ImGuiCol_HeaderActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_HeaderHovered : ImGuiCol_Header);
6644 RenderFrame(bb.Min, bb.Max, col, false, 0.0f);
6645 }
6646 if (g.NavId == id)
6647 RenderNavHighlight(bb, id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_Compact | ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding);
6648
6649 if (span_all_columns)
6650 {
6651 if (g.CurrentTable)
6652 TablePopBackgroundChannel();
6653 else if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6654 PopColumnsBackground();
6655 }
6656
6657 RenderTextClipped(text_min, text_max, label, NULL, &label_size, style.SelectableTextAlign, &bb);
6658
6659 // Automatically close popups
6660 if (pressed && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups) && !(g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_SelectableDontClosePopup))
6661 CloseCurrentPopup();
6662
6663 if (disabled_item && !disabled_global)
6664 EndDisabled();
6665
6666 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
6667 return pressed; //-V1020
6668}
6669
6670bool ImGui::Selectable(const char* label, bool* p_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags flags, const ImVec2& size_arg)
6671{
6672 if (Selectable(label, *p_selected, flags, size_arg))
6673 {
6674 *p_selected = !*p_selected;
6675 return true;
6676 }
6677 return false;
6678}
6679
6680
6681//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6682// [SECTION] Widgets: Typing-Select support
6683//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6684
6685// [Experimental] Currently not exposed in public API.
6686// Consume character inputs and return search request, if any.
6687// This would typically only be called on the focused window or location you want to grab inputs for, e.g.
6688// if (ImGui::IsWindowFocused(...))
6689// if (ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req = ImGui::GetTypingSelectRequest())
6690// focus_idx = ImGui::TypingSelectFindMatch(req, my_items.size(), [](void*, int n) { return my_items[n]->Name; }, &my_items, -1);
6691// However the code is written in a way where calling it from multiple locations is safe (e.g. to obtain buffer).
6692ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* ImGui::GetTypingSelectRequest(ImGuiTypingSelectFlags flags)
6693{
6694 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6695 ImGuiTypingSelectState* data = &g.TypingSelectState;
6696 ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* out_request = &data->Request;
6697
6698 // Clear buffer
6699 const float TYPING_SELECT_RESET_TIMER = 1.80f; // FIXME: Potentially move to IO config.
6700 const int TYPING_SELECT_SINGLE_CHAR_COUNT_FOR_LOCK = 4; // Lock single char matching when repeating same char 4 times
6701 if (data->SearchBuffer[0] != 0)
6702 {
6703 bool clear_buffer = false;
6704 clear_buffer |= (g.NavFocusScopeId != data->FocusScope);
6705 clear_buffer |= (data->LastRequestTime + TYPING_SELECT_RESET_TIMER < g.Time);
6706 clear_buffer |= g.NavAnyRequest;
6707 clear_buffer |= g.ActiveId != 0 && g.NavActivateId == 0; // Allow temporary SPACE activation to not interfere
6708 clear_buffer |= IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Escape) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter);
6709 clear_buffer |= IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace) && (flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowBackspace) == 0;
6710 //if (clear_buffer) { IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("GetTypingSelectRequest(): Clear SearchBuffer.\n"); }
6711 if (clear_buffer)
6712 data->Clear();
6713 }
6714
6715 // Append to buffer
6716 const int buffer_max_len = IM_ARRAYSIZE(data->SearchBuffer) - 1;
6717 int buffer_len = (int)strlen(data->SearchBuffer);
6718 bool select_request = false;
6719 for (ImWchar w : g.IO.InputQueueCharacters)
6720 {
6721 const int w_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(&w, &w + 1);
6722 if (w < 32 || (buffer_len == 0 && ImCharIsBlankW(w)) || (buffer_len + w_len > buffer_max_len)) // Ignore leading blanks
6723 continue;
6724 char w_buf[5];
6725 ImTextCharToUtf8(w_buf, (unsigned int)w);
6726 if (data->SingleCharModeLock && w_len == out_request->SingleCharSize && memcmp(w_buf, data->SearchBuffer, w_len) == 0)
6727 {
6728 select_request = true; // Same character: don't need to append to buffer.
6729 continue;
6730 }
6731 if (data->SingleCharModeLock)
6732 {
6733 data->Clear(); // Different character: clear
6734 buffer_len = 0;
6735 }
6736 memcpy(data->SearchBuffer + buffer_len, w_buf, w_len + 1); // Append
6737 buffer_len += w_len;
6738 select_request = true;
6739 }
6740 g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
6741
6742 // Handle backspace
6743 if ((flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowBackspace) && IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Backspace, 0, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat))
6744 {
6745 char* p = (char*)(void*)ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(data->SearchBuffer, data->SearchBuffer + buffer_len);
6746 *p = 0;
6747 buffer_len = (int)(p - data->SearchBuffer);
6748 }
6749
6750 // Return request if any
6751 if (buffer_len == 0)
6752 return NULL;
6753 if (select_request)
6754 {
6755 data->FocusScope = g.NavFocusScopeId;
6756 data->LastRequestFrame = g.FrameCount;
6757 data->LastRequestTime = (float)g.Time;
6758 }
6759 out_request->Flags = flags;
6760 out_request->SearchBufferLen = buffer_len;
6761 out_request->SearchBuffer = data->SearchBuffer;
6762 out_request->SelectRequest = (data->LastRequestFrame == g.FrameCount);
6763 out_request->SingleCharMode = false;
6764 out_request->SingleCharSize = 0;
6765
6766 // Calculate if buffer contains the same character repeated.
6767 // - This can be used to implement a special search mode on first character.
6768 // - Performed on UTF-8 codepoint for correctness.
6769 // - SingleCharMode is always set for first input character, because it usually leads to a "next".
6770 if (flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowSingleCharMode)
6771 {
6772 const char* buf_begin = out_request->SearchBuffer;
6773 const char* buf_end = out_request->SearchBuffer + out_request->SearchBufferLen;
6774 const int c0_len = ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(buf_begin, buf_end);
6775 const char* p = buf_begin + c0_len;
6776 for (; p < buf_end; p += c0_len)
6777 if (memcmp(buf_begin, p, (size_t)c0_len) != 0)
6778 break;
6779 const int single_char_count = (p == buf_end) ? (out_request->SearchBufferLen / c0_len) : 0;
6780 out_request->SingleCharMode = (single_char_count > 0 || data->SingleCharModeLock);
6781 out_request->SingleCharSize = (ImS8)c0_len;
6782 data->SingleCharModeLock |= (single_char_count >= TYPING_SELECT_SINGLE_CHAR_COUNT_FOR_LOCK); // From now on we stop search matching to lock to single char mode.
6783 }
6784
6785 return out_request;
6786}
6787
6788static int ImStrimatchlen(const char* s1, const char* s1_end, const char* s2)
6789{
6790 int match_len = 0;
6791 while (s1 < s1_end && ImToUpper(*s1++) == ImToUpper(*s2++))
6792 match_len++;
6793 return match_len;
6794}
6795
6796// Default handler for finding a result for typing-select. You may implement your own.
6797// You might want to display a tooltip to visualize the current request SearchBuffer
6798// When SingleCharMode is set:
6799// - it is better to NOT display a tooltip of other on-screen display indicator.
6800// - the index of the currently focused item is required.
6801// if your SetNextItemSelectionData() values are indices, you can obtain it from ImGuiMultiSelectIO::NavIdItem, otherwise from g.NavLastValidSelectionUserData.
6802int ImGui::TypingSelectFindMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data, int nav_item_idx)
6803{
6804 if (req == NULL || req->SelectRequest == false) // Support NULL parameter so both calls can be done from same spot.
6805 return -1;
6806 int idx = -1;
6807 if (req->SingleCharMode && (req->Flags & ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowSingleCharMode))
6808 idx = TypingSelectFindNextSingleCharMatch(req, items_count, get_item_name_func, user_data, nav_item_idx);
6809 else
6810 idx = TypingSelectFindBestLeadingMatch(req, items_count, get_item_name_func, user_data);
6811 if (idx != -1)
6812 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
6813 return idx;
6814}
6815
6816// Special handling when a single character is repeated: perform search on a single letter and goes to next.
6817int ImGui::TypingSelectFindNextSingleCharMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data, int nav_item_idx)
6818{
6819 // FIXME: Assume selection user data is index. Would be extremely practical.
6820 //if (nav_item_idx == -1)
6821 // nav_item_idx = (int)g.NavLastValidSelectionUserData;
6822
6823 int first_match_idx = -1;
6824 bool return_next_match = false;
6825 for (int idx = 0; idx < items_count; idx++)
6826 {
6827 const char* item_name = get_item_name_func(user_data, idx);
6828 if (ImStrimatchlen(req->SearchBuffer, req->SearchBuffer + req->SingleCharSize, item_name) < req->SingleCharSize)
6829 continue;
6830 if (return_next_match) // Return next matching item after current item.
6831 return idx;
6832 if (first_match_idx == -1 && nav_item_idx == -1) // Return first match immediately if we don't have a nav_item_idx value.
6833 return idx;
6834 if (first_match_idx == -1) // Record first match for wrapping.
6835 first_match_idx = idx;
6836 if (nav_item_idx == idx) // Record that we encountering nav_item so we can return next match.
6837 return_next_match = true;
6838 }
6839 return first_match_idx; // First result
6840}
6841
6842int ImGui::TypingSelectFindBestLeadingMatch(ImGuiTypingSelectRequest* req, int items_count, const char* (*get_item_name_func)(void*, int), void* user_data)
6843{
6844 int longest_match_idx = -1;
6845 int longest_match_len = 0;
6846 for (int idx = 0; idx < items_count; idx++)
6847 {
6848 const char* item_name = get_item_name_func(user_data, idx);
6849 const int match_len = ImStrimatchlen(req->SearchBuffer, req->SearchBuffer + req->SearchBufferLen, item_name);
6850 if (match_len <= longest_match_len)
6851 continue;
6852 longest_match_idx = idx;
6853 longest_match_len = match_len;
6854 if (match_len == req->SearchBufferLen)
6855 break;
6856 }
6857 return longest_match_idx;
6858}
6859
6860void ImGui::DebugNodeTypingSelectState(ImGuiTypingSelectState* data)
6861{
6862#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
6863 Text("SearchBuffer = \"%s\"", data->SearchBuffer);
6864 Text("SingleCharMode = %d, Size = %d, Lock = %d", data->Request.SingleCharMode, data->Request.SingleCharSize, data->SingleCharModeLock);
6865 Text("LastRequest = time: %.2f, frame: %d", data->LastRequestTime, data->LastRequestFrame);
6866#else
6867 IM_UNUSED(data);
6868#endif
6869}
6870
6871
6872//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6873// [SECTION] Widgets: Multi-Select support
6874//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6875
6876void ImGui::SetNextItemSelectionUserData(ImGuiSelectionUserData selection_user_data)
6877{
6878 // Note that flags will be cleared by ItemAdd(), so it's only useful for Navigation code!
6879 // This designed so widgets can also cheaply set this before calling ItemAdd(), so we are not tied to MultiSelect api.
6880 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6881 g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData;
6882 g.NextItemData.SelectionUserData = selection_user_data;
6883}
6884
6885
6886//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6887// [SECTION] Widgets: ListBox
6888//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6889// - BeginListBox()
6890// - EndListBox()
6891// - ListBox()
6892//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
6893
6894// This is essentially a thin wrapper to using BeginChild/EndChild with the ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle flag for stylistic changes + displaying a label.
6895// Tip: To have a list filling the entire window width, use size.x = -FLT_MIN and pass an non-visible label e.g. "##empty"
6896// Tip: If your vertical size is calculated from an item count (e.g. 10 * item_height) consider adding a fractional part to facilitate seeing scrolling boundaries (e.g. 10.25 * item_height).
6897bool ImGui::BeginListBox(const char* label, const ImVec2& size_arg)
6898{
6899 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6900 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6901 if (window->SkipItems)
6902 return false;
6903
6904 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
6905 const ImGuiID id = GetID(label);
6906 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
6907
6908 // Size default to hold ~7.25 items.
6909 // Fractional number of items helps seeing that we can scroll down/up without looking at scrollbar.
6910 ImVec2 size = ImTrunc(CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 7.25f + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
6911 ImVec2 frame_size = ImVec2(size.x, ImMax(size.y, label_size.y));
6912 ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
6913 ImRect bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0.0f));
6914 g.NextItemData.ClearFlags();
6915
6916 if (!IsRectVisible(bb.Min, bb.Max))
6917 {
6918 ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
6919 ItemAdd(bb, 0, &frame_bb);
6920 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
6921 return false;
6922 }
6923
6924 // FIXME-OPT: We could omit the BeginGroup() if label_size.x == 0.0f but would need to omit the EndGroup() as well.
6925 BeginGroup();
6926 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
6927 {
6928 ImVec2 label_pos = ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y);
6929 RenderText(label_pos, label);
6930 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, label_pos + label_size);
6931 }
6932
6933 BeginChild(id, frame_bb.GetSize(), ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle);
6934 return true;
6935}
6936
6937void ImGui::EndListBox()
6938{
6939 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6940 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6941 IM_ASSERT((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && "Mismatched BeginListBox/EndListBox calls. Did you test the return value of BeginListBox?");
6942 IM_UNUSED(window);
6943
6944 EndChild();
6945 EndGroup(); // This is only required to be able to do IsItemXXX query on the whole ListBox including label
6946}
6947
6948bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* const items[], int items_count, int height_items)
6949{
6950 const bool value_changed = ListBox(label, current_item, Items_ArrayGetter, (void*)items, items_count, height_items);
6951 return value_changed;
6952}
6953
6954// This is merely a helper around BeginListBox(), EndListBox().
6955// Considering using those directly to submit custom data or store selection differently.
6956bool ImGui::ListBox(const char* label, int* current_item, const char* (*getter)(void* user_data, int idx), void* user_data, int items_count, int height_in_items)
6957{
6958 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6959
6960 // Calculate size from "height_in_items"
6961 if (height_in_items < 0)
6962 height_in_items = ImMin(items_count, 7);
6963 float height_in_items_f = height_in_items + 0.25f;
6964 ImVec2 size(0.0f, ImTrunc(GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * height_in_items_f + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f));
6965
6966 if (!BeginListBox(label, size))
6967 return false;
6968
6969 // Assume all items have even height (= 1 line of text). If you need items of different height,
6970 // you can create a custom version of ListBox() in your code without using the clipper.
6971 bool value_changed = false;
6972 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
6973 clipper.Begin(items_count, GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()); // We know exactly our line height here so we pass it as a minor optimization, but generally you don't need to.
6974 while (clipper.Step())
6975 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
6976 {
6977 const char* item_text = getter(user_data, i);
6978 if (item_text == NULL)
6979 item_text = "*Unknown item*";
6980
6981 PushID(i);
6982 const bool item_selected = (i == *current_item);
6983 if (Selectable(item_text, item_selected))
6984 {
6985 *current_item = i;
6986 value_changed = true;
6987 }
6988 if (item_selected)
6989 SetItemDefaultFocus();
6990 PopID();
6991 }
6992 EndListBox();
6993
6994 if (value_changed)
6995 MarkItemEdited(g.LastItemData.ID);
6996
6997 return value_changed;
6998}
6999
7000//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7001// [SECTION] Widgets: PlotLines, PlotHistogram
7002//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7003// - PlotEx() [Internal]
7004// - PlotLines()
7005// - PlotHistogram()
7006//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7007// Plot/Graph widgets are not very good.
7008// Consider writing your own, or using a third-party one, see:
7009// - ImPlot https://github.com/epezent/implot
7010// - others https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Useful-Extensions
7011//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7012
7013int ImGui::PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType plot_type, const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, const ImVec2& size_arg)
7014{
7015 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7016 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7017 if (window->SkipItems)
7018 return -1;
7019
7020 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
7021 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7022
7023 const ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7024 const ImVec2 frame_size = CalcItemSize(size_arg, CalcItemWidth(), label_size.y + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
7025
7026 const ImRect frame_bb(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + frame_size);
7027 const ImRect inner_bb(frame_bb.Min + style.FramePadding, frame_bb.Max - style.FramePadding);
7028 const ImRect total_bb(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max + ImVec2(label_size.x > 0.0f ? style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + label_size.x : 0.0f, 0));
7029 ItemSize(total_bb, style.FramePadding.y);
7030 if (!ItemAdd(total_bb, 0, &frame_bb))
7031 return -1;
7032 const bool hovered = ItemHoverable(frame_bb, id, g.LastItemData.InFlags);
7033
7034 // Determine scale from values if not specified
7035 if (scale_min == FLT_MAX || scale_max == FLT_MAX)
7036 {
7037 float v_min = FLT_MAX;
7038 float v_max = -FLT_MAX;
7039 for (int i = 0; i < values_count; i++)
7040 {
7041 const float v = values_getter(data, i);
7042 if (v != v) // Ignore NaN values
7043 continue;
7044 v_min = ImMin(v_min, v);
7045 v_max = ImMax(v_max, v);
7046 }
7047 if (scale_min == FLT_MAX)
7048 scale_min = v_min;
7049 if (scale_max == FLT_MAX)
7050 scale_max = v_max;
7051 }
7052
7053 RenderFrame(frame_bb.Min, frame_bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_FrameBg), true, style.FrameRounding);
7054
7055 const int values_count_min = (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? 2 : 1;
7056 int idx_hovered = -1;
7057 if (values_count >= values_count_min)
7058 {
7059 int res_w = ImMin((int)frame_size.x, values_count) + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
7060 int item_count = values_count + ((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? -1 : 0);
7061
7062 // Tooltip on hover
7063 if (hovered && inner_bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
7064 {
7065 const float t = ImClamp((g.IO.MousePos.x - inner_bb.Min.x) / (inner_bb.Max.x - inner_bb.Min.x), 0.0f, 0.9999f);
7066 const int v_idx = (int)(t * item_count);
7067 IM_ASSERT(v_idx >= 0 && v_idx < values_count);
7068
7069 const float v0 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + values_offset) % values_count);
7070 const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v_idx + 1 + values_offset) % values_count);
7071 if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
7072 SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g\n%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0, v_idx + 1, v1);
7073 else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
7074 SetTooltip("%d: %8.4g", v_idx, v0);
7075 idx_hovered = v_idx;
7076 }
7077
7078 const float t_step = 1.0f / (float)res_w;
7079 const float inv_scale = (scale_min == scale_max) ? 0.0f : (1.0f / (scale_max - scale_min));
7080
7081 float v0 = values_getter(data, (0 + values_offset) % values_count);
7082 float t0 = 0.0f;
7083 ImVec2 tp0 = ImVec2( t0, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v0 - scale_min) * inv_scale) ); // Point in the normalized space of our target rectangle
7084 float histogram_zero_line_t = (scale_min * scale_max < 0.0f) ? (1 + scale_min * inv_scale) : (scale_min < 0.0f ? 0.0f : 1.0f); // Where does the zero line stands
7085
7086 const ImU32 col_base = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLines : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogram);
7087 const ImU32 col_hovered = GetColorU32((plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? ImGuiCol_PlotLinesHovered : ImGuiCol_PlotHistogramHovered);
7088
7089 for (int n = 0; n < res_w; n++)
7090 {
7091 const float t1 = t0 + t_step;
7092 const int v1_idx = (int)(t0 * item_count + 0.5f);
7093 IM_ASSERT(v1_idx >= 0 && v1_idx < values_count);
7094 const float v1 = values_getter(data, (v1_idx + values_offset + 1) % values_count);
7095 const ImVec2 tp1 = ImVec2( t1, 1.0f - ImSaturate((v1 - scale_min) * inv_scale) );
7096
7097 // NB: Draw calls are merged together by the DrawList system. Still, we should render our batch are lower level to save a bit of CPU.
7098 ImVec2 pos0 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, tp0);
7099 ImVec2 pos1 = ImLerp(inner_bb.Min, inner_bb.Max, (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines) ? tp1 : ImVec2(tp1.x, histogram_zero_line_t));
7100 if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Lines)
7101 {
7102 window->DrawList->AddLine(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
7103 }
7104 else if (plot_type == ImGuiPlotType_Histogram)
7105 {
7106 if (pos1.x >= pos0.x + 2.0f)
7107 pos1.x -= 1.0f;
7108 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(pos0, pos1, idx_hovered == v1_idx ? col_hovered : col_base);
7109 }
7110
7111 t0 = t1;
7112 tp0 = tp1;
7113 }
7114 }
7115
7116 // Text overlay
7117 if (overlay_text)
7118 RenderTextClipped(ImVec2(frame_bb.Min.x, frame_bb.Min.y + style.FramePadding.y), frame_bb.Max, overlay_text, NULL, NULL, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.0f));
7119
7120 if (label_size.x > 0.0f)
7121 RenderText(ImVec2(frame_bb.Max.x + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, inner_bb.Min.y), label);
7122
7123 // Return hovered index or -1 if none are hovered.
7124 // This is currently not exposed in the public API because we need a larger redesign of the whole thing, but in the short-term we are making it available in PlotEx().
7125 return idx_hovered;
7126}
7127
7128struct ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData
7129{
7130 const float* Values;
7131 int Stride;
7132
7133 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData(const float* values, int stride) { Values = values; Stride = stride; }
7134};
7135
7136static float Plot_ArrayGetter(void* data, int idx)
7137{
7138 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData* plot_data = (ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData*)data;
7139 const float v = *(const float*)(const void*)((const unsigned char*)plot_data->Values + (size_t)idx * plot_data->Stride);
7140 return v;
7141}
7142
7143void ImGui::PlotLines(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
7144{
7145 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
7146 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void*)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
7147}
7148
7149void ImGui::PlotLines(const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
7150{
7151 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Lines, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
7152}
7153
7154void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char* label, const float* values, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size, int stride)
7155{
7156 ImGuiPlotArrayGetterData data(values, stride);
7157 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, &Plot_ArrayGetter, (void*)&data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
7158}
7159
7160void ImGui::PlotHistogram(const char* label, float (*values_getter)(void* data, int idx), void* data, int values_count, int values_offset, const char* overlay_text, float scale_min, float scale_max, ImVec2 graph_size)
7161{
7162 PlotEx(ImGuiPlotType_Histogram, label, values_getter, data, values_count, values_offset, overlay_text, scale_min, scale_max, graph_size);
7163}
7164
7165//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7166// [SECTION] Widgets: Value helpers
7167// Those is not very useful, legacy API.
7168//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7169// - Value()
7170//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7171
7172void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, bool b)
7173{
7174 Text("%s: %s", prefix, (b ? "true" : "false"));
7175}
7176
7177void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, int v)
7178{
7179 Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
7180}
7181
7182void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, unsigned int v)
7183{
7184 Text("%s: %d", prefix, v);
7185}
7186
7187void ImGui::Value(const char* prefix, float v, const char* float_format)
7188{
7189 if (float_format)
7190 {
7191 char fmt[64];
7192 ImFormatString(fmt, IM_ARRAYSIZE(fmt), "%%s: %s", float_format);
7193 Text(fmt, prefix, v);
7194 }
7195 else
7196 {
7197 Text("%s: %.3f", prefix, v);
7198 }
7199}
7200
7201//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7202// [SECTION] MenuItem, BeginMenu, EndMenu, etc.
7203//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7204// - ImGuiMenuColumns [Internal]
7205// - BeginMenuBar()
7206// - EndMenuBar()
7207// - BeginMainMenuBar()
7208// - EndMainMenuBar()
7209// - BeginMenu()
7210// - EndMenu()
7211// - MenuItemEx() [Internal]
7212// - MenuItem()
7213//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7214
7215// Helpers for internal use
7216void ImGuiMenuColumns::Update(float spacing, bool window_reappearing)
7217{
7218 if (window_reappearing)
7219 memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
7220 Spacing = (ImU16)spacing;
7221 CalcNextTotalWidth(true);
7222 memset(Widths, 0, sizeof(Widths));
7223 TotalWidth = NextTotalWidth;
7224 NextTotalWidth = 0;
7225}
7226
7227void ImGuiMenuColumns::CalcNextTotalWidth(bool update_offsets)
7228{
7229 ImU16 offset = 0;
7230 bool want_spacing = false;
7231 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Widths); i++)
7232 {
7233 ImU16 width = Widths[i];
7234 if (want_spacing && width > 0)
7235 offset += Spacing;
7236 want_spacing |= (width > 0);
7237 if (update_offsets)
7238 {
7239 if (i == 1) { OffsetLabel = offset; }
7240 if (i == 2) { OffsetShortcut = offset; }
7241 if (i == 3) { OffsetMark = offset; }
7242 }
7243 offset += width;
7244 }
7245 NextTotalWidth = offset;
7246}
7247
7248float ImGuiMenuColumns::DeclColumns(float w_icon, float w_label, float w_shortcut, float w_mark)
7249{
7250 Widths[0] = ImMax(Widths[0], (ImU16)w_icon);
7251 Widths[1] = ImMax(Widths[1], (ImU16)w_label);
7252 Widths[2] = ImMax(Widths[2], (ImU16)w_shortcut);
7253 Widths[3] = ImMax(Widths[3], (ImU16)w_mark);
7254 CalcNextTotalWidth(false);
7255 return (float)ImMax(TotalWidth, NextTotalWidth);
7256}
7257
7258// FIXME: Provided a rectangle perhaps e.g. a BeginMenuBarEx() could be used anywhere..
7259// Currently the main responsibility of this function being to setup clip-rect + horizontal layout + menu navigation layer.
7260// Ideally we also want this to be responsible for claiming space out of the main window scrolling rectangle, in which case ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar will become unnecessary.
7261// Then later the same system could be used for multiple menu-bars, scrollbars, side-bars.
7262bool ImGui::BeginMenuBar()
7263{
7264 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7265 if (window->SkipItems)
7266 return false;
7267 if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
7268 return false;
7269
7270 IM_ASSERT(!window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
7271 BeginGroup(); // Backup position on layer 0 // FIXME: Misleading to use a group for that backup/restore
7272 PushID("##menubar");
7273
7274 // We don't clip with current window clipping rectangle as it is already set to the area below. However we clip with window full rect.
7275 // We remove 1 worth of rounding to Max.x to that text in long menus and small windows don't tend to display over the lower-right rounded area, which looks particularly glitchy.
7276 ImRect bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
7277 ImRect clip_rect(IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Min.x + window->WindowBorderSize), IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Min.y + window->WindowBorderSize), IM_ROUND(ImMax(bar_rect.Min.x, bar_rect.Max.x - ImMax(window->WindowRounding, window->WindowBorderSize))), IM_ROUND(bar_rect.Max.y));
7278 clip_rect.ClipWith(window->OuterRectClipped);
7279 PushClipRect(clip_rect.Min, clip_rect.Max, false);
7280
7281 // We overwrite CursorMaxPos because BeginGroup sets it to CursorPos (essentially the .EmitItem hack in EndMenuBar() would need something analogous here, maybe a BeginGroupEx() with flags).
7282 window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImVec2(bar_rect.Min.x + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x, bar_rect.Min.y + window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y);
7283 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal;
7284 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
7285 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
7286 window->DC.MenuBarAppending = true;
7287 AlignTextToFramePadding();
7288 return true;
7289}
7290
7291void ImGui::EndMenuBar()
7292{
7293 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7294 if (window->SkipItems)
7295 return;
7296 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7297
7298 // Nav: When a move request within one of our child menu failed, capture the request to navigate among our siblings.
7299 if (NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7300 {
7301 // Try to find out if the request is for one of our child menu
7302 ImGuiWindow* nav_earliest_child = g.NavWindow;
7303 while (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow && (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7304 nav_earliest_child = nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow;
7305 if (nav_earliest_child->ParentWindow == window && nav_earliest_child->DC.ParentLayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal && (g.NavMoveFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded) == 0)
7306 {
7307 // To do so we claim focus back, restore NavId and then process the movement request for yet another frame.
7308 // This involve a one-frame delay which isn't very problematic in this situation. We could remove it by scoring in advance for multiple window (probably not worth bothering)
7309 const ImGuiNavLayer layer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
7310 IM_ASSERT(window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext & (1 << layer)); // Sanity check (FIXME: Seems unnecessary)
7311 FocusWindow(window);
7312 SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
7313 g.NavDisableHighlight = true; // Hide highlight for the current frame so we don't see the intermediary selection.
7314 g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
7315 NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, g.NavMoveClipDir, g.NavMoveFlags, g.NavMoveScrollFlags); // Repeat
7316 }
7317 }
7318
7319 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
7320 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar);
7321 IM_ASSERT(window->DC.MenuBarAppending);
7322 PopClipRect();
7323 PopID();
7324 window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x; // Save horizontal position so next append can reuse it. This is kinda equivalent to a per-layer CursorPos.
7325
7326 // FIXME: Extremely confusing, cleanup by (a) working on WorkRect stack system (b) not using a Group confusingly here.
7327 ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
7328 group_data.EmitItem = false;
7329 ImVec2 restore_cursor_max_pos = group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos;
7330 window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->Scroll.x); // Convert ideal extents for scrolling layer equivalent.
7331 EndGroup(); // Restore position on layer 0 // FIXME: Misleading to use a group for that backup/restore
7332 window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
7333 window->DC.IsSameLine = false;
7334 window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
7335 window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
7336 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = restore_cursor_max_pos;
7337}
7338
7339// Important: calling order matters!
7340// FIXME: Somehow overlapping with docking tech.
7341// FIXME: The "rect-cut" aspect of this could be formalized into a lower-level helper (rect-cut: https://halt.software/dead-simple-layouts)
7342bool ImGui::BeginViewportSideBar(const char* name, ImGuiViewport* viewport_p, ImGuiDir dir, float axis_size, ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags)
7343{
7344 IM_ASSERT(dir != ImGuiDir_None);
7345
7346 ImGuiWindow* bar_window = FindWindowByName(name);
7347 if (bar_window == NULL || bar_window->BeginCount == 0)
7348 {
7349 // Calculate and set window size/position
7350 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)(viewport_p ? viewport_p : GetMainViewport());
7351 ImRect avail_rect = viewport->GetBuildWorkRect();
7352 ImGuiAxis axis = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? ImGuiAxis_Y : ImGuiAxis_X;
7353 ImVec2 pos = avail_rect.Min;
7354 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right || dir == ImGuiDir_Down)
7355 pos[axis] = avail_rect.Max[axis] - axis_size;
7356 ImVec2 size = avail_rect.GetSize();
7357 size[axis] = axis_size;
7358 SetNextWindowPos(pos);
7359 SetNextWindowSize(size);
7360
7361 // Report our size into work area (for next frame) using actual window size
7362 if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Left)
7363 viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin[axis] += axis_size;
7364 else if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down || dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
7365 viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax[axis] -= axis_size;
7366 }
7367
7368 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove;
7369 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowRounding, 0.0f);
7370 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowMinSize, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Lift normal size constraint
7371 bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, window_flags);
7372 PopStyleVar(2);
7373
7374 return is_open;
7375}
7376
7377bool ImGui::BeginMainMenuBar()
7378{
7379 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7380 ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)GetMainViewport();
7381
7382 // For the main menu bar, which cannot be moved, we honor g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding to ensure text can be visible on a TV set.
7383 // FIXME: This could be generalized as an opt-in way to clamp window->DC.CursorStartPos to avoid SafeArea?
7384 // FIXME: Consider removing support for safe area down the line... it's messy. Nowadays consoles have support for TV calibration in OS settings.
7385 g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.x, ImMax(g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding.y - g.Style.FramePadding.y, 0.0f));
7386 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
7387 float height = GetFrameHeight();
7388 bool is_open = BeginViewportSideBar("##MainMenuBar", viewport, ImGuiDir_Up, height, window_flags);
7389 g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
7390
7391 if (is_open)
7392 BeginMenuBar();
7393 else
7394 End();
7395 return is_open;
7396}
7397
7398void ImGui::EndMainMenuBar()
7399{
7400 EndMenuBar();
7401
7402 // When the user has left the menu layer (typically: closed menus through activation of an item), we restore focus to the previous window
7403 // FIXME: With this strategy we won't be able to restore a NULL focus.
7404 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7405 if (g.CurrentWindow == g.NavWindow && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && !g.NavAnyRequest)
7406 FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(g.NavWindow, NULL, NULL, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal | ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_RestoreFocusedChild);
7407
7408 End();
7409}
7410
7411static bool IsRootOfOpenMenuSet()
7412{
7413 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7414 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7415 if ((g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7416 return false;
7417
7418 // Initially we used 'upper_popup->OpenParentId == window->IDStack.back()' to differentiate multiple menu sets from each others
7419 // (e.g. inside menu bar vs loose menu items) based on parent ID.
7420 // This would however prevent the use of e.g. PushID() user code submitting menus.
7421 // Previously this worked between popup and a first child menu because the first child menu always had the _ChildWindow flag,
7422 // making hovering on parent popup possible while first child menu was focused - but this was generally a bug with other side effects.
7423 // Instead we don't treat Popup specifically (in order to consistently support menu features in them), maybe the first child menu of a Popup
7424 // doesn't have the _ChildWindow flag, and we rely on this IsRootOfOpenMenuSet() check to allow hovering between root window/popup and first child menu.
7425 // In the end, lack of ID check made it so we could no longer differentiate between separate menu sets. To compensate for that, we at least check parent window nav layer.
7426 // This fixes the most common case of menu opening on hover when moving between window content and menu bar. Multiple different menu sets in same nav layer would still
7427 // open on hover, but that should be a lesser problem, because if such menus are close in proximity in window content then it won't feel weird and if they are far apart
7428 // it likely won't be a problem anyone runs into.
7429 const ImGuiPopupData* upper_popup = &g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
7430 if (window->DC.NavLayerCurrent != upper_popup->ParentNavLayer)
7431 return false;
7432 return upper_popup->Window && (upper_popup->Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) && ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(upper_popup->Window, window, true);
7433}
7434
7435bool ImGui::BeginMenuEx(const char* label, const char* icon, bool enabled)
7436{
7437 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7438 if (window->SkipItems)
7439 return false;
7440
7441 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7442 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
7443 const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(label);
7444 bool menu_is_open = IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None);
7445
7446 // Sub-menus are ChildWindow so that mouse can be hovering across them (otherwise top-most popup menu would steal focus and not allow hovering on parent menu)
7447 // The first menu in a hierarchy isn't so hovering doesn't get across (otherwise e.g. resizing borders with ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren would react), but top-most BeginMenu() will bypass that limitation.
7448 ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus;
7449 if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
7450 window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
7451
7452 // If a menu with same the ID was already submitted, we will append to it, matching the behavior of Begin().
7453 // We are relying on a O(N) search - so O(N log N) over the frame - which seems like the most efficient for the expected small amount of BeginMenu() calls per frame.
7454 // If somehow this is ever becoming a problem we can switch to use e.g. ImGuiStorage mapping key to last frame used.
7455 if (g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.contains(id))
7456 {
7457 if (menu_is_open)
7458 menu_is_open = BeginPopupEx(id, window_flags); // menu_is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7459 else
7460 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // we behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7461 return menu_is_open;
7462 }
7463
7464 // Tag menu as used. Next time BeginMenu() with same ID is called it will append to existing menu
7465 g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.push_back(id);
7466
7467 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7468
7469 // Odd hack to allow hovering across menus of a same menu-set (otherwise we wouldn't be able to hover parent without always being a Child window)
7470 // This is only done for items for the menu set and not the full parent window.
7471 const bool menuset_is_open = IsRootOfOpenMenuSet();
7472 if (menuset_is_open)
7473 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck, true);
7474
7475 // The reference position stored in popup_pos will be used by Begin() to find a suitable position for the child menu,
7476 // However the final position is going to be different! It is chosen by FindBestWindowPosForPopup().
7477 // e.g. Menus tend to overlap each other horizontally to amplify relative Z-ordering.
7478 ImVec2 popup_pos, pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7479 PushID(label);
7480 if (!enabled)
7481 BeginDisabled();
7482 const ImGuiMenuColumns* offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
7483 bool pressed;
7484
7485 // We use ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner to allow down on one menu item, move, up on another.
7486 const ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID | ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick | ImGuiSelectableFlags_DontClosePopups;
7487 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7488 {
7489 // Menu inside an horizontal menu bar
7490 // Selectable extend their highlight by half ItemSpacing in each direction.
7491 // For ChildMenu, the popup position will be overwritten by the call to FindBestWindowPosForPopup() in Begin()
7492 popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x - 1.0f - IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f), pos.y - style.FramePadding.y + window->MenuBarHeight());
7493 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
7494 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
7495 float w = label_size.x;
7496 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
7497 pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, selectable_flags, ImVec2(w, label_size.y));
7498 RenderText(text_pos, label);
7499 PopStyleVar();
7500 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
7501 }
7502 else
7503 {
7504 // Menu inside a regular/vertical menu
7505 // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
7506 // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
7507 popup_pos = ImVec2(pos.x, pos.y - style.WindowPadding.y);
7508 float icon_w = (icon && icon[0]) ? CalcTextSize(icon, NULL).x : 0.0f;
7509 float checkmark_w = IM_TRUNC(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
7510 float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, 0.0f, checkmark_w); // Feedback to next frame
7511 float extra_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
7512 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
7513 pressed = Selectable("", menu_is_open, selectable_flags | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, label_size.y));
7514 RenderText(text_pos, label);
7515 if (icon_w > 0.0f)
7516 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetIcon, 0.0f), icon);
7517 RenderArrow(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + extra_w + g.FontSize * 0.30f, 0.0f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ImGuiDir_Right);
7518 }
7519 if (!enabled)
7520 EndDisabled();
7521
7522 const bool hovered = (g.HoveredId == id) && enabled && !g.NavDisableMouseHover;
7523 if (menuset_is_open)
7524 PopItemFlag();
7525
7526 bool want_open = false;
7527 bool want_open_nav_init = false;
7528 bool want_close = false;
7529 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical) // (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup|ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7530 {
7531 // Close menu when not hovering it anymore unless we are moving roughly in the direction of the menu
7532 // Implement http://bjk5.com/post/44698559168/breaking-down-amazons-mega-dropdown to avoid using timers, so menus feels more reactive.
7533 bool moving_toward_child_menu = false;
7534 ImGuiPopupData* child_popup = (g.BeginPopupStack.Size < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) ? &g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size] : NULL; // Popup candidate (testing below)
7535 ImGuiWindow* child_menu_window = (child_popup && child_popup->Window && child_popup->Window->ParentWindow == window) ? child_popup->Window : NULL;
7536 if (g.HoveredWindow == window && child_menu_window != NULL)
7537 {
7538 const float ref_unit = g.FontSize; // FIXME-DPI
7539 const float child_dir = (window->Pos.x < child_menu_window->Pos.x) ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
7540 const ImRect next_window_rect = child_menu_window->Rect();
7541 ImVec2 ta = (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseDelta);
7542 ImVec2 tb = (child_dir > 0.0f) ? next_window_rect.GetTL() : next_window_rect.GetTR();
7543 ImVec2 tc = (child_dir > 0.0f) ? next_window_rect.GetBL() : next_window_rect.GetBR();
7544 const float pad_farmost_h = ImClamp(ImFabs(ta.x - tb.x) * 0.30f, ref_unit * 0.5f, ref_unit * 2.5f); // Add a bit of extra slack.
7545 ta.x += child_dir * -0.5f;
7546 tb.x += child_dir * ref_unit;
7547 tc.x += child_dir * ref_unit;
7548 tb.y = ta.y + ImMax((tb.y - pad_farmost_h) - ta.y, -ref_unit * 8.0f); // Triangle has maximum height to limit the slope and the bias toward large sub-menus
7549 tc.y = ta.y + ImMin((tc.y + pad_farmost_h) - ta.y, +ref_unit * 8.0f);
7550 moving_toward_child_menu = ImTriangleContainsPoint(ta, tb, tc, g.IO.MousePos);
7551 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddTriangleFilled(ta, tb, tc, moving_toward_child_menu ? IM_COL32(0,128,0,128) : IM_COL32(128,0,0,128)); // [DEBUG]
7552 }
7553
7554 // The 'HovereWindow == window' check creates an inconsistency (e.g. moving away from menu slowly tends to hit same window, whereas moving away fast does not)
7555 // But we also need to not close the top-menu menu when moving over void. Perhaps we should extend the triangle check to a larger polygon.
7556 // (Remember to test this on BeginPopup("A")->BeginMenu("B") sequence which behaves slightly differently as B isn't a Child of A and hovering isn't shared.)
7557 if (menu_is_open && !hovered && g.HoveredWindow == window && !moving_toward_child_menu && !g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.ActiveId == 0)
7558 want_close = true;
7559
7560 // Open
7561 // (note: at this point 'hovered' actually includes the NavDisableMouseHover == false test)
7562 if (!menu_is_open && pressed) // Click/activate to open
7563 want_open = true;
7564 else if (!menu_is_open && hovered && !moving_toward_child_menu) // Hover to open
7565 want_open = true;
7566 else if (!menu_is_open && hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer >= 0.30f && g.MouseStationaryTimer >= 0.30f) // Hover to open (timer fallback)
7567 want_open = true;
7568 if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right) // Nav-Right to open
7569 {
7570 want_open = want_open_nav_init = true;
7571 NavMoveRequestCancel();
7572 NavRestoreHighlightAfterMove();
7573 }
7574 }
7575 else
7576 {
7577 // Menu bar
7578 if (menu_is_open && pressed && menuset_is_open) // Click an open menu again to close it
7579 {
7580 want_close = true;
7581 want_open = menu_is_open = false;
7582 }
7583 else if (pressed || (hovered && menuset_is_open && !menu_is_open)) // First click to open, then hover to open others
7584 {
7585 want_open = true;
7586 }
7587 else if (g.NavId == id && g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) // Nav-Down to open
7588 {
7589 want_open = true;
7590 NavMoveRequestCancel();
7591 }
7592 }
7593
7594 if (!enabled) // explicitly close if an open menu becomes disabled, facilitate users code a lot in pattern such as 'if (BeginMenu("options", has_object)) { ..use object.. }'
7595 want_close = true;
7596 if (want_close && IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
7597 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
7598
7599 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable | (menu_is_open ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened : 0));
7600 PopID();
7601
7602 if (want_open && !menu_is_open && g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size)
7603 {
7604 // Don't reopen/recycle same menu level in the same frame if it is a different menu ID, first close the other menu and yield for a frame.
7605 OpenPopup(label);
7606 }
7607 else if (want_open)
7608 {
7609 menu_is_open = true;
7610 OpenPopup(label, ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopen);// | (want_open_nav_init ? ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopenAlwaysNavInit : 0));
7611 }
7612
7613 if (menu_is_open)
7614 {
7615 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_in_parent = g.LastItemData;
7616 SetNextWindowPos(popup_pos, ImGuiCond_Always); // Note: misleading: the value will serve as reference for FindBestWindowPosForPopup(), not actual pos.
7617 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.PopupRounding); // First level will use _PopupRounding, subsequent will use _ChildRounding
7618 menu_is_open = BeginPopupEx(id, window_flags); // menu_is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7619 PopStyleVar();
7620 if (menu_is_open)
7621 {
7622 // Implement what ImGuiPopupFlags_NoReopenAlwaysNavInit would do:
7623 // Perform an init request in the case the popup was already open (via a previous mouse hover)
7624 if (want_open && want_open_nav_init && !g.NavInitRequest)
7625 {
7626 FocusWindow(g.CurrentWindow, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal);
7627 NavInitWindow(g.CurrentWindow, false);
7628 }
7629
7630 // Restore LastItemData so IsItemXXXX functions can work after BeginMenu()/EndMenu()
7631 // (This fixes using IsItemClicked() and IsItemHovered(), but IsItemHovered() also relies on its support for ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck)
7632 g.LastItemData = last_item_in_parent;
7633 if (g.HoveredWindow == window)
7634 g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
7635 }
7636 }
7637 else
7638 {
7639 g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7640 }
7641
7642 return menu_is_open;
7643}
7644
7645bool ImGui::BeginMenu(const char* label, bool enabled)
7646{
7647 return BeginMenuEx(label, NULL, enabled);
7648}
7649
7650void ImGui::EndMenu()
7651{
7652 // Nav: When a left move request our menu failed, close ourselves.
7653 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7654 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7655 IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginMenu()/EndMenu() calls
7656 ImGuiWindow* parent_window = window->ParentWindow; // Should always be != NULL is we passed assert.
7657 if (window->BeginCount == window->BeginCountPreviousFrame)
7658 if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet())
7659 if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window) && parent_window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical)
7660 {
7661 ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
7662 NavMoveRequestCancel();
7663 }
7664
7665 EndPopup();
7666}
7667
7668bool ImGui::MenuItemEx(const char* label, const char* icon, const char* shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
7669{
7670 ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7671 if (window->SkipItems)
7672 return false;
7673
7674 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7675 ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
7676 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7677 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
7678
7679 // See BeginMenuEx() for comments about this.
7680 const bool menuset_is_open = IsRootOfOpenMenuSet();
7681 if (menuset_is_open)
7682 PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck, true);
7683
7684 // We've been using the equivalent of ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover on all Selectable() since early Nav system days (commit 43ee5d73),
7685 // but I am unsure whether this should be kept at all. For now moved it to be an opt-in feature used by menus only.
7686 bool pressed;
7687 PushID(label);
7688 if (!enabled)
7689 BeginDisabled();
7690
7691 // We use ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner to allow down on one menu item, move, up on another.
7692 const ImGuiSelectableFlags selectable_flags = ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease | ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover;
7693 const ImGuiMenuColumns* offsets = &window->DC.MenuColumns;
7694 if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7695 {
7696 // Mimic the exact layout spacing of BeginMenu() to allow MenuItem() inside a menu bar, which is a little misleading but may be useful
7697 // Note that in this situation: we don't render the shortcut, we render a highlight instead of the selected tick mark.
7698 float w = label_size.x;
7699 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * 0.5f);
7700 ImVec2 text_pos(window->DC.CursorPos.x + offsets->OffsetLabel, window->DC.CursorPos.y + window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset);
7701 PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(style.ItemSpacing.x * 2.0f, style.ItemSpacing.y));
7702 pressed = Selectable("", selected, selectable_flags, ImVec2(w, 0.0f));
7703 PopStyleVar();
7704 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible)
7705 RenderText(text_pos, label);
7706 window->DC.CursorPos.x += IM_TRUNC(style.ItemSpacing.x * (-1.0f + 0.5f)); // -1 spacing to compensate the spacing added when Selectable() did a SameLine(). It would also work to call SameLine() ourselves after the PopStyleVar().
7707 }
7708 else
7709 {
7710 // Menu item inside a vertical menu
7711 // (In a typical menu window where all items are BeginMenu() or MenuItem() calls, extra_w will always be 0.0f.
7712 // Only when they are other items sticking out we're going to add spacing, yet only register minimum width into the layout system.
7713 float icon_w = (icon && icon[0]) ? CalcTextSize(icon, NULL).x : 0.0f;
7714 float shortcut_w = (shortcut && shortcut[0]) ? CalcTextSize(shortcut, NULL).x : 0.0f;
7715 float checkmark_w = IM_TRUNC(g.FontSize * 1.20f);
7716 float min_w = window->DC.MenuColumns.DeclColumns(icon_w, label_size.x, shortcut_w, checkmark_w); // Feedback for next frame
7717 float stretch_w = ImMax(0.0f, GetContentRegionAvail().x - min_w);
7718 pressed = Selectable("", false, selectable_flags | ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth, ImVec2(min_w, label_size.y));
7719 if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible)
7720 {
7721 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetLabel, 0.0f), label);
7722 if (icon_w > 0.0f)
7723 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetIcon, 0.0f), icon);
7724 if (shortcut_w > 0.0f)
7725 {
7726 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]);
7727 RenderText(pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetShortcut + stretch_w, 0.0f), shortcut, NULL, false);
7728 PopStyleColor();
7729 }
7730 if (selected)
7731 RenderCheckMark(window->DrawList, pos + ImVec2(offsets->OffsetMark + stretch_w + g.FontSize * 0.40f, g.FontSize * 0.134f * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), g.FontSize * 0.866f);
7732 }
7733 }
7734 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(g.LastItemData.ID, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags | ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable | (selected ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked : 0));
7735 if (!enabled)
7736 EndDisabled();
7737 PopID();
7738 if (menuset_is_open)
7739 PopItemFlag();
7740
7741 return pressed;
7742}
7743
7744bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool selected, bool enabled)
7745{
7746 return MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, selected, enabled);
7747}
7748
7749bool ImGui::MenuItem(const char* label, const char* shortcut, bool* p_selected, bool enabled)
7750{
7751 if (MenuItemEx(label, NULL, shortcut, p_selected ? *p_selected : false, enabled))
7752 {
7753 if (p_selected)
7754 *p_selected = !*p_selected;
7755 return true;
7756 }
7757 return false;
7758}
7759
7760//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7761// [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabBar, EndTabBar, etc.
7762//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7763// - BeginTabBar()
7764// - BeginTabBarEx() [Internal]
7765// - EndTabBar()
7766// - TabBarLayout() [Internal]
7767// - TabBarCalcTabID() [Internal]
7768// - TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth() [Internal]
7769// - TabBarFindTabById() [Internal]
7770// - TabBarFindTabByOrder() [Internal]
7771// - TabBarGetCurrentTab() [Internal]
7772// - TabBarGetTabName() [Internal]
7773// - TabBarRemoveTab() [Internal]
7774// - TabBarCloseTab() [Internal]
7775// - TabBarScrollClamp() [Internal]
7776// - TabBarScrollToTab() [Internal]
7777// - TabBarQueueFocus() [Internal]
7778// - TabBarQueueReorder() [Internal]
7779// - TabBarProcessReorderFromMousePos() [Internal]
7780// - TabBarProcessReorder() [Internal]
7781// - TabBarScrollingButtons() [Internal]
7782// - TabBarTabListPopupButton() [Internal]
7783//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
7784
7785struct ImGuiTabBarSection
7786{
7787 int TabCount; // Number of tabs in this section.
7788 float Width; // Sum of width of tabs in this section (after shrinking down)
7789 float Spacing; // Horizontal spacing at the end of the section.
7790
7791 ImGuiTabBarSection() { memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this)); }
7792};
7793
7794namespace ImGui
7795{
7796 static void TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
7797 static ImU32 TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, ImGuiWindow* docked_window);
7798 static float TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth();
7799 static float TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, float scrolling);
7800 static void TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections);
7801 static ImGuiTabItem* TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
7802 static ImGuiTabItem* TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
7803}
7804
7805ImGuiTabBar::ImGuiTabBar()
7806{
7807 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
7808 CurrFrameVisible = PrevFrameVisible = -1;
7809 LastTabItemIdx = -1;
7810}
7811
7812static inline int TabItemGetSectionIdx(const ImGuiTabItem* tab)
7813{
7814 return (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading) ? 0 : (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing) ? 2 : 1;
7815}
7816
7817static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerBySection(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
7818{
7819 const ImGuiTabItem* a = (const ImGuiTabItem*)lhs;
7820 const ImGuiTabItem* b = (const ImGuiTabItem*)rhs;
7821 const int a_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(a);
7822 const int b_section = TabItemGetSectionIdx(b);
7823 if (a_section != b_section)
7824 return a_section - b_section;
7825 return (int)(a->IndexDuringLayout - b->IndexDuringLayout);
7826}
7827
7828static int IMGUI_CDECL TabItemComparerByBeginOrder(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
7829{
7830 const ImGuiTabItem* a = (const ImGuiTabItem*)lhs;
7831 const ImGuiTabItem* b = (const ImGuiTabItem*)rhs;
7832 return (int)(a->BeginOrder - b->BeginOrder);
7833}
7834
7835static ImGuiTabBar* GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(const ImGuiPtrOrIndex& ref)
7836{
7837 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7838 return ref.Ptr ? (ImGuiTabBar*)ref.Ptr : g.TabBars.GetByIndex(ref.Index);
7839}
7840
7841static ImGuiPtrOrIndex GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
7842{
7843 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7844 if (g.TabBars.Contains(tab_bar))
7845 return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(g.TabBars.GetIndex(tab_bar));
7846 return ImGuiPtrOrIndex(tab_bar);
7847}
7848
7849bool ImGui::BeginTabBar(const char* str_id, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
7850{
7851 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7852 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7853 if (window->SkipItems)
7854 return false;
7855
7856 ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
7857 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.TabBars.GetOrAddByKey(id);
7858 ImRect tab_bar_bb = ImRect(window->DC.CursorPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y, window->WorkRect.Max.x, window->DC.CursorPos.y + g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2);
7859 tab_bar->ID = id;
7860 tab_bar->SeparatorMinX = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
7861 tab_bar->SeparatorMaxX = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x + IM_TRUNC(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f);
7862 return BeginTabBarEx(tab_bar, tab_bar_bb, flags | ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused);
7863}
7864
7865bool ImGui::BeginTabBarEx(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const ImRect& tab_bar_bb, ImGuiTabBarFlags flags)
7866{
7867 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7868 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7869 if (window->SkipItems)
7870 return false;
7871
7872 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ID != 0);
7873 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
7874 PushOverrideID(tab_bar->ID);
7875
7876 // Add to stack
7877 g.CurrentTabBarStack.push_back(GetTabBarRefFromTabBar(tab_bar));
7878 g.CurrentTabBar = tab_bar;
7879
7880 // Append with multiple BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar() pairs.
7881 tab_bar->BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7882 if (tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible == g.FrameCount)
7883 {
7884 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
7885 tab_bar->BeginCount++;
7886 return true;
7887 }
7888
7889 // Ensure correct ordering when toggling ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable flag, or when a new tab was added while being not reorderable
7890 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) != (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) || (tab_bar->TabsAddedNew && !(flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable)))
7891 ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerByBeginOrder);
7892 tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = false;
7893
7894 // Flags
7895 if ((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_) == 0)
7896 flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
7897
7898 tab_bar->Flags = flags;
7899 tab_bar->BarRect = tab_bar_bb;
7900 tab_bar->WantLayout = true; // Layout will be done on the first call to ItemTab()
7901 tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible = tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible;
7902 tab_bar->CurrFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
7903 tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight = tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
7904 tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = 0.0f;
7905 tab_bar->ItemSpacingY = g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7906 tab_bar->FramePadding = g.Style.FramePadding;
7907 tab_bar->TabsActiveCount = 0;
7908 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = -1;
7909 tab_bar->BeginCount = 1;
7910
7911 // Set cursor pos in a way which only be used in the off-chance the user erroneously submits item before BeginTabItem(): items will overlap
7912 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->ItemSpacingY);
7913
7914 // Draw separator
7915 // (it would be misleading to draw this in EndTabBar() suggesting that it may be drawn over tabs, as tab bar are appendable)
7916 const ImU32 col = GetColorU32((flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) ? ImGuiCol_TabActive : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive);
7917 if (g.Style.TabBarBorderSize > 0.0f)
7918 {
7919 const float y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y;
7920 window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(tab_bar->SeparatorMinX, y - g.Style.TabBarBorderSize), ImVec2(tab_bar->SeparatorMaxX, y), col);
7921 }
7922 return true;
7923}
7924
7925void ImGui::EndTabBar()
7926{
7927 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7928 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7929 if (window->SkipItems)
7930 return;
7931
7932 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
7933 if (tab_bar == NULL)
7934 {
7935 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Mismatched BeginTabBar()/EndTabBar()!");
7936 return;
7937 }
7938
7939 // Fallback in case no TabItem have been submitted
7940 if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
7941 TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
7942
7943 // Restore the last visible height if no tab is visible, this reduce vertical flicker/movement when a tabs gets removed without calling SetTabItemClosed().
7944 const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
7945 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted || tab_bar->VisibleTabId == 0 || tab_bar_appearing)
7946 {
7947 tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight = ImMax(window->DC.CursorPos.y - tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y, tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight);
7948 window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->CurrTabsContentsHeight;
7949 }
7950 else
7951 {
7952 window->DC.CursorPos.y = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y + tab_bar->PrevTabsContentsHeight;
7953 }
7954 if (tab_bar->BeginCount > 1)
7955 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BackupCursorPos;
7956
7957 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = -1;
7958 if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode) == 0)
7959 PopID();
7960
7961 g.CurrentTabBarStack.pop_back();
7962 g.CurrentTabBar = g.CurrentTabBarStack.empty() ? NULL : GetTabBarFromTabBarRef(g.CurrentTabBarStack.back());
7963}
7964
7965// Scrolling happens only in the central section (leading/trailing sections are not scrolling)
7966static float TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections)
7967{
7968 return tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - sections[0].Width - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
7969}
7970
7971// This is called only once a frame before by the first call to ItemTab()
7972// The reason we're not calling it in BeginTabBar() is to leave a chance to the user to call the SetTabItemClosed() functions.
7973static void ImGui::TabBarLayout(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
7974{
7975 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7976 tab_bar->WantLayout = false;
7977
7978 // Garbage collect by compacting list
7979 // Detect if we need to sort out tab list (e.g. in rare case where a tab changed section)
7980 int tab_dst_n = 0;
7981 bool need_sort_by_section = false;
7982 ImGuiTabBarSection sections[3]; // Layout sections: Leading, Central, Trailing
7983 for (int tab_src_n = 0; tab_src_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_src_n++)
7984 {
7985 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
7986 if (tab->LastFrameVisible < tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible || tab->WantClose)
7987 {
7988 // Remove tab
7989 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0; }
7990 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0; }
7991 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab->ID) { tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0; }
7992 continue;
7993 }
7994 if (tab_dst_n != tab_src_n)
7995 tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n] = tab_bar->Tabs[tab_src_n];
7996
7997 tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n];
7998 tab->IndexDuringLayout = (ImS16)tab_dst_n;
7999
8000 // We will need sorting if tabs have changed section (e.g. moved from one of Leading/Central/Trailing to another)
8001 int curr_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
8002 if (tab_dst_n > 0)
8003 {
8004 ImGuiTabItem* prev_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_dst_n - 1];
8005 int prev_tab_section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(prev_tab);
8006 if (curr_tab_section_n == 0 && prev_tab_section_n != 0)
8007 need_sort_by_section = true;
8008 if (prev_tab_section_n == 2 && curr_tab_section_n != 2)
8009 need_sort_by_section = true;
8010 }
8011
8012 sections[curr_tab_section_n].TabCount++;
8013 tab_dst_n++;
8014 }
8015 if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size != tab_dst_n)
8016 tab_bar->Tabs.resize(tab_dst_n);
8017
8018 if (need_sort_by_section)
8019 ImQsort(tab_bar->Tabs.Data, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, sizeof(ImGuiTabItem), TabItemComparerBySection);
8020
8021 // Calculate spacing between sections
8022 sections[0].Spacing = sections[0].TabCount > 0 && (sections[1].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount) > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
8023 sections[1].Spacing = sections[1].TabCount > 0 && sections[2].TabCount > 0 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f;
8024
8025 // Setup next selected tab
8026 ImGuiID scroll_to_tab_id = 0;
8027 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId)
8028 {
8029 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId;
8030 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
8031 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
8032 }
8033
8034 // Process order change request (we could probably process it when requested but it's just saner to do it in a single spot).
8035 if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId != 0)
8036 {
8037 if (TabBarProcessReorder(tab_bar))
8038 if (tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
8039 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId;
8040 tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = 0;
8041 }
8042
8043 // Tab List Popup (will alter tab_bar->BarRect and therefore the available width!)
8044 const bool tab_list_popup_button = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton) != 0;
8045 if (tab_list_popup_button)
8046 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_select = TabBarTabListPopupButton(tab_bar)) // NB: Will alter BarRect.Min.x!
8047 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_to_select->ID;
8048
8049 // Leading/Trailing tabs will be shrink only if central one aren't visible anymore, so layout the shrink data as: leading, trailing, central
8050 // (whereas our tabs are stored as: leading, central, trailing)
8051 int shrink_buffer_indexes[3] = { 0, sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount, sections[0].TabCount };
8052 g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.resize(tab_bar->Tabs.Size);
8053
8054 // Compute ideal tabs widths + store them into shrink buffer
8055 ImGuiTabItem* most_recently_selected_tab = NULL;
8056 int curr_section_n = -1;
8057 bool found_selected_tab_id = false;
8058 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
8059 {
8060 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
8061 IM_ASSERT(tab->LastFrameVisible >= tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible);
8062
8063 if ((most_recently_selected_tab == NULL || most_recently_selected_tab->LastFrameSelected < tab->LastFrameSelected) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button))
8064 most_recently_selected_tab = tab;
8065 if (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId)
8066 found_selected_tab_id = true;
8067 if (scroll_to_tab_id == 0 && g.NavJustMovedToId == tab->ID)
8068 scroll_to_tab_id = tab->ID;
8069
8070 // Refresh tab width immediately, otherwise changes of style e.g. style.FramePadding.x would noticeably lag in the tab bar.
8071 // Additionally, when using TabBarAddTab() to manipulate tab bar order we occasionally insert new tabs that don't have a width yet,
8072 // and we cannot wait for the next BeginTabItem() call. We cannot compute this width within TabBarAddTab() because font size depends on the active window.
8073 const char* tab_name = TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab);
8074 const bool has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton) == 0 || (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument);
8075 tab->ContentWidth = (tab->RequestedWidth >= 0.0f) ? tab->RequestedWidth : TabItemCalcSize(tab_name, has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker).x;
8076
8077 int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
8078 ImGuiTabBarSection* section = &sections[section_n];
8079 section->Width += tab->ContentWidth + (section_n == curr_section_n ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
8080 curr_section_n = section_n;
8081
8082 // Store data so we can build an array sorted by width if we need to shrink tabs down
8083 IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6385);
8084 ImGuiShrinkWidthItem* shrink_width_item = &g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[shrink_buffer_indexes[section_n]++];
8085 shrink_width_item->Index = tab_n;
8086 shrink_width_item->Width = shrink_width_item->InitialWidth = tab->ContentWidth;
8087 tab->Width = ImMax(tab->ContentWidth, 1.0f);
8088 }
8089
8090 // Compute total ideal width (used for e.g. auto-resizing a window)
8091 tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal = 0.0f;
8092 for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
8093 tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal += sections[section_n].Width + sections[section_n].Spacing;
8094
8095 // Horizontal scrolling buttons
8096 // (note that TabBarScrollButtons() will alter BarRect.Max.x)
8097 if ((tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal > tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() && tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 1) && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTabListScrollingButtons) && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
8098 if (ImGuiTabItem* scroll_and_select_tab = TabBarScrollingButtons(tab_bar))
8099 {
8100 scroll_to_tab_id = scroll_and_select_tab->ID;
8101 if ((scroll_and_select_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) == 0)
8102 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = scroll_to_tab_id;
8103 }
8104
8105 // Shrink widths if full tabs don't fit in their allocated space
8106 float section_0_w = sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
8107 float section_1_w = sections[1].Width + sections[1].Spacing;
8108 float section_2_w = sections[2].Width + sections[2].Spacing;
8109 bool central_section_is_visible = (section_0_w + section_2_w) < tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth();
8110 float width_excess;
8111 if (central_section_is_visible)
8112 width_excess = ImMax(section_1_w - (tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section_0_w - section_2_w), 0.0f); // Excess used to shrink central section
8113 else
8114 width_excess = (section_0_w + section_2_w) - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth(); // Excess used to shrink leading/trailing section
8115
8116 // With ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll policy, we will only shrink leading/trailing if the central section is not visible anymore
8117 if (width_excess >= 1.0f && ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown) || !central_section_is_visible))
8118 {
8119 int shrink_data_count = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[1].TabCount : sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount);
8120 int shrink_data_offset = (central_section_is_visible ? sections[0].TabCount + sections[2].TabCount : 0);
8121 ShrinkWidths(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.Data + shrink_data_offset, shrink_data_count, width_excess);
8122
8123 // Apply shrunk values into tabs and sections
8124 for (int tab_n = shrink_data_offset; tab_n < shrink_data_offset + shrink_data_count; tab_n++)
8125 {
8126 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Index];
8127 float shrinked_width = IM_TRUNC(g.ShrinkWidthBuffer[tab_n].Width);
8128 if (shrinked_width < 0.0f)
8129 continue;
8130
8131 shrinked_width = ImMax(1.0f, shrinked_width);
8132 int section_n = TabItemGetSectionIdx(tab);
8133 sections[section_n].Width -= (tab->Width - shrinked_width);
8134 tab->Width = shrinked_width;
8135 }
8136 }
8137
8138 // Layout all active tabs
8139 int section_tab_index = 0;
8140 float tab_offset = 0.0f;
8141 tab_bar->WidthAllTabs = 0.0f;
8142 for (int section_n = 0; section_n < 3; section_n++)
8143 {
8144 ImGuiTabBarSection* section = &sections[section_n];
8145 if (section_n == 2)
8146 tab_offset = ImMin(ImMax(0.0f, tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth() - section->Width), tab_offset);
8147
8148 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < section->TabCount; tab_n++)
8149 {
8150 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[section_tab_index + tab_n];
8151 tab->Offset = tab_offset;
8152 tab->NameOffset = -1;
8153 tab_offset += tab->Width + (tab_n < section->TabCount - 1 ? g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x : 0.0f);
8154 }
8155 tab_bar->WidthAllTabs += ImMax(section->Width + section->Spacing, 0.0f);
8156 tab_offset += section->Spacing;
8157 section_tab_index += section->TabCount;
8158 }
8159
8160 // Clear name buffers
8161 tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.resize(0);
8162
8163 // If we have lost the selected tab, select the next most recently active one
8164 if (found_selected_tab_id == false)
8165 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0;
8166 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0 && most_recently_selected_tab != NULL)
8167 scroll_to_tab_id = tab_bar->SelectedTabId = most_recently_selected_tab->ID;
8168
8169 // Lock in visible tab
8170 tab_bar->VisibleTabId = tab_bar->SelectedTabId;
8171 tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = false;
8172
8173 // Apply request requests
8174 if (scroll_to_tab_id != 0)
8175 TabBarScrollToTab(tab_bar, scroll_to_tab_id, sections);
8176 else if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll) && IsMouseHoveringRect(tab_bar->BarRect.Min, tab_bar->BarRect.Max, true) && IsWindowContentHoverable(g.CurrentWindow))
8177 {
8178 const float wheel = g.IO.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap ? g.IO.MouseWheel : g.IO.MouseWheelH;
8179 const ImGuiKey wheel_key = g.IO.MouseWheelRequestAxisSwap ? ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY : ImGuiKey_MouseWheelX;
8180 if (TestKeyOwner(wheel_key, tab_bar->ID) && wheel != 0.0f)
8181 {
8182 const float scroll_step = wheel * TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(tab_bar, sections) / 3.0f;
8183 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = 0.0f;
8184 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget - scroll_step);
8185 }
8186 SetKeyOwner(wheel_key, tab_bar->ID);
8187 }
8188
8189 // Update scrolling
8190 tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingAnim);
8191 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = TabBarScrollClamp(tab_bar, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget);
8192 if (tab_bar->ScrollingAnim != tab_bar->ScrollingTarget)
8193 {
8194 // Scrolling speed adjust itself so we can always reach our target in 1/3 seconds.
8195 // Teleport if we are aiming far off the visible line
8196 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, 70.0f * g.FontSize);
8197 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed, ImFabs(tab_bar->ScrollingTarget - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim) / 0.3f);
8198 const bool teleport = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount) || (tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility > 10.0f * g.FontSize);
8199 tab_bar->ScrollingAnim = teleport ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : ImLinearSweep(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, tab_bar->ScrollingTarget, g.IO.DeltaTime * tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed);
8200 }
8201 else
8202 {
8203 tab_bar->ScrollingSpeed = 0.0f;
8204 }
8205 tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + sections[0].Width + sections[0].Spacing;
8206 tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX = tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - sections[2].Width - sections[1].Spacing;
8207
8208 // Actual layout in host window (we don't do it in BeginTabBar() so as not to waste an extra frame)
8209 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8210 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min;
8211 ItemSize(ImVec2(tab_bar->WidthAllTabs, tab_bar->BarRect.GetHeight()), tab_bar->FramePadding.y);
8212 window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x + tab_bar->WidthAllTabsIdeal);
8213}
8214
8215// Dockable windows uses Name/ID in the global namespace. Non-dockable items use the ID stack.
8216static ImU32 ImGui::TabBarCalcTabID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, ImGuiWindow* docked_window)
8217{
8218 IM_ASSERT(docked_window == NULL); // master branch only
8219 IM_UNUSED(docked_window);
8220 if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode)
8221 {
8222 ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(label);
8223 KeepAliveID(id);
8224 return id;
8225 }
8226 else
8227 {
8228 ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8229 return window->GetID(label);
8230 }
8231}
8232
8233static float ImGui::TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()
8234{
8235 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8236 return g.FontSize * 20.0f;
8237}
8238
8239ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarFindTabByID(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
8240{
8241 if (tab_id != 0)
8242 for (int n = 0; n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; n++)
8243 if (tab_bar->Tabs[n].ID == tab_id)
8244 return &tab_bar->Tabs[n];
8245 return NULL;
8246}
8247
8248// Order = visible order, not submission order! (which is tab->BeginOrder)
8249ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarFindTabByOrder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, int order)
8250{
8251 if (order < 0 || order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
8252 return NULL;
8253 return &tab_bar->Tabs[order];
8254}
8255
