8256ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarGetCurrentTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
8257{
8258 if (tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx <= 0 || tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
8259 return NULL;
8260 return &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
8261}
8262
8263const char* ImGui::TabBarGetTabName(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
8264{
8265 if (tab->NameOffset == -1)
8266 return "N/A";
8267 IM_ASSERT(tab->NameOffset < tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.Size);
8268 return tab_bar->TabsNames.Buf.Data + tab->NameOffset;
8269}
8270
8271// The *TabId fields are already set by the docking system _before_ the actual TabItem was created, so we clear them regardless.
8272void ImGui::TabBarRemoveTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id)
8273{
8274 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
8275 tab_bar->Tabs.erase(tab);
8276 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->VisibleTabId = 0; }
8277 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->SelectedTabId = 0; }
8278 if (tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == tab_id) { tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0; }
8279}
8280
8281// Called on manual closure attempt
8282void ImGui::TabBarCloseTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
8283{
8284 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
8285 return; // A button appended with TabItemButton().
8286
8287 if ((tab->Flags & (ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoAssumedClosure)) == 0)
8288 {
8289 // This will remove a frame of lag for selecting another tab on closure.
8290 // However we don't run it in the case where the 'Unsaved' flag is set, so user gets a chance to fully undo the closure
8291 tab->WantClose = true;
8292 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == tab->ID)
8293 {
8294 tab->LastFrameVisible = -1;
8295 tab_bar->SelectedTabId = tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = 0;
8296 }
8297 }
8298 else
8299 {
8300 // Actually select before expecting closure attempt (on an UnsavedDocument tab user is expect to e.g. show a popup)
8301 if (tab_bar->VisibleTabId != tab->ID)
8302 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
8303 }
8304}
8305
8306static float ImGui::TabBarScrollClamp(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, float scrolling)
8307{
8308 scrolling = ImMin(scrolling, tab_bar->WidthAllTabs - tab_bar->BarRect.GetWidth());
8309 return ImMax(scrolling, 0.0f);
8310}
8311
8312// Note: we may scroll to tab that are not selected! e.g. using keyboard arrow keys
8313static void ImGui::TabBarScrollToTab(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiTabBarSection* sections)
8314{
8315 ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id);
8316 if (tab == NULL)
8317 return;
8318 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_)
8319 return;
8320
8321 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8322 float margin = g.FontSize * 1.0f; // When to scroll to make Tab N+1 visible always make a bit of N visible to suggest more scrolling area (since we don't have a scrollbar)
8323 int order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab);
8324
8325 // Scrolling happens only in the central section (leading/trailing sections are not scrolling)
8326 float scrollable_width = TabBarCalcScrollableWidth(tab_bar, sections);
8327
8328 // We make all tabs positions all relative Sections[0].Width to make code simpler
8329 float tab_x1 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + (order > sections[0].TabCount - 1 ? -margin : 0.0f);
8330 float tab_x2 = tab->Offset - sections[0].Width + tab->Width + (order + 1 < tab_bar->Tabs.Size - sections[2].TabCount ? margin : 1.0f);
8331 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = 0.0f;
8332 if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget > tab_x1 || (tab_x2 - tab_x1 >= scrollable_width))
8333 {
8334 // Scroll to the left
8335 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax(tab_bar->ScrollingAnim - tab_x2, 0.0f);
8336 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x1;
8337 }
8338 else if (tab_bar->ScrollingTarget < tab_x2 - scrollable_width)
8339 {
8340 // Scroll to the right
8341 tab_bar->ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility = ImMax((tab_x1 - scrollable_width) - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim, 0.0f);
8342 tab_bar->ScrollingTarget = tab_x2 - scrollable_width;
8343 }
8344}
8345
8346void ImGui::TabBarQueueFocus(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab)
8347{
8348 tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = tab->ID;
8349}
8350
8351void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* tab, int offset)
8352{
8353 IM_ASSERT(offset != 0);
8354 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
8355 tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId = tab->ID;
8356 tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset = (ImS16)offset;
8357}
8358
8359void ImGui::TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, ImGuiTabItem* src_tab, ImVec2 mouse_pos)
8360{
8361 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8362 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId == 0);
8363 if ((tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable) == 0)
8364 return;
8365
8366 const bool is_central_section = (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
8367 const float bar_offset = tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - (is_central_section ? tab_bar->ScrollingTarget : 0);
8368
8369 // Count number of contiguous tabs we are crossing over
8370 const int dir = (bar_offset + src_tab->Offset) > mouse_pos.x ? -1 : +1;
8371 const int src_idx = tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(src_tab);
8372 int dst_idx = src_idx;
8373 for (int i = src_idx; i >= 0 && i < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; i += dir)
8374 {
8375 // Reordered tabs must share the same section
8376 const ImGuiTabItem* dst_tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[i];
8377 if (dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
8378 break;
8379 if ((dst_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (src_tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
8380 break;
8381 dst_idx = i;
8382
8383 // Include spacing after tab, so when mouse cursor is between tabs we would not continue checking further tabs that are not hovered.
8384 const float x1 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset - g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
8385 const float x2 = bar_offset + dst_tab->Offset + dst_tab->Width + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
8386 //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(ImVec2(x1, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(x2, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
8387 if ((dir < 0 && mouse_pos.x > x1) || (dir > 0 && mouse_pos.x < x2))
8388 break;
8389 }
8390
8391 if (dst_idx != src_idx)
8392 TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, src_tab, dst_idx - src_idx);
8393}
8394
8395bool ImGui::TabBarProcessReorder(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
8396{
8397 ImGuiTabItem* tab1 = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->ReorderRequestTabId);
8398 if (tab1 == NULL || (tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder))
8399 return false;
8400
8401 //IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable); // <- this may happen when using debug tools
8402 int tab2_order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab1) + tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
8403 if (tab2_order < 0 || tab2_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size)
8404 return false;
8405
8406 // Reordered tabs must share the same section
8407 // (Note: TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos() also has a similar test but since we allow direct calls to TabBarQueueReorder() we do it here too)
8408 ImGuiTabItem* tab2 = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab2_order];
8409 if (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder)
8410 return false;
8411 if ((tab1->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) != (tab2->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_))
8412 return false;
8413
8414 ImGuiTabItem item_tmp = *tab1;
8415 ImGuiTabItem* src_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 + 1 : tab2;
8416 ImGuiTabItem* dst_tab = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab1 : tab2 + 1;
8417 const int move_count = (tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset > 0) ? tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset : -tab_bar->ReorderRequestOffset;
8418 memmove(dst_tab, src_tab, move_count * sizeof(ImGuiTabItem));
8419 *tab2 = item_tmp;
8420
8421 if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_SaveSettings)
8422 MarkIniSettingsDirty();
8423 return true;
8424}
8425
8426static ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarScrollingButtons(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
8427{
8428 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8429 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8430
8431 const ImVec2 arrow_button_size(g.FontSize - 2.0f, g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
8432 const float scrolling_buttons_width = arrow_button_size.x * 2.0f;
8433
8434 const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8435 //window->DrawList->AddRect(ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
8436
8437 int select_dir = 0;
8438 ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
8439 arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
8440
8441 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
8442 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
8443 const float backup_repeat_delay = g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay;
8444 const float backup_repeat_rate = g.IO.KeyRepeatRate;
8445 g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = 0.250f;
8446 g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = 0.200f;
8447 float x = ImMax(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x - scrolling_buttons_width);
8448 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
8449 if (ArrowButtonEx("##<", ImGuiDir_Left, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick | ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat))
8450 select_dir = -1;
8451 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(x + arrow_button_size.x, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
8452 if (ArrowButtonEx("##>", ImGuiDir_Right, arrow_button_size, ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick | ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat))
8453 select_dir = +1;
8454 PopStyleColor(2);
8455 g.IO.KeyRepeatRate = backup_repeat_rate;
8456 g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay = backup_repeat_delay;
8457
8458 ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_scroll_to = NULL;
8459 if (select_dir != 0)
8460 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab_item = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_bar->SelectedTabId))
8461 {
8462 int selected_order = TabBarGetTabOrder(tab_bar, tab_item);
8463 int target_order = selected_order + select_dir;
8464
8465 // Skip tab item buttons until another tab item is found or end is reached
8466 while (tab_to_scroll_to == NULL)
8467 {
8468 // If we are at the end of the list, still scroll to make our tab visible
8469 tab_to_scroll_to = &tab_bar->Tabs[(target_order >= 0 && target_order < tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? target_order : selected_order];
8470
8471 // Cross through buttons
8472 // (even if first/last item is a button, return it so we can update the scroll)
8473 if (tab_to_scroll_to->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
8474 {
8475 target_order += select_dir;
8476 selected_order += select_dir;
8477 tab_to_scroll_to = (target_order < 0 || target_order >= tab_bar->Tabs.Size) ? tab_to_scroll_to : NULL;
8478 }
8479 }
8480 }
8481 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
8482 tab_bar->BarRect.Max.x -= scrolling_buttons_width + 1.0f;
8483
8484 return tab_to_scroll_to;
8485}
8486
8487static ImGuiTabItem* ImGui::TabBarTabListPopupButton(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
8488{
8489 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8490 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8491
8492 // We use g.Style.FramePadding.y to match the square ArrowButton size
8493 const float tab_list_popup_button_width = g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y;
8494 const ImVec2 backup_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8495 window->DC.CursorPos = ImVec2(tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x - g.Style.FramePadding.y, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y);
8496 tab_bar->BarRect.Min.x += tab_list_popup_button_width;
8497
8498 ImVec4 arrow_col = g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_Text];
8499 arrow_col.w *= 0.5f;
8500 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, arrow_col);
8501 PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, ImVec4(0, 0, 0, 0));
8502 bool open = BeginCombo("##v", NULL, ImGuiComboFlags_NoPreview | ImGuiComboFlags_HeightLargest);
8503 PopStyleColor(2);
8504
8505 ImGuiTabItem* tab_to_select = NULL;
8506 if (open)
8507 {
8508 for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
8509 {
8510 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
8511 if (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)
8512 continue;
8513
8514 const char* tab_name = TabBarGetTabName(tab_bar, tab);
8515 if (Selectable(tab_name, tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID))
8516 tab_to_select = tab;
8517 }
8518 EndCombo();
8519 }
8520
8521 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_cursor_pos;
8522 return tab_to_select;
8523}
8524
8525//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8526// [SECTION] Widgets: BeginTabItem, EndTabItem, etc.
8527//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8528// - BeginTabItem()
8529// - EndTabItem()
8530// - TabItemButton()
8531// - TabItemEx() [Internal]
8532// - SetTabItemClosed()
8533// - TabItemCalcSize() [Internal]
8534// - TabItemBackground() [Internal]
8535// - TabItemLabelAndCloseButton() [Internal]
8536//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
8537
8538bool ImGui::BeginTabItem(const char* label, bool* p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
8539{
8540 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8541 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8542 if (window->SkipItems)
8543 return false;
8544
8545 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8546 if (tab_bar == NULL)
8547 {
8548 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8549 return false;
8550 }
8551 IM_ASSERT(!(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button)); // BeginTabItem() Can't be used with button flags, use TabItemButton() instead!
8552
8553 bool ret = TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, p_open, flags, NULL);
8554 if (ret && !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
8555 {
8556 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
8557 PushOverrideID(tab->ID); // We already hashed 'label' so push into the ID stack directly instead of doing another hash through PushID(label)
8558 }
8559 return ret;
8560}
8561
8562void ImGui::EndTabItem()
8563{
8564 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8565 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8566 if (window->SkipItems)
8567 return;
8568
8569 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8570 if (tab_bar == NULL)
8571 {
8572 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8573 return;
8574 }
8575 IM_ASSERT(tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx >= 0);
8576 ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx];
8577 if (!(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoPushId))
8578 PopID();
8579}
8580
8581bool ImGui::TabItemButton(const char* label, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags)
8582{
8583 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8584 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8585 if (window->SkipItems)
8586 return false;
8587
8588 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8589 if (tab_bar == NULL)
8590 {
8591 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(tab_bar != NULL, "Needs to be called between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar()!");
8592 return false;
8593 }
8594 return TabItemEx(tab_bar, label, NULL, flags | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoReorder, NULL);
8595}
8596
8597bool ImGui::TabItemEx(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar, const char* label, bool* p_open, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* docked_window)
8598{
8599 // Layout whole tab bar if not already done
8600 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8601 if (tab_bar->WantLayout)
8602 {
8603 ImGuiNextItemData backup_next_item_data = g.NextItemData;
8604 TabBarLayout(tab_bar);
8605 g.NextItemData = backup_next_item_data;
8606 }
8607 ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8608 if (window->SkipItems)
8609 return false;
8610
8611 const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
8612 const ImGuiID id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label, docked_window);
8613
8614 // If the user called us with *p_open == false, we early out and don't render.
8615 // We make a call to ItemAdd() so that attempts to use a contextual popup menu with an implicit ID won't use an older ID.
8616 IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(id, label, g.LastItemData.StatusFlags);
8617 if (p_open && !*p_open)
8618 {
8619 ItemAdd(ImRect(), id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
8620 return false;
8621 }
8622
8623 IM_ASSERT(!p_open || !(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button));
8624 IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)) != (ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing)); // Can't use both Leading and Trailing
8625
8626 // Store into ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton, also honor ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton passed by user (although not documented)
8627 if (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton)
8628 p_open = NULL;
8629 else if (p_open == NULL)
8630 flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton;
8631
8632 // Acquire tab data
8633 ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, id);
8634 bool tab_is_new = false;
8635 if (tab == NULL)
8636 {
8637 tab_bar->Tabs.push_back(ImGuiTabItem());
8638 tab = &tab_bar->Tabs.back();
8639 tab->ID = id;
8640 tab_bar->TabsAddedNew = tab_is_new = true;
8641 }
8642 tab_bar->LastTabItemIdx = (ImS16)tab_bar->Tabs.index_from_ptr(tab);
8643
8644 // Calculate tab contents size
8645 ImVec2 size = TabItemCalcSize(label, (p_open != NULL) || (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument));
8646 tab->RequestedWidth = -1.0f;
8647 if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
8648 size.x = tab->RequestedWidth = g.NextItemData.Width;
8649 if (tab_is_new)
8650 tab->Width = ImMax(1.0f, size.x);
8651 tab->ContentWidth = size.x;
8652 tab->BeginOrder = tab_bar->TabsActiveCount++;
8653
8654 const bool tab_bar_appearing = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
8655 const bool tab_bar_focused = (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused) != 0;
8656 const bool tab_appearing = (tab->LastFrameVisible + 1 < g.FrameCount);
8657 const bool tab_just_unsaved = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument);
8658 const bool is_tab_button = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) != 0;
8659 tab->LastFrameVisible = g.FrameCount;
8660 tab->Flags = flags;
8661
8662 // Append name _WITH_ the zero-terminator
8663 if (docked_window != NULL)
8664 {
8665 IM_ASSERT(docked_window == NULL); // master branch only
8666 }
8667 else
8668 {
8669 tab->NameOffset = (ImS32)tab_bar->TabsNames.size();
8670 tab_bar->TabsNames.append(label, label + strlen(label) + 1);
8671 }
8672
8673 // Update selected tab
8674 if (!is_tab_button)
8675 {
8676 if (tab_appearing && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs) && tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId == 0)
8677 if (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0)
8678 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab); // New tabs gets activated
8679 if ((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SetSelected) && (tab_bar->SelectedTabId != id)) // _SetSelected can only be passed on explicit tab bar
8680 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
8681 }
8682
8683 // Lock visibility
8684 // (Note: tab_contents_visible != tab_selected... because CTRL+TAB operations may preview some tabs without selecting them!)
8685 bool tab_contents_visible = (tab_bar->VisibleTabId == id);
8686 if (tab_contents_visible)
8687 tab_bar->VisibleTabWasSubmitted = true;
8688
8689 // On the very first frame of a tab bar we let first tab contents be visible to minimize appearing glitches
8690 if (!tab_contents_visible && tab_bar->SelectedTabId == 0 && tab_bar_appearing)
8691 if (tab_bar->Tabs.Size == 1 && !(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs))
8692 tab_contents_visible = true;
8693
8694 // Note that tab_is_new is not necessarily the same as tab_appearing! When a tab bar stops being submitted
8695 // and then gets submitted again, the tabs will have 'tab_appearing=true' but 'tab_is_new=false'.
8696 if (tab_appearing && (!tab_bar_appearing || tab_is_new))
8697 {
8698 ItemAdd(ImRect(), id, NULL, ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav);
8699 if (is_tab_button)
8700 return false;
8701 return tab_contents_visible;
8702 }
8703
8704 if (tab_bar->SelectedTabId == id)
8705 tab->LastFrameSelected = g.FrameCount;
8706
8707 // Backup current layout position
8708 const ImVec2 backup_main_cursor_pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8709
8710 // Layout
8711 const bool is_central_section = (tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_) == 0;
8712 size.x = tab->Width;
8713 if (is_central_section)
8714 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(IM_TRUNC(tab->Offset - tab_bar->ScrollingAnim), 0.0f);
8715 else
8716 window->DC.CursorPos = tab_bar->BarRect.Min + ImVec2(tab->Offset, 0.0f);
8717 ImVec2 pos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8718 ImRect bb(pos, pos + size);
8719
8720 // We don't have CPU clipping primitives to clip the CloseButton (until it becomes a texture), so need to add an extra draw call (temporary in the case of vertical animation)
8721 const bool want_clip_rect = is_central_section && (bb.Min.x < tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX || bb.Max.x > tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX);
8722 if (want_clip_rect)
8723 PushClipRect(ImVec2(ImMax(bb.Min.x, tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX), bb.Min.y - 1), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, bb.Max.y), true);
8724
8725 ImVec2 backup_cursor_max_pos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
8726 ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), style.FramePadding.y);
8727 window->DC.CursorMaxPos = backup_cursor_max_pos;
8728
8729 if (!ItemAdd(bb, id))
8730 {
8731 if (want_clip_rect)
8732 PopClipRect();
8733 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
8734 return tab_contents_visible;
8735 }
8736
8737 // Click to Select a tab
8738 // Allow the close button to overlap
8739 ImGuiButtonFlags button_flags = ((is_tab_button ? ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease : ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick) | ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap);
8740 if (g.DragDropActive)
8741 button_flags |= ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold;
8742 bool hovered, held;
8743 bool pressed = ButtonBehavior(bb, id, &hovered, &held, button_flags);
8744 if (pressed && !is_tab_button)
8745 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
8746
8747 // Drag and drop: re-order tabs
8748 if (held && !tab_appearing && IsMouseDragging(0))
8749 {
8750 if (!g.DragDropActive && (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable))
8751 {
8752 // While moving a tab it will jump on the other side of the mouse, so we also test for MouseDelta.x
8753 if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x < 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x < bb.Min.x)
8754 {
8755 TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
8756 }
8757 else if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x > 0.0f && g.IO.MousePos.x > bb.Max.x)
8758 {
8759 TabBarQueueReorderFromMousePos(tab_bar, tab, g.IO.MousePos);
8760 }
8761 }
8762 }
8763
8764#if 0
8765 if (hovered && g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer > TOOLTIP_DELAY && bb.GetWidth() < tab->ContentWidth)
8766 {
8767 // Enlarge tab display when hovering
8768 bb.Max.x = bb.Min.x + IM_TRUNC(ImLerp(bb.GetWidth(), tab->ContentWidth, ImSaturate((g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer - 0.40f) * 6.0f)));
8769 display_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8770 TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive));
8771 }
8772#endif
8773
8774 // Render tab shape
8775 ImDrawList* display_draw_list = window->DrawList;
8776 const ImU32 tab_col = GetColorU32((held || hovered) ? ImGuiCol_TabHovered : tab_contents_visible ? (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_TabActive : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocusedActive) : (tab_bar_focused ? ImGuiCol_Tab : ImGuiCol_TabUnfocused));
8777 TabItemBackground(display_draw_list, bb, flags, tab_col);
8778 RenderNavHighlight(bb, id);
8779
8780 // Select with right mouse button. This is so the common idiom for context menu automatically highlight the current widget.
8781 const bool hovered_unblocked = IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup);
8782 if (hovered_unblocked && (IsMouseClicked(1) || IsMouseReleased(1)) && !is_tab_button)
8783 TabBarQueueFocus(tab_bar, tab);
8784
8785 if (tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton)
8786 flags |= ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton;
8787
8788 // Render tab label, process close button
8789 const ImGuiID close_button_id = p_open ? GetIDWithSeed("#CLOSE", NULL, id) : 0;
8790 bool just_closed;
8791 bool text_clipped;
8792 TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(display_draw_list, bb, tab_just_unsaved ? (flags & ~ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) : flags, tab_bar->FramePadding, label, id, close_button_id, tab_contents_visible, &just_closed, &text_clipped);
8793 if (just_closed && p_open != NULL)
8794 {
8795 *p_open = false;
8796 TabBarCloseTab(tab_bar, tab);
8797 }
8798
8799 // Restore main window position so user can draw there
8800 if (want_clip_rect)
8801 PopClipRect();
8802 window->DC.CursorPos = backup_main_cursor_pos;
8803
8804 // Tooltip
8805 // (Won't work over the close button because ItemOverlap systems messes up with HoveredIdTimer-> seems ok)
8806 // (We test IsItemHovered() to discard e.g. when another item is active or drag and drop over the tab bar, which g.HoveredId ignores)
8807 // FIXME: This is a mess.
8808 // FIXME: We may want disabled tab to still display the tooltip?
8809 if (text_clipped && g.HoveredId == id && !held)
8810 if (!(tab_bar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoTooltip) && !(tab->Flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip))
8811 SetItemTooltip("%.*s", (int)(FindRenderedTextEnd(label) - label), label);
8812
8813 IM_ASSERT(!is_tab_button || !(tab_bar->SelectedTabId == tab->ID && is_tab_button)); // TabItemButton should not be selected
8814 if (is_tab_button)
8815 return pressed;
8816 return tab_contents_visible;
8817}
8818
8819// [Public] This is call is 100% optional but it allows to remove some one-frame glitches when a tab has been unexpectedly removed.
8820// To use it to need to call the function SetTabItemClosed() between BeginTabBar() and EndTabBar().
8821// Tabs closed by the close button will automatically be flagged to avoid this issue.
8822void ImGui::SetTabItemClosed(const char* label)
8823{
8824 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8825 bool is_within_manual_tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar && !(g.CurrentTabBar->Flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode);
8826 if (is_within_manual_tab_bar)
8827 {
8828 ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = g.CurrentTabBar;
8829 ImGuiID tab_id = TabBarCalcTabID(tab_bar, label, NULL);
8830 if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, tab_id))
8831 tab->WantClose = true; // Will be processed by next call to TabBarLayout()
8832 }
8833}
8834
8835ImVec2 ImGui::TabItemCalcSize(const char* label, bool has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker)
8836{
8837 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8838 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8839 ImVec2 size = ImVec2(label_size.x + g.Style.FramePadding.x, label_size.y + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
8840 if (has_close_button_or_unsaved_marker)
8841 size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + (g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x + g.FontSize); // We use Y intentionally to fit the close button circle.
8842 else
8843 size.x += g.Style.FramePadding.x + 1.0f;
8844 return ImVec2(ImMin(size.x, TabBarCalcMaxTabWidth()), size.y);
8845}
8846
8847ImVec2 ImGui::TabItemCalcSize(ImGuiWindow*)
8848{
8849 IM_ASSERT(0); // This function exists to facilitate merge with 'docking' branch.
8850 return ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8851}
8852
8853void ImGui::TabItemBackground(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImRect& bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImU32 col)
8854{
8855 // While rendering tabs, we trim 1 pixel off the top of our bounding box so they can fit within a regular frame height while looking "detached" from it.
8856 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8857 const float width = bb.GetWidth();
8858 IM_UNUSED(flags);
8859 IM_ASSERT(width > 0.0f);
8860 const float rounding = ImMax(0.0f, ImMin((flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button) ? g.Style.FrameRounding : g.Style.TabRounding, width * 0.5f - 1.0f));
8861 const float y1 = bb.Min.y + 1.0f;
8862 const float y2 = bb.Max.y - g.Style.TabBarBorderSize;
8863 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x, y2));
8864 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 6, 9);
8865 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding, y1 + rounding), rounding, 9, 12);
8866 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x, y2));
8867 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
8868 if (g.Style.TabBorderSize > 0.0f)
8869 {
8870 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + 0.5f, y2));
8871 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Min.x + rounding + 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 6, 9);
8872 draw_list->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - rounding - 0.5f, y1 + rounding + 0.5f), rounding, 9, 12);
8873 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(bb.Max.x - 0.5f, y2));
8874 draw_list->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), 0, g.Style.TabBorderSize);
8875 }
8876}
8877
8878// Render text label (with custom clipping) + Unsaved Document marker + Close Button logic
8879// We tend to lock style.FramePadding for a given tab-bar, hence the 'frame_padding' parameter.
8880void ImGui::TabItemLabelAndCloseButton(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImRect& bb, ImGuiTabItemFlags flags, ImVec2 frame_padding, const char* label, ImGuiID tab_id, ImGuiID close_button_id, bool is_contents_visible, bool* out_just_closed, bool* out_text_clipped)
8881{
8882 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8883 ImVec2 label_size = CalcTextSize(label, NULL, true);
8884
8885 if (out_just_closed)
8886 *out_just_closed = false;
8887 if (out_text_clipped)
8888 *out_text_clipped = false;
8889
8890 if (bb.GetWidth() <= 1.0f)
8891 return;
8892
8893 // In Style V2 we'll have full override of all colors per state (e.g. focused, selected)
8894 // But right now if you want to alter text color of tabs this is what you need to do.
8895#if 0
8896 const float backup_alpha = g.Style.Alpha;
8897 if (!is_contents_visible)
8898 g.Style.Alpha *= 0.7f;
8899#endif
8900
8901 // Render text label (with clipping + alpha gradient) + unsaved marker
8902 ImRect text_pixel_clip_bb(bb.Min.x + frame_padding.x, bb.Min.y + frame_padding.y, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x, bb.Max.y);
8903 ImRect text_ellipsis_clip_bb = text_pixel_clip_bb;
8904
8905 // Return clipped state ignoring the close button
8906 if (out_text_clipped)
8907 {
8908 *out_text_clipped = (text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min.x + label_size.x) > text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x;
8909 //draw_list->AddCircle(text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, 3.0f, *out_text_clipped ? IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255) : IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
8910 }
8911
8912 const float button_sz = g.FontSize;
8913 const ImVec2 button_pos(ImMax(bb.Min.x, bb.Max.x - frame_padding.x - button_sz), bb.Min.y + frame_padding.y);
8914
8915 // Close Button & Unsaved Marker
8916 // We are relying on a subtle and confusing distinction between 'hovered' and 'g.HoveredId' which happens because we are using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlapMode + SetItemAllowOverlap()
8917 // 'hovered' will be true when hovering the Tab but NOT when hovering the close button
8918 // 'g.HoveredId==id' will be true when hovering the Tab including when hovering the close button
8919 // 'g.ActiveId==close_button_id' will be true when we are holding on the close button, in which case both hovered booleans are false
8920 bool close_button_pressed = false;
8921 bool close_button_visible = false;
8922 if (close_button_id != 0)
8923 if (is_contents_visible || bb.GetWidth() >= ImMax(button_sz, g.Style.TabMinWidthForCloseButton))
8924 if (g.HoveredId == tab_id || g.HoveredId == close_button_id || g.ActiveId == tab_id || g.ActiveId == close_button_id)
8925 close_button_visible = true;
8926 bool unsaved_marker_visible = (flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_UnsavedDocument) != 0 && (button_pos.x + button_sz <= bb.Max.x);
8927
8928 if (close_button_visible)
8929 {
8930 ImGuiLastItemData last_item_backup = g.LastItemData;
8931 if (CloseButton(close_button_id, button_pos))
8932 close_button_pressed = true;
8933 g.LastItemData = last_item_backup;
8934
8935 // Close with middle mouse button
8936 if (!(flags & ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton) && IsMouseClicked(2))
8937 close_button_pressed = true;
8938 }
8939 else if (unsaved_marker_visible)
8940 {
8941 const ImRect bullet_bb(button_pos, button_pos + ImVec2(button_sz, button_sz));
8942 RenderBullet(draw_list, bullet_bb.GetCenter(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
8943 }
8944
8945 // This is all rather complicated
8946 // (the main idea is that because the close button only appears on hover, we don't want it to alter the ellipsis position)
8947 // FIXME: if FramePadding is noticeably large, ellipsis_max_x will be wrong here (e.g. #3497), maybe for consistency that parameter of RenderTextEllipsis() shouldn't exist..
8948 float ellipsis_max_x = close_button_visible ? text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x : bb.Max.x - 1.0f;
8949 if (close_button_visible || unsaved_marker_visible)
8950 {
8951 text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x -= close_button_visible ? (button_sz) : (button_sz * 0.80f);
8952 text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max.x -= unsaved_marker_visible ? (button_sz * 0.80f) : 0.0f;
8953 ellipsis_max_x = text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x;
8954 }
8955 RenderTextEllipsis(draw_list, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Min, text_ellipsis_clip_bb.Max, text_pixel_clip_bb.Max.x, ellipsis_max_x, label, NULL, &label_size);
8956
8957#if 0
8958 if (!is_contents_visible)
8959 g.Style.Alpha = backup_alpha;
8960#endif
8961
8962 if (out_just_closed)
8963 *out_just_closed = close_button_pressed;
8964}
8965
8966
8967#endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE

ImGuiContext * GImGui

ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton
@ ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton
Definition imgui.h:1172

@ ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton
Definition imgui.h:1171
ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_
@ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_
Definition imgui.h:1178
ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_
@ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_
